loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati M. is a 43 year old unmarried woman who lives in Dhalko, Kathmandu. She lives with her father, mother and one brother. Her father is a farmer and her brother works at the computer institute. 
Sarswati M. is a tailor in Dhalko. She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. She took 6 months of training for tailoring work. She prefers to make ladies clothing like blouses, Kurta-Sulwar, etc. She also makes school uniforms for boys and girls. Due to lack of capital, she cannot expand her business.  She is requesting a $150 loan to buy raw materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Dilbarnisso.

texts.ru:
Dilbarnisso S. lives with her family in Yavan, Tajikistan. Dilbarnisso is married with 3 children. She is a housewife and helps her husband to earn money to support their family. Dilbarnisso has a small piece of land where she grows vegetables. She sells the crops and uses the profits for her household needs. She wants to get a loan to buy some fertilizer. She is planning to pay the loan back in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Шамсиддинова Дилбарниссо жительница города Яван . Живет со своей семьей . Она замужем и имеет 3 детей.домохозяйка . но помогает своему мужу зарабатывать деньги. Имеет небольшой участок земли . Засеивает его овощами . Получаемый урожай продает , а полученные деньги испаользует для хозяйства. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить удобрения . Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 39-year-old trader. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She has sold used clothes at the Koforidua market of Ghana for the past twelve years. With this business, she has been able to support one of children to complete senior high school.

With low capital, she is not able to buy larger bale quantities of used clothes to sell. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes, with variety, to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

She is a member of the group called ‘Esther Trust Group’. In this group, members provide one another social collateral to access loan funds and peer pressure to repay the loan. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay. If one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Hanka

texts.en:
Hanka is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Tesanj in northern Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and her husband is currently employed. Hanka works as a tailor, repairing and altering clothes and also making new clothes that she sells to neighbors and around town. She has been in business for a while now, working mostly from home, and in a good month can earn up to 700 KM (US$550) for her work.

It is Hanka's plan to take this 1500 KM (US$1150) loan from Zene za Zene to buy material and other tailoring supplies for her business. Hanka wants to experiment with buying some new types of cloth and thread that she can use to make outfits, and she hopes these will be received well by her customers.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring supplies

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Xuân  tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 2007. Ngoài chăn nuôi và trồng trọt  gia đình có nghề phụ làm các mặt hàng sắt như cửa sắt  khung nhôm kính... phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân trong huyện.  Chồng chị là một công nhân lành nghề nên các sản phẩm do gia đình anh chị làm ra đều có chất lượng tốt. Không những thế giá cả của các mặt hàng cũng rất hợp lý vì thế gia đình chị ngày càng nhận được nhiều đơn đặt hàng của khách hàng. Với mức thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng từ công việc làm và  kinh doanh các sản phẩm bằng sắt kinh tế gia đình chị  ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua sắt về sản xuất các sản phẩm bán cho người dân địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân joined the Fund in 2007. Besides breeding and farming, the family also produces of various iron articles like forged doors or aluminium framed windows, satisfying the local demand from the district. Her husband is a qualified worker and therefore the family's production is of consistent, high quality. Moreover, the pricing is very reasonable and as a result, the family is receiving an increasing number of order requests from customers. With a level of income of 4.500.000đ per month from their occupation and the production of iron articles, the family's economy is expanding. For the next round, she would like to borrow 9.000.000đ to buy iron to produce articles and sell to customers in the region.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles

texts.es: Reyna tiene 36 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo Eduardo. Tuvieron tres hijos, pero uno de ellos ya está casado. Sus otros dos hijos tienen 8 y 10 años de edad y actualmente cursan la educación primaria. Reyna trabaja en una zona franca, oficio en el cual devenga un bajo salario, pero su marido la apoya en los gastos familiares. Debido a los bajos ingresos de la familia no han podido mejorar su vivienda, es por eso que están en la necesidad de un préstamo. El techo de su vivienda está en muy mal estado y las lluvias les está afectando su vivienda. Con el préstamo comprará láminas de zinc para cambiarlas y así poder ir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Reyna is 36 years old. She lives in the town of Ticuatepe with her husband Eduardo. They have three children, one of whom is married. Their two other children are 8 and 10 years old and are currently in grade school. Reyna works in a free trade area, where she earns a small salary. Nevertheless, her husband helps cover household costs. Because of the family's small earnings, they haven't been able to improve their home. For this reason, they find themselves needing a loan. The roof of their house is in very bad condition -- so much so that rain is damaging the house. They will use the loan to purchase roof sheeting made of zinc to replace the old sheeting and, in this way, improve their house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair roof of their house

loans.name: I Wayan Buda

texts.id: Dari pinjaman tahap pertama I Wayan Buda Memperoleh keuntungan yang cukup lumayan yaitu Rp. 1.800.000.- / 3 bln setelah di potong biaya- biaya perawatan tanaman dan ongkos kerja. Hasil yang cukup untuk biaya hidup 3 orang yaitu bersama istri dan seorang anaknya yang belum menikah.n Menanam kacang panjang dilakukan I Wayan Buda pada saat musim kemarau di saat sawah miliknya tak bisa di tanami padi. Jadi selang waktu menunggu musim hujan tiba inilah tanaman kacang panjang menjadi tanaman yang bisa menghasilkan pendapatan untuk keluarga. Dengan sumber air dari sumur bor dan mesin pompa air yang dibeli pada pinjaman pertama sangat membantu proses penyiraman kebun sayur milik  I Wayan Buda. nSaat ini kebun sayur I Wayan Buda telah hampir selesai panen dan telah mulai persiapan penanaman tanaman baru lagi. Untuk itu I Wayan Buda Masih memerlukan pinjaman lagi untuk tahap yang ke dua yang akan di pergunakan lagi untuk biaya pengolahan tanah , beli bibit, pupuk dan juga sebuah selang air untuk penyiraman. Untuk menunjang usahanya, I Wayan Buda bergabung dengan program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. n            Dengan memiliki pompa air ini dalam  setahun Wayan Buda bisa melakukan proses penanaman kacang panjang 2 kali dan Wayan Buda sangat optimis hasil panennya kedepan akan lebih baik . nn
texts.en:
I Wayan Buda is a long bean farmer. He participated in DINARI foundation loan program in the last farming season. He can earned a net income of IDR 1.8 million (around USD 190) after a 3 month farming period. This income is used to finance his family of 3 (his wife and one kid) daily needs.

He wants to participate in the 6 month DINARI foundation program to enable him to buy seeds, fertilizer, and also water pump and water hose to enhance the irrigation to his farm. With this he is hoping to get a better harvest result.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer (Membeli bibit, anti hama dan ongkos tenaga kerja)

loans.name: Nor Mohammad

texts.en:
Nor Mohammad is married and lives in his nuclear family. He works in agriculture. He has been working here for more than 6 years because the business was left to him by his father. After the death of his father, he took responsibility for his family and he continued the business. Therefore he needs to expand his business.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for a term of 18 months to complete his stock and buy more seeds for his land so that he can plant all his lands and make a good profit to send wheat to be sold at the bazaar and continue his business with more success and make a better future for his family.

Nor Mohammad is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to say that he is going to be improving his business and make a better commerce in the future. He would like to thank lenders around the world for supporting this process of small loans in his country.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, etc. for his land

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosalina R. T. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos sus edades son un niño de 3 años y cursa el 1 nivel de preescolar y un niño de 9 meses, su esposo labora en salón de belleza, sus deseos son de prosperar en el negocio que tiene actualmente ya que este es el que le ha ayudado a salir adelante por lo que le proporcionado que sus hijos puedan estudiar, sus propósitos son de alcanzar la calidad en su negocio ya que existe mucha demanda de este tipo de negocio en el mercado por lo que su interés seria predominar fuertemente y los beneficios que obtendría de esto será tener su casa propia.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es un salón de belleza, la ubicación de su negocio es de hospital de emergencia 75 varas arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, ella inicia este negocio en la casa de habitación de su Mama ya que su hermana tenia el negocio a su cargo por lo que cuando su hermana decide marcharse a otro país ella decide estudiar belleza e invertir en este negocio y es así como lo consigue, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de productos como: cremas para alisar el cabello, tintes, peroxido y tratamientos ya que sus clientes exigen la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosalina R. T. is 34 year old, married, and has two children, a 3-year-old son in his first year of pre-school and a nine-month-old boy. Her husband works in the beauty salon. Rosalina wishes to make her current business profitable, as it has helped her to prosper, and permitted her son to attend school. She strives for quality in her endeavors because the demand in the marketplace for this type of business is high. Rosalina is interested in making a good showing and to put her proceeds towards the purchase of her own home. The economic activity to which she devotes her efforts is a beauty salon located in an emergency hospital 75 yards away. She has had this business for ten years, starting out in her mother’s house, taking over from her sister who emigrated to another country. Rosalina decided to go to beauty school and invest in this business and that is how she got to where she is today. Since her customers demand quality products, the loan is for working capital intended for the purchase of products such as anti-frizz conditioners, hair dyes, peroxide and conditioners.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Oem Y., 58, lives Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to grow crops, rice and vegetables, a skill she has learned from her grandmother. She plants twice a year. Her husband is living at home and currently works with her. She is a mother of three children; three of them are single. To help a little with the family's expenses, one of her single sons is employed as a car repairer in Phnom Penh City.

Y. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. To earn additional income, she needs a loan as capital to purchase cashews and re-sell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashews

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром молодой человек 30 лет , женат имеет одного ребёнка,крутой бизнесмен.Сам привозит товар и реализует его на рынке Худжанда.В его ассортимент входят продукты питания такие как сахар,сладкие изделия , соль печенье и.т.д.Его жена занимается продажей женской одежды на вещевом рынке.Бахром для увеличения товарооборота хочет взять кредит.
texts.en:
Bahrom, 30, is married and has one child. Bahrom is a successful businessman. He produces many of the products he sells at the Khudzhand market including sweets, cookies, etc. His wife sells clothing for women. Bahrom will use this loan to increase the assortment of goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Lidia Wualberta

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Lidia es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Lidia tiene un puesto en la galería Mayorista, local es alquilado, en donde vende ropa de adultos, niños, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Lidia junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante en una calle concurrida de la ciudad.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones.
Los sueños de Lidia son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the community bank “Despertar” (wake up). She is 30 years old, married with 3 children. She rents a booth at the wholesale market where she sells children’s and adult’s clothing that she purchases in Lima. Lidia and her husband also have a restaurant on a busy street in their city. She is asking for a loan of 2000 soles that she will invest in purchasing pants for resale. Lidia’s dreams are to buy some land to build her house and to offer more products in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants for resale

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Mrs. Ath P. is a villager in Trapaing Chambork village in Takeo province. She is a chicken-seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens to sell and earn more profit to support her family, Her husband, Mr. Pul Nget, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Ath P. is 60 years old and the mother of six children; two are construction workers, one sells groceries and the others attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small food-items shop and has sold bites in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to Takrima group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for the expansion of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 28, married, and has two children: ages 8 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more food items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: Doña Argentina Azucena V., reside en un barrio de la capital Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua,  mujer trabajadora que desde horas temprana sale a ofrecer su acarreo en los diferentes mercado. El medio que usa es un carretón con caballos, lleva muchos años en el negocio y ha sido el sustento para su familia, tiene 46 años de edad, con seis hijos cuatro mayores y dos menores que estudian. Este es su octavo crédito en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo que se le ha brindado con este préstamo va a comprar caballo chucaros para domesticarlo y luego venderlos a buen precio. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a  su casa, ampliar el negocio de acarreo.
texts.en:
Doña Argentina Azucena V. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of the capital city of Manaugua. She is an industrious women who goes out in the early morning to offer her transport services in the various markets. She uses a large horse-drawn wagon for this. She's been engaged in this business for many years and it has sustained her family. She is 46 years of age with six children, four adults and two younger ones who are still in school. This is her eighth loan with AFODENIC and she is grateful for the assistance which they have provided. With this loan she is going to buy untamed horses in order to domesticate them and later sell them for a good price. Her plans are to be able to make improvements to her house and to build up her transport business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wild horses.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Холматова Гульсара- женщина 43 лет , мать троих детей. Проживает и работает в Худжанде. Её муж работает в мастером по ремонту автомашин. Сама Гульсара занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей на счёт продажи помогает её муж. Узнав от соседей, Гульсара решила получить кредит и увеличить свой бизнес. Хочет купить ещё пару голов коров, которые дают молоко. Для чего Гульсара и обратилась в Микроинвест. На снимке Гульсара  кормит баранов.
texts.en:
Gulsara K., 43, mother of 3, lives and works in Khujand. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Gulsara is a cattle farmer. Having learned from her neighbors about MicroInvest, Gulsara decided to apply for a loan to expand her business. She plans to use the money to purchase a pair of milk cows.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk cows

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de ataúdes que manda a elaborar con los carpinteros y ella realiza los acabados de tapizado y pintado, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes provincias.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ataúdes en blanco.
Maria sueña con tener un negocio estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Morenita II. Maria lives with her partner, is 42 years old, and has 4 children. Maria and her husband dedicate themselves to the sale of coffins that are ordered from carpenters, and she carries out the finishing touches by upholstering and painting them. They carry out their sales in different provinces. Maria needs a loan of 900 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of blank coffins. Maria dreams of having a stable business, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blank coffins.

loans.name: Ameudullah

texts.en: Ameudullah is the son of B. K.. Married with two children, he lives in Kabul Afghanistan where he is a farmer very interested in agriculture.  Everyday he wakes up early and starts his work on his land. He is requesting a loan of 30000 Afghani to buy more and different kinds of seeds for growing. He would like to be a really successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine Z. is from the village of Purok 9B, Zone 3, Kiwalan Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Josephine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "GTY" products or Ready to Wear products in the local community. Josephine is just starting this business. She also has a sideline business; she peddles dried fish and longganisa to her established customers.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Purok 9B, Zone 3, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del

loans.name: Humphrey Amonde

texts.en:
Humphrey owns a small shop called 'Stebats', which is a combination of his wife, Stella’s, name and his nickname, 'Batson.' His stall is located in a market north of Kisumu, and he sells omena, the small dried fish that come from Lake Victoria. He sells to retailers and to customers directly. Humphrey has been married for two years, and he has a young child. Sometimes when the full moon is out, the fish are scarce, and the price to buy them goes up. With his loan, Humphrey would like to buy a large quanitity of omena so that he can better ride out the ups and downs of the market.

Humphrey is also a minister and community health worker in his neighborhood of Nyamasaria. He is no longer a full-time minister, but is still very active in his church. He says that he loves business as it comes very naturally to him. As a community health worker with Kiva partner K-MET, Humphrey visits his neighbors who are sick, refers them to doctors, brings them basic supplies, and educates them on best practice in health-related issues.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of fish

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es casado con la Sra. Sandra. Tienen dos hijos de 19 y 10 años respectivamente. Poseen un bien inmueble propio en el cual se encuentra funcionando el negocio. Oscar se dedica a prestar sus servicios  de cerrajería, bicicleteria y gomeria,  la conyugue atiende el negocio de comida el cual está instalado en su domicilio, ambos atienden sus negocios hace 19 años aproximadamente. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad, experiencia, calidad,   rapidez e higiene en el servicio, les ha permitido mantener buena clientela, la cual demanda permanentemente sus servicios. El destino del crédito es para incrementar el capital de operaciones del negocio. Quinto préstamo  al que accede Oscar, con excelente comportamiento y puntualidad en sus pagos.  No registra atrasos ni mora en ninguna de sus cuotas.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES

loans.name: Mujeres Liberadas Group

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Andrea J. H. (far right in pink) is the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope Mujeres Liberadas (Freed Women). She lives in Los Alcarrizos, which is a city about one hour northeast of the capital, Santo Domingo. For the past three years, Andrea has sold various items such as clothing and underwear. With her first microfinance loan she intends to buy 20 bed sheets, 20 collared shirts, and 12 pairs of high heels, which she predicts will bring in a profit that will approximately match the loan she’s receiving. One of the benefits of microfinance is that the initial investment is replicated, because loan recipients such as Andrea reinvest their profits in their business. One point that Esperanza International emphasizes is that profits need to be used to better the family or the business, and Andrea certainly understands this fact. 

One of Andrea’s personal goals is to improve her life each and every day. With profits from her business, Andrea intends to start saving and invest in her children’s education. She has three children (13, 10, 9) and is pregnant with her fourth child who is due in December. While Andrea has not finished high school, she hopes to return to school and continue her education. Above everything else, Andrea looks forward to a better future.

On behalf of Andrea, the Bank of Hope Mujeres Liberadas, and the microfinance institute Esperanza International (one of Kiva's field partners), thank you for providing opportunities for those who need them most.

loans.use: 20 bed sheets, 20 collared shirts, and 12 pairs of high heels

loans.name: Genoveva Nathesda

texts.es: Doña Genoveva se dedica a la compra por mayor D. chompas ecuatorianas las cuales las distribuye en las oficinas a pagos, la cliente anteriormente ya trabajo en uno D. los Bancos D. Emprendimiento en el que no tuvo ningún tipo D. dificultad en la cancelación D. las cuotas.  La señora tiene estabilidad domiciliaria ya que vive en casa familiar D. forma independiente, comparte su departamento con sus dos hijos los cuales tiene independencia económica y colaboran con los gastos del hogar.  El crédito será destinado en la compra D. mercadería que se encuentra en oferta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Genoveva is dedicated to buying Ecuadorian sweaters in the wholesale and distributing them for a profit.The client has worked previously with one of the “Bancos D. Emprendimiento” (entrepreneurship banks) and had no difficulty liquidating her debts. She has a fixed residence and lives independently in a family house. She shares her apartment with her two sons, who are financially independent and contribute to the household expenses. The loan will be used to buy merchandise that is on sale.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will be used to buy merchandise

loans.name: Charles' Group

texts.en:
Charles S. is 27 years old and the leader of a lending group in Mukono. He is a single man with no wife or children of his own.

Charles has worked as a motorcyclist in Namugongo/Mbalwa for three years and is able to make 35,000/= in profits per week. He says that it’s a good business except at times his bosses and his regular customers take a long time to pay him, which affects his cash flow. Despite this, Charles makes sure that he is always neat and clean at work and handles his customers professionally.

Charles dreams of buying his own motorcycle, as well as building his own home, before he even thinks of marrying and having children because he would want them to have a bright future. This is his first loan application with the group and he believes it will enable him to repair his motorcycle, since it was loaned to him on the condition that in the event of any mechanical problems, he would cover the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle for efficiency

loans.name: Laraba

texts.en: Laraba is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells colorful sarongs at various prices. This is the high season for the sales of sarongs, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs a loan of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (20201070027) is a 39 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. is the leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn nhóm 09 (9).

N. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, N. works providing construction services to local community members.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 3,808,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by N. from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201070028) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Hà Thị B. (20201070029) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070030) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070031) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

N. Nguyễn Thị (20201070027) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn nhóm 09 (9).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ xây dựng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND.  N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.808.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201070028) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Hà Thị B. (20201070029) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070030) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070031) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: A. Christine est née le 12 Novembre 1979. C'est une célibataire sans enfant, qui vit depuis trois ans au quartier Houéyiho à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Christine a été à l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Christine vit seule, et pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle vend divers articles (savons, omo, lait, allumettes, bougies, huile d'arachide, etc.) et aussi des paires de chaussures à son domicile. Christine a déjà 4 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine. Christine fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Christine a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour augmenter son capital et son étalage afin de mieux rentabiliser son activité, Christine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Christine was born on November 12, 1979. She is unmarried and without children and has been living for three years in the Houéyiho district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has completed secondary school. She lives alone, and to support herself, she sells a variety of goods (soaps, Omo, milk, matches, candles, peanut oil, etc.) and also shoes, out of her home. Christine already has four years of experience in this domain. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She obtained an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid. To augment her capital and her display of goods, so as to make her business more profitable, she's requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and various goods (soaps, canned foods

loans.name: Fatmata N.

texts.en:
This is Fatmata N. T.. She is 40 years old, married, and is from Tombo town in Waterloo. She has two children: one girl and one boy.

Fatmata has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Fatmata has a shop in Tombo town where she sells building materials. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional inventory for sale. With her new loan, she hopes to add more of the same building goods to her business.

If she is able to make an increased profit with the help of her latest loan, Fatmata plans to use materials from her store to build a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials for sale

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en: Rosefina D. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two children: one adult and one student. Rosefina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling surplus shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Rosefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosefina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to support the school expenditures of her student child. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Than

texts.en: C., age 34, is a rice farmer and married mother caring for three young children, who are studying at the secondary school. In addition, for extra income, C. also goes to fish with her husband in and around the river. C. planted her rice months ago but the crop is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield. (C. was unavailable when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Salmon

texts.ru: Алимов Салмон проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Алимов Салмон имеет высшее образование по специальности "Педагог". Растениеводством занимается более 5 лет. Алимов Салмон сажает картошку и собирая вывозит на рынок. В этом ему помогают родственники. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
A. Salmon lives in the Shahrituz region. He's thirty-four years old, married and has five children. A. has a university degree qualifying him as a teacher. He has grown potatoes for more than five years. Later, with then help of his family, he sells it at the market. He's asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora F. is from the village of Malibangcao in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Flora is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Flora plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Flora is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Flora's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aminata Tiguidanké

texts.fr: Aminata Tiguidanké DIALO est une femme de 37 ans, elle mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 2003, elle a 13 cycle d'existence dans ledit Banc Villageois. Elle a une boutique à domicile et son prêt lui permet de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises de payer son électricité et de payer également les frais de transport de sa marchandise. Avec ses bénéfices elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de leur famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Aminata Tiguidanke Dialo is a 37-year-old married mother of 6. She has been a member of the community bank Velingara Foulbe since 2003. She runs a store from her house, and the loan allows her to better restock her merchandise, pay for her electricity, as well as pay for the shipment of her products. With the profits made, she is able to help her husband take care of the family expenses, as well as take care of her individual needs.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Mirtha Gladys

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector Posope Alto del distrito de Patapo, una zona conocida por ser netamente productora de caña de azúcar y que se encuentra ubicado a treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Debido a que la mayoría de pobladores de la zona son trabajadores dependientes de la empresa agroindustrial del lugar, su negocio de venta de ropa la realiza principalmente al crédito para ser cobrado quincenalmente (en algunos casos mensualmente). En el caso de la venta de cosméticos, ésta se hace a través de catálogos y directamente de su stock de mercadería.

Su negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su hogar, su esposo trabaja como chofer de combi de la ruta Pátapo – Chiclayo. Con el dinero que ambos perciben, salen adelante y actualmente se encuentran ahorrando dinero para poder adquirir su casa propia.

Mirtha desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 31 year old mother who lives with her husband and young son in the home of her parents, which is located in the area of Posope Alto in the District of Patapo. This region is located 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo and distinctly known for its sugar cane production.

Mirtha has been selling clothing and cosmetics for two years. Since most of the local residents are workers who are dependent on the agro-industrial businesses in the area, her clothing sales are made on credit and she collects payments biweekly (and sometimes monthly). With her cosmetics sales, her customers order through catalogs or buy directly from her stock of merchandise.

Her business has been a great help to her household finances. Her husband works as a driver of a van that travels along the route between Pátapo and Chiclayo. With the money they both earn, Mirtha and her husband are able to get ahead and are now saving money so that they can acquire their own home.

Mirtha wants to expand her business by purchasing more products. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 2000 PEN. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances have great respect for her and consider her to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi M. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 44 yeras old, married and blessed with 4 school-aged children. She cultivates and selling farm products.  Naomi has been in business for 15 years and generate a monthly net income of 4,000 to support her family.

In 2004, Naomi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naomi is requesting a new loan of 25,000.00 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Naomi from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
---------------------------------
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farm.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap Y. (in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Khoem, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have two young sons.

The couple has been farming for more than ten years; they grow rice and green beans on their farmland in the village. The couple hopes to continue increasing their productivity; farming is the main business to support their standard of living. Hence Sopheap is requesting her second loan of $500 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: For seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Marilou is single. She owns and operates a specialized retail store selling snacks and other delicacies such as biko, bingka, puto (varieties of rice cake), etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children. He sells cosmetics for a living. He has been involved in the business for eight years. He also sells clothes and fabrics to tailors. 

He is a new member of a Faulu Kenya group called Millenium Self-Help Group. He joined this group to access financial support easily from Faulu Kenya.  He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more cosmetics. He hopes to become a major distributor of cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie T. is from the village of Christine, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Elvie is married and has three infant children. 

To make a living, Elvie owns a general store which primarily sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elvie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elvie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Christine Village, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabe

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. I. is 24 years old. She is single and has one child, aged three years old, whom she hopes to provide with a quality education. Her business is located at a busy market area in Kakamega. She sells second-hand clothes to the local people. She says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge she has is that her debtors fail to keep the promise to pay their debts as per their agreements, therefore bringing down her sales. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open a boutique to sell more and make more income. She describes herself as hardworking, humble and honest.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma A., from the village of Bagacay, is the 27-year-old group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each group member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elma, who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 5,000.00 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Elma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria T. A. tiene 24 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene un niño de 18 meses.

Flor es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Flor trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz de verano. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ureas, semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a trabajar.Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Enfrenta desafíos con su bebe que se enferma mucho y con enfermedades en los cultivos. 

Le gusta escuchar música de Ecuador en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Flor Maria T. A. is twenty-four years old and lives with her partner in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has an eighteen month old son. Flor is a member of the communal bank "Recinto San Ramon" which is located in Nuevo San Ramon, twelve kilometers from Ventanas. The communal bank has twenty members who all work in six month farming cycles. This is the first loan they are taking out. Flor is a farmer who grows corn and summer rice. She sells her crops in Ventanas every six months. She is taking out a loan to buy seeds, nitrogen, and fertilizers. Flor thinks that this loan will help her with her work. She dreams of having her own home. She faces many challenges -- her baby gets sick a lot and her crops are affected by pests.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, nitrogen and other fertalizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as zinc to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot T., 31, has a business selling brooms at the local market of her Takeo province and earns approximately US$1 a day. Her husband, pictured here, stays at home making brooms. The brooms are made from a type of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife know how to make brooms, having learned from their neighbors, and began their business in 2000. The couple have two children. Sot T. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike to transport brooms to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza P. is from the village of Northern Poblacion, Calamba, MIsamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, Silver Swan products, candies and powdered soap in the local community. Liza has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $233 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Liza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk C. is 43 years old and sells fruit in Takeo province. Her business has been around for about nine years and she makes US$ 15 every day in revenue. She is a widow with four children; two are in school and the other two are employed. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to invest in her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruit to sell.

loans.use: To invest into her own fruit business

loans.name: Felizarda

texts.pt:
FELIZARDA M. nasceu em Jogo um dos distritos de Morrubene, província de Inhambane, a sul de Moçambique. Cresceu e fez o se u ensino primário na mesma província. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo com o seu marido quando este foi transferido. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 5 anos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu esposo que já era cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00 para comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Para o futuro pretende solicitar novos créditos uma vez que ira precisar de montar cozinha e casa de banho melhorando as condições de sua residência.
texts.en:
Felizarda was born in Jogo, one of the districts of Morrubene in the Inhambane Province, South Mozambique. She grew up and went to elementary school in that same Province. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. 

She left Inhambane to go to Maputo with her husband when he was transferred. She has had her own business for more than 5 years. She makes around 4,000 meticais per month which goes towards household expenses and bank savings. 

She has never had loans with other banks. She came to know about Hluvuku through her husband who was already a partner. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais. It will be used to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, doors and others) to continue construction of her house. 

She intends to request more loans in the future since she wants to build her kitchen and bathroom to improve her house's conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, doors and others)

loans.name: Martha Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Martha Lourdes P. L., tiene la edad de 48 años habitante del Barrio San Pedro, es madre soltera de un 1 hijo mayor de edad, casado y administrador de su propio negocio, ella es agricultora desde hace mas de 20 años, se ha enfrentado en su negocio a diversos problemas de sequia y plagas, que disminuyen la producción afectándole a su economía domestica, fue su padre quien le heredo unas tierras, su esposo la abandono hace muchos años atrás y no cuenta con nadie que le brinde una apoyo, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que favorezcan los terrenos y a corto plazo la recuperación de la inversión y la posibilidad de invertir en nuevas fuentes de trabajo e ingreso que mejoren la calidad de vida de ella y por ende la de su único hijo y su descendencia.
texts.en: Mrs. Martha Lourdes P. L. is 48 years old and lives in Barrio San Pedro. She is a single mother of one grown son, who is married and is the manager of his own business. She has been in the agriculture business for more than 20 years. She has been facing various problems in her business including drought and plagues that have reduced her production affecting her financially. She inherited the land from her father. Her husband abandoned her many years ago and she doesn't have anyone who can help her. For now she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and agricultural supplies that suit the lands. In a short time the recovery from the investment and the possibility to invest in new areas of work and income will improve her quality of life and therefore of her only son and his kids.

loans.use: To maintain plant health.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa C. A. tiene 33 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Maria pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa  y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y dar la educación a los hijos.
Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa C. A. is 33 years old.  She is married, and she lives with her husband and their children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  She has four children.

Maria belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba Communal Bank, which is half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that works in agriculture and farming livestock such as dairy cows and pigs. The group has 20 members.

Maria grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes.  She also raises dairy cows.  She buys them in Guaranda, and she sells them in the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her corn, wheat, bean, and potato crops.  She also wants the loan to buy animals to fatten and later sell.  The the loan will help her provide her family with the necessities.  

Her dream is to buy a house and to educate her children.

She likes to listen to music.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her corn, wheat, bean, and potato crops and to buy animals to fatten and later sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 45 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro, vive en su casa junto a su esposo Narciso de 45 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calida de vida. La siembra de cacao, café y hojas de coca, es la actividad a la que se dedica Juana. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus chacras para que sus plantaciones sean fértiles y obtenga una buena producción. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos, puesto que perjudican y atrasan el desarrollo de las plantaciones. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, hasta el mercado, ya que tiene que llevarlos con mucho cuidado. Con el tiempo desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar la siembra de sus frutos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, también comprará abono para aplicar a sus tierras y asegurar la producción de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Juana, 45 years old, is a woman who has worked very hard all her life.  She lives with her husband Narciso, 45, and their three beloved children, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.

Juana grows cacao, coffee and coca leaves.  Every morning, starting very early, she works in her fields so her plants will be fertile and she will have a good crop.  What she likes most about her work is protecting the crop from insects because they are detrimental to the plants and harm their growth.  She has been doing this work for eight years, and she believes the most difficult part is transporting her products to market because she has to be very careful with them.  In the future she would like to buy more land so she can plant more.

This is Juana's seventh loan from MFP.  She knows she has to make her payments punctually, and she is ready to do so.  In her communal bank she is very committed to the group's development.  With the three thousand new soles she has requested, she will buy seeds for cacao and coffee.  She will also buy fertilizer to use on her land and assure a good crop.

loans.use: Buy seeds for cacao and coffee, and buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Rutwe Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
A. Runyansi is the leader of Rutwe Kwetungura group in Kihihi. He is 34 years old and married with 6 children, with 5 of them in school. 

A. is involved in the sale of produce from Kihihi town council.  He also owns a motorcycle that he hires out, and is able to earn income every day. In total, he is able to make 50,000 UGX in weekly net profits.   As another side business, A. is also involved in brick laying, from which he got money to start up his current businesses. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke for reselling. He is a cooperative man who works hard to ensure that his business expands, and to have a stable family. A. is a new client of Pearl and he hopes for the best.

loans.use: To buy matooke for resale

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiru

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old and is married to David Murigi, who contributes to the family income. She runs a greengrocer in Kabati and has been in operation for about 8 years with a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

This is her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying her previous loans well and on time. She hopes to be a leading greengrocer and give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock of pawpaw and tomatoes.

loans.name: Veronica Ignacia

texts.es:
Doña Veronica de 48 años de edad, habita en la Comarca Pulvozan del Municipio de San Pedro de Lovago, es madres soltera de dos hijos los que le ayudan a las actividades de la Finca y cuida de dos hermanas que tienen problemas mentales, esta Señora es trabajadora, activa, esforzada; los bienes que tiene son propiedad de ella y los ha obtenido con mucho sacrificio y dedicacion; su mayor fuente de ingresos es el ordeño, ademas realiza actividades agricolas como la siembre de tuberculos mismos que produce tanto para el sonsumo y para obtener otras fuentes de ingresos.  

Solicita su primer credito para el cuido de su Ganado Parido que tiene en existencia y comprar dos mas para producir mas leche y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.  

Su mayor deseo es que su familia goce de buena salud y que no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en: Mrs Veronica, age 48, lives in the Pulvozan region of the San Pedro de Lovago municipality. She is a single mother of two children who help her with the farm work and the care of two brothers who have mental health problems. She is a hard-working and active woman. She has her own property which she obtained with much sacrifice and dedication. Her greatest source of income is organizing, and she also does agricultural work such as sowing tubers that she produces both for her consumption and to sell for income. She is requesting her first loan for the care of her calving cows, and to purchase two more to produce more milk. This way, she will increase her income. Her greatest desire is for her family to have good health and to have food to eat every day.

loans.use: the purchase of calving cows

loans.name: Meena

texts.en: Meena A. is married and has one child. Her husband is a palm wine tapper.  Meena sells palm oil and palm kernel oil at Abura. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. The loan she hopes to get will be used to buy more kernels to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Meena plans to buy a nut-cracking machine.

loans.use: to buy more kernels to process for sale

loans.name: Bivamuntuyo Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
27-year-old K. Saulo has for the last decade been engaged in running a carpentry business in Kikubabamutwe-Lugazi. This hard-working gentleman who is a father to five says he began this business on sensing the high demand for furniture such as chairs and tables around his neighborhood  in Lugazi town. 

Weekly Saulo says this business generates him 55,000 shillings and he says with this Kiva loan he is going to purchase more lumber to make furniture to resell. Saulo belongs to Bivamuntuyo development group-Lugazi

loans.use: The purchase of more timber

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated an open vegetable stall, selling tomatoes and onions  to her neighbours for the last year. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to be self reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon C. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Thy Em, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have one married daughter, who is a garment factory worker.   

Sokhon is a rice farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. She had asked for a Kiva loan once before to purchase a motorcycle which her husband uses to ride to work everyday. Sokhon want to buy one more motorbike for her daughter to ride to work at the factorg, so she is asking for another loan of $1,100.   She will also use a part of the loan to purchase a sugar cane juicing machine to sell sugar cane juice when she is not working on the farm.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike and sugar cane juicing machine

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo Hernández tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la colonia San Francisco de la ciudad de Danli y se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, actividad con la que cuenta con mas de once años de experiencia.

En la actualidad él no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para seguir comprando vehículos, ya que muchas veces las ventas no son de contado y hace cambios de vehículos en las que algunas veces le devuelven efectivo y en otras ocasiones le toca a él devolver efectivo. 
Don Alfredo vive en unión libre pero con su compañera de hogar no ha procreado hijos, pero si es padre de 3 hijos de su primer matrimonio los cuales ya son adultos y trabajan.

Su compañera de hogar labora para el Ministerio de Salud Publica donde se desempeña como Auxiliar de Enfermería en el Hospital departamental de Oriente.

el credito lo utilizara para reunir una cantidad de dinero y asi poder empezar a comprar otro carro para reventa.
texts.en:
Alfredo Hernández, age 52, lives in the San Francisco neighborhood in the city of Danli.  He buys and sells vehicals.  He has over 11 years of experience in this business.

He does not presently have enough working capital to continue buying vehicles.  This is because many times the sales are not for cash.  He exchanges vehicles, and sometimes he gets cash back.  Other times he is the one who gives cash back.

Alfredo is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his life partner, and they do not have children.  However, he does have three children from his first marriage.  The children are adults, and they work.  His life partner works for the Ministry of Public Health as a nurse’s assistant in the Oriente departmental hospital.

He will use the loan to get together the money to be able to start buying another car for resale.

loans.use: to buy automobiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler and a set of pans

loans.name: Anvarshoh

texts.en:
Anvarshoh A. is a focused and active single man. He is from Dushanbe, Tajikistan.  From childhood he has been interested in agriculture, and today he is engaged in animal husbandry. He sells cattle in the market located in Vahdat city.  Every week he purchases cattle for 1500 to 1700 Somoni and sells them for 1800 to 2000 Somoni. He has been in this business for 3 years. Besides that, he also sells vegetables and milk.  Anvarshoh would like to get a loan of 7000 Somoni to expand his business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 31-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Gerald has operated a retail shop for three years and, with the income, he has been able to educate his children and buy land. His hardships include bad debtors, high transport costs, limited funds and inflation. Nevertheless, his vision is to own a large-scale retail shop and educate his family. Gerald requested a loan to buy rice, cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil and sugar for sale

loans.name: Adiara

texts.fr:
Madame Adiara est une femme mariée de 30 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
Ayant vite abandonné l’école dès à son jeune âge, elle s’intéressa très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment à l’achat  vente des vêtements et chaussures. Avec plus de 6 ans d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa mère.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décide d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des vêtements et chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (Capitale de la République du Mali). Elle est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle effectue ses ventes dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni, en ambulant, mais aussi au marché, les jours des foires. 
Elle compte réalise  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 58 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiara is a 30-year old married woman with three children and she lives with her husband and children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni. Having left school at an early age, she rapidly became interested in income-generating activities, notably the purchase and sale of clothes and shoes. She now has more than six years' experience and handles the business which she learned from her mother well. 

In order to satisfy customer demand, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy clothes and shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). She is on her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She sells while walking around the various districts of Bougouni and also in the market on fair days.

With this loan she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 58,000FCFA which she is planning to use to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Didier

texts.fr: Né le 23 mai 1975 au Bénin, Didier est marié à Bernadette. Le couple à sept enfants à charge, dont cinq sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Didier et sa femme vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Didier à arrêté l’école au secondaire, puis a appris la menuiserie, activité qu'il exerce depuis quatorze ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Didier fait de l'élevage dans sa région. Ces activités lui génèrent des revenus qui lui permettent d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. La demande de la clientèle de Didier se fait de plus en plus grande. Ne pouvant pas réunir les moyens financiers nécessaires en vue de satisfaire les commandes de sa clientèle, Didier sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit lui servira certainement à l'achat de matières premières pour la fabrication des équipements mobiliers des clients.
texts.en:
Born in Benin on May 23, 1975, Didier is married to Bernadette. The couple has seven dependent children, five of whom are their own. Some of the children go to school. Didier and his wife live together with their children. Didier left school in high school. He then learnt woodworking, his business for fourteen years. In addition to this activity, Didier also raises animals in his region. These activities generate sufficient revenues to provide for his family's various expenses.
Demand from Didier's clients is growing. As he cannot come up with the funds necessary to fulfill his customers' orders, Didier is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will definitely be used to purchase raw material to manufacture furniture for his clients.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has three children.

Ali has been a carpenter since 2005; he makes bedroom sets, wood counters and doors. He has a long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is being well known in his area.

He is requesting $2400 to buy carpenter machine tools. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him and his family a positive growth.

loans.use: To buy carpenter machine tools.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, aged 30, is married to Kenneth, who sells milk. They are blessed with one child who is two years old. 

Nancy does dairy farming, which she has been doing for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.40,000.  This is her fourth loan term with KADET LTD and has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy two dairy cows for milk production, which she will, in turn, sell.
Nancy intends to use the expected profits to furnish her new home and hopes to increase her farm productivity.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.

El socio nació en la ciudad de Huarocondo de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 45 años de edad, ella está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos.

Actualmente, El socio vive en la ciudad de donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales.
