El es artesano picapedrero pues elaborar lozas, adoquines, sardineles, lajas menudas y otras cosas en base de piedra. El pertenece a la Asociación de Picapedreros de la Comunidad de Huarocondo. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este actividad y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar herramientas como por ejemplo amoladoras, carretillas, diamantes y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
This borrower is a responsible and hard-working person who, owing to these personal qualities, was invited by his friends to join Asociación Arariwa's "Las Natividades" community bank.

The borrower was born in the city of Huarocondo, in Anta province, in Cusco department, Peru.  He is 45 years old, married, and has six children.

The borrower currently lives in the city in which he was born and this is where he carries out his business.  He is an artisan stonemason who makes flagstones, cobbles, curbstones, small slabs and other stone-based products.  He is a member of Huarocondo community's Association of Stonemasons.  He has been in this business for 20 years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

On this occasion, the borrower needs a loan to buy tools such as grinders, wheelbarrows, etc.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Inharrime, provincia de Inhambane, ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 10 a 20 anos de idade todos vão a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois filhos que não vivem com ele enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de emprego e veio sozinho,mais tarde formou uma familia. É funcionario permanente no Hospital Central de Maputo ha 32 anos e tem um salario mensal de 3.200.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria .
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes, e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (prancha, ferro, areia, cimento, chapas, pedra, e outros) para dar continudade a sua casa. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 12.000.00mt. 
Pretende concluir a sua obra e mobiliar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, assim vai solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: He was born in the Inharrime district in the Inhambane province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has six children ranging in age from 10 to 20-years-old, all of whom are in school.  He completed six years of schooling but stopped because of lack of money.  He lives in his own house with his family and also maintains two more children who don’t live with him by sending them money to help with their food expenses.  He left Inhambane to go to Maputo to look for work and though he went alone he formed a family later.  He has been an employee in the Central Hospital of Maputo for 32 years and has a monthly salary of 3,200 meticais (Mozambique currency) which he uses for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.  He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers and this is his second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticais which he plans to use to buy construction materials such as boards, iron, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others to continue working on his house.  The first loan was for 12,000 meticais.  He hopes to finish his house project and move to give his family greater comfort so he will request more loans from Hluvuku in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (boards, iron, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others).

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es una mujer de 31 años que tiene sus metas bien trazadas, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Abelardo y sus dos hermosos e inquietos hijos Verónica y Anthony. En armonía familiar ellos viven en el caserío de Cumutay. La sonrisa de está mujer, es su secreto para mantener buenos resultados. Todos los días desde muy temprano trabaja los terrenos productivos que arrienda para sembrar papa, alverja y flor de gladiolos de diferentes colores con la ayuda de algunos operarios que contrata, mientras su esposo realiza servicio de transporte público con su propio vehículo (auto). Los objetivos de Yolanda son muy claros, ella también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de semilla de papa, esta actividad le gusta porque obtiene ingresos económicos provechosos que le permiten vivir cómodamente y pagar una adecuada educación para sus hijos en la ciudad pese a vivir a una hora con 20 minutos de distancia. Como es una mujer emprendedora y conciente de que puede alcanzar sus objetivos con perseverancia, con el tiempo anhela construir una casa en la ciudad para que sus pequeños no se cansen viajando constantemente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de cada una de las cuotas. Yolanda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de medio saco de semilla de alverja, que en esta temporada piensa sembrar.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 31, is a woman with very well defined goals.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Abelardo, and their two beautiful and restless children, Verónia and Anthony, in familial harmony in the hamlet of Cumutay.  This woman’s smile is her secret to obtain good results.  Every day from very early she works her fields that she leases to grow potatoes, peas and gladioli of various colors with help from a few day laborers that she hires while her husband works providing public transportation services in his own vehicle (car).  

Yolanda’s objectives are very clear.  She also is a potato seed merchant.  She likes this activity because she earns profitable income that allow her to live comfortably and pay for an adequate education in the city for her children despite living an hour and twenty minutes away from it.

As an enterprising woman who knows that she can reach her objectives with perseverance, in time she hopes to build a house in the city so that her children will not be tired out all the time from the constant travel.

She’s a member of the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Cumutay Daybreak) communal bank and this is the 5th MFP loan.  She is grateful for all of your support and promises to be punctual with each installment payment.

If Yolanda were to receive your support she will use the requested money to buy half a sack of pea seeds that she plans to plant this season.

loans.use: to buy half a sack of pea seeds.

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en:
Phuc is a 29 year old singL. woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. Phuc earns a living by running a general store, which she has done for the past 5 years. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and confectionery items to sell in her store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers.

Phuc hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to generate additional income to reinvest in her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater range and quantity of goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ogtay

texts.ru: Ogtay ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoim bratom. Ogtay 31 qod. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom i razvodit kuric(ciplat). Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya pereprodaji. Etomu biznessu Ogtay nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje zanimalsya etim delom.
texts.en: Ogtay is not married and has no children.  He lives in the Baku region together with his brother.  Ogtay is 31 years old.  He has been involved in agriculture and raising chickens for seven years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy chickens for resale.  Ogtay learned this business from his uncle, who is also involved in this type of business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years.

Erlinda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children: three boys and four girls. Four of her children attend school while three graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish another business of selling fish in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to establish a clothes selling business and purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a clothes selling business and purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He is married with four children between five and 11 years old, all of whom are in school. For the past 21 years, Jackson has been a farmer. He currently produces maize, beans, and milk to sell at the local market and he employs two farmhands. 

Jackson is requesting his first loan with Juhudi Kilimo to venture into poultry farming. He says the purchase of poultry will enable him increase his income and make his business more secure. Jackson’s potential business threat is the outbreak of disease. However, he is convinced that the business will pay as there is a ready market for poultry in his area. Jackson is glad that Juhudi Kilimo has made farming loans available.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Karina Lissette

texts.es:
Karina, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, ella posee una tienda de productos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz)este negocio surgio por iniciativa propia,  todos los días trabaja, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para crecer más su tienda  y comprar más mercadería como: churros, galleta, arroz, frijoles, gaseosas, dulces, de esa forma obtendrá mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Karina es incrementar sus ventas teniendo más variedad y cubrir las obligaciones diarias de su hija.
texts.en: Karina is a single mother with a 2-year-old daughter. She owns a store selling basic products (rice, beans, sugar and corn). She started this business on her own initiative and works every day. She does not work fixed hours. Karina will use her loan to further grow her store and buy more merchandise such as churros (fried-dough snack), cookies, rice, beans, soda and sweet treats. This will enable her to make better income. Karina's dream is to increase her sales, to have a greater variety of products and to cover her daughter's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy churros, cookies, rice, beans, soda and sweet treats

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis Felipe tiene 31 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con los padres y con el hijo de once años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

 LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá invertir en la agricultura y comprar los insumos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, las plagas en los cultivos. El sueño es poderse esforzar para ayudarle al hijo a que culmine los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta el deporte y pasear con el hijo visitando a los familiares.
texts.en:
Luis Felipe is 31 years old and is single. He has one son. He lives with his parents and his 11 year old son in the Ventanas canton in the Ríos province.
The community bank  LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO can be found in Recinto Caimato II, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This is an area of agricultural laborers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.
Luis is a farmer who sows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He does his buying and selling in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition.
The loan will help him greatly because he will be able to invest in his harvest and buy supplies. 
The challenges that he faces frequently are: competition and crop pests. His dream is to be able to be strong so that his son can complete his studies. 
In his free times he likes sport and going out with his son to visit family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, fertilizers, and weedkiller.

loans.name: Mary Jaen

texts.en:
Mary Jaen is from Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old. Mary Jaen is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Mary Jaen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products such as toothpaste, shampoo, and many other products to the local community. Mary Jaen has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities. 

Mary Jaen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. In 2010, Mary Jaen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: El Tesoro 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Yaquelin is the coordinator of El Tesoro 4, 5 & 6 (The treasure), a group maD. up of 15 micro-entrepreneurs. This group was founded almost four years ago, and the majority of the initiating members have received loans. The group is located in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest and a luxury tourism.

Yaquelin lives with her long-term partner and three children, and operates a colmado, a grocery store, run in a neighborhood whose people buy their daily meals. She will use this loan to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, and canned food to increase her store's inventory. She is excited to receive her sixth loan with Esperanza and her group, as with each loan she has been able to improve her business, making it possible for her to proviD. for her family's needs and save to build her house in the future. She enjoys working in her little store and her dream is to have a big grocery store or a supermarket.

Yaquelin says that her most difficult challenges are to continue improving her business and helping to proviD. for her children's education. "Obtaining an education in The Bateyes is very difficult, because students need to go to the nearest town to get a better education, and for most it means more expenses," Yaquelin said. She thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, canned food, flour, and vegetables.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio Guido se sigue dedicando al negocio de taller de carpinteria,el hace trbajos como muebles,mesas y puertas de madera y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la ciudad de cusco,por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de taller de carpinteria.El socio solicita el credito para comprar madera y herramientas para la carpinteria.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Guido still has his carpentry business. He makes furniture, tables and doors from wood and subsequently sells them at the different street markets in the city of Cusco. By means of this business, the member takes care of his children. The member wants to expand and improve his carpentry workshop. The member is asking for a loan to buy wood and carpentry tools.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to makes the repayments.

.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Allodalome Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALLODALOME est composé de vingt deux personnes qui habitent la même région. La représentante  de ce groupement, du nom de Pascaline est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Pascaline est âgée de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Pascaline est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants en charge. Pascaline et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Pascaline mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d’année, la vente de poissons fumés et des condiments dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et mieux satisfaire à la demande de leur clientèle, Pascaline et les autres membres du groupement ALLODALOME sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The ALLODALOME group is made up of twenty-two people who all live in the same area.  Pascaline, the woman raising her hand on the photo, is the facilitator of the group.  In order to boost their business and better meet their customers' demand, the group is requesting financial assistance from Alidé.  Pascaline is 49 years-old and lives in Bénin.  She is married to a farmer named Joseph.  They have four children whom they all financially support.   Some of their children go to school.  Besides their own children, Pascaline and Joseph also financially support two other children.  Pascaline and her husband live together with their children.  In order to help provide for her family, Pascaline has been selling smoked fish and various condiments, locally, for about thirty years.  Pascaline and the other members of the ALLODALOME group have requested their first loan from Alidé in order to strengthen their business and to better satisfy their customers.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and various condiments.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
María, tiene 39 años de edad vive con su esposo y dos hijos en casa familiar, ella tiene una granja de pollos de engorde hace 4 años el oficio lo aprendió de su suegra el cual le dedica todo el tiempo completo, por eso no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar pollos de un día de nacidos para engordarlos y concentrado para su alimentación, vacunas contra alguna enfermedad, de esa forma el negocio estará en buenas condiciones y podrá obtener en un futuro las ganancias necesarias para el sostenimiento de su familia.
La aspiración de María es que sus hijos estudien y sean independientes, tener vivienda propia y aumentar en la granja de pollos para que sus ganancias sean mejores.
texts.en:
María is 39 and lives with her husband and two children in the familial home. She has had a chicken farm raising broilers for 4 years. She learned the task from her mother-in-law and devotes full-time to it so she does not have a set schedule.

She will utilize the loan to buy day-old chicks to fatten as well as concentrate for feeding and vaccines against disease. In this way her business will be on solid ground and she will be able to make the necessary profit to support her family in the future.

María’s aspirations are for her children to get an education and become independent, to have her own residence and to expand her chicken farm in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy day-old chicks, concentrate and vaccines.

loans.name: Me's Group

texts.en:
Me, aged 54, is widowed and has four children, two of whom rely on her. Living in Kampong Cham province, this woman supports her family’s living through selling grocery items and working for others for a fee. 
Since she is in need of working capital, she formed a group of three members to apply for loans support from VisionFund. Me will use her loan to buy grocery items to replenish her store. She hopes that this will attract more customers and she can get more income to improve living standard and to expand selling business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to attract more customers to improve living standard.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise K. was born in Tsévié, in the prefecture of Zio, in 1975. She is married and the mother of two children. A very energetic woman, she started very early on, working in the yams business in her neighborhood. She currently is established at the grand market of Hédrzanawoé in Lomé. But she lacks enough funds to stock yams in quantity.

Her business is successful, and given the bigger and bigger demand, she needs more funding in order to satisfy the market. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $750 which will allow her to go herself to order yams from the source, to transport them to Lomé, to keep an inventory, and to sell them at the grand market. Her plans will certainly improve her level of income.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Elise est née en 1975 à Tsévié dans la préfecture de Zio. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Très dynamique, elle a très tôt entrepris le commerce des ignames dans son quartier. Actuellement elle a trouvé une place au grand marché de Hédrzanawoé à Lomé pour s’installer mais elle n’a pas assez de moyens pour faire un approvisionnement quantitatif d’ignames.

Vu le succès qu’elle réalise dans ses activités et les demandes de plus en plus importantes, elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers afin de pouvoir répondre aux exigences du marché. Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre d’aller elle-même faire la commande d’ignames dans les zones de production, le transporter à Lomé, le stocker et le revendre au grand marché. Ce projet améliorera à coup sûr le revenu de Mme K.

loans.use: Buying and stocking agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his bakery business

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomás is 45 years, married, and father of 2 children. He is a craftsman who works and sculpts leather. His business is located close to the Cathedral of Caacupé and his specialty is to cover bull horn cups and thermos bottles with sculpted leather. He has been doing this for more than 25 years now, and he learned the art from his parents: before he had his own workshop, he worked with his father and learned to prepare and sculpt leather.

He exhibits his products in numerous arts and crafts expositions, where his work is much appreciated, especially the thermos bottle covers and leather handbags.

One of his future projects is to buy another industrial machine. With this he will expand his toolset and machines that he owns. He sometimes loans the machine to his colleagues, which creates timing conflicts that makes it impossible for him to produce in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Tomás tiene 45 años está casado, tiene 2 hijos. Su oficio es el arte de trabajar y tallar cuero. Su negocio está ubicado cerca de la Basílica de Caacupé y su especialidad es la de forrar las guampas y termos con cuero tallado. Está dedicado a la actividad hace más de 25 años y el conocimiento lo heredó de sus padres ya que antes de tener su propio taller y negocio trabajó con su papá, donde aprendió a confeccionar y tallar el cuero.

Exhibió sus productos en numerosas exposiciones artesanales, donde fue muy apreciado su trabajo, en especial por los forrados de termos, como así también las carteras de cuero.

Dentro de sus proyectos actuales, está la compra (en el futuro) de una máquina industrial. Con esto ampliaría la variedad de herramientas y maquinarias que posee, ya que en algunos casos esa máquina la presta de sus colegas, lo cual crea contratiempos imposibilita la producción de mayores cantidades.

loans.use: To buy leather

loans.name: Lidia Da Graca

texts.pt:
Lidia is single, and she joined FDM in the early part of 2007. With her first loan of approx. 200 dollars, she expanded her salon and purchased products. She asks for a second loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products and jewels.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Solteira, entrou para o programa no inicio de 2007, com o primeiro emprestimo de 5.000, ampliou o salao e comprou produtos, recebeu o 2. emprestimo a 10/07/07, que investiu na compra de produtos de beleza e joias.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and jewels for sale in salon

loans.name: Endang

texts.en: Endang is 27 years old and is married. She sells rice and some fried foods such as fried chicken, potatoes, fish, fried snacks, and many more items. Her husband, Asep, is a musician in a group with an unfixed income. Endang has been running her business since she joined MBK, and can earn $17 per day. She needs a $100 loan for buying some food and to increase her capital. She hopes that this will increase her business and she is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy some food and increase the capital

loans.name: Komugisha

texts.en:
Komugisha is 38-years-old and has raised her children (ages 11 and 16) as a single parent after her husband left her in 1997. She also takes care of the children (ages 14 and 15) of her physically handicapped sister who lives in the village.

Five years ago, Komugisha opened a café, which she named “Mama Lishe Otagaya” (meaning “don’t judge me” cafe). She explained that she chose this name because this business is how she makes a living despite stereotypes associated with such street cafes.

Around 50 customers come to Komugisha’s café daily, which is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner from 5am to 8pm, 6 days a week. Komugisha hires 2 assistants to help her with the cooking, paying them each a salary of around $70 per month. After paying her café’s rent of about $18, Komugisha brings in a profit of around $135 each month.

With a loan, Komugisha hopes to buy food items to increase her business. She belongs to the group Airport (named after their location near the national airport), which consists of 17 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a butcher who is married with 6 children and one dependent. For the past five years, he has traveled two hundred miles once per week to buy two cows for slaughter. Since there is no refrigeration, the meat must be sold within 2 days. He will pay about 500,000 schillings for the animal on the hoof or about $300.00US. Once back in Kiyinde, he will slaughter the animal and be able to market about 100kgs of beef on the bone. His gross profit will be about $25.00US per cow; out of that he will have to take the cost of hired help, rent, and transportation.

But a butcher is a skilled trade and always in demand, so this is a business which can be passed on to family members. With his loan, Christopher will use the money to pay for transportation costs and rent.

loans.use: Christopher will use his loan to pay for transporting his purchased cows.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en: I am Mussarat B. from the small metropolis Pakpattan, Pakistan.  I own a house here and live with my family. My family comprises of one son, one daughter and my husband.  My daughter attends kindergarten while my son is too young to attend school at the present.  My husband works as a ticket collector in a local transport. I request a loan for my brother, who is a blacksmith and manufactures iron boxes. My group members are my neighbors and I completely trust them. Imam H. needs a loan to buy a donkey cart. Karam Bhari plans  to buy a rickshaw. Naseem B. will use the loan to repair their rickshaw.

loans.use: To expand brother's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Miguel Roberto

texts.en:
I have been renting and selling business suits for more than three years. This business is the source of income for my family. I need a machine and more modern equipment for more elaborate tailoring of the suits, and also I would like to rent a separate space because right now, I operate this business out of my home. It would be nice to have the two separate. I am asking for a loan of $750.00 to purchase a machine and equipment for tailoring and for rental space in the center of the city of Nuevo Laredo, Mexico.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 3 años con el negocio de venta y renta de trajes para caballeros. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. En el negocio me esta haciendo falta una maquina y equipo mas moderno para la elaboración de los trajes, también quiero rentar un local ya que lo tengo el negocio en mi casa quiero separar el negocio de la casa. Solicitó un préstamo de $750.00 Dlls. Para la compra de maquina y equipo de trabajo de costura y la renta de un local en el centro de la cuidad de Nuevo Laredo Mexico.

loans.use: To Buy a Machine and Equipment for Tailoring

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn S. is a clothing seller and lives in Roteang Village in Kandal Province. She is 58 years old and is married with eight children. Three of the children are working and two others are enrolled in school; the others are too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Toun Teoun, who is on the left in the photo, is a farmer and can generate a small income.

Mrs. Horn S. usually faces a problem during the rainy season because no customers come to buy her products. The family typically spends money on vegetable seeds, as well as on Mrs. Horn S.’s business and everyday family expenses. In order to expand her business, she now wants to apply for a loan to buy more clothes to sell in the village.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs.  Victoria I. is 54 years of age, she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children and she sells Provisions, which is what she learned from her lovely  mother. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her improve her business and  has been in LAPO for 10 year as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sales

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi is married with one daughter named Lizzy. He lives in Kherson, Ukraine, and sells children’s clothing in the Dneprovskyi market. Dmytryi’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 7 years. Today he has about $3,000 invested in his business. His monthly net profit is about $2,000.

Dmytryi is very good with people. He has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him be successful in the competitive clothing market. Dmytryi’s biggest dream is to have financial independence and a decent livelihood for his family. He hopes the current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: To restock inventory

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Maria, 41, lives in the city of Managua, in the neighborhood of Sabana Grande. She has two young children and she and her husband want to provide the very best for them, especially with regards to education. Her husband works hauling goods in a horse-drawn wagon.

Maria makes a living making and selling "cosa de horno" (a traditional cornbread-like food made from maize), a product very popular with her customers. Her grandmother taught her the skill that has long enabled her to earn a living and still does today. Her plan is to increase her volume of production so that she can become a distributor.

The loan that Maria has applied for will go to buying maize to make cosa de horno, the first step in her plans to increase production and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Don Maria tiene 41 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de managua, en la comarca sabana grande. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad a los cuales junto a su esposo quieren darles lo mejor y sobre todo educación. Su esposo trabaja en acarreo en una carretón de caballo.

Doña Maria se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno, producto muy demandado por sus clientes, que se hace a base de maiz. Su abuelita le enseñó este oficio y con el cual ella ha podido y puede ganarse la vida. Sus planes son generar mayor volumen de producción para poder llegar a ser un distribuidor.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de maiz para la elaboración de cosa de horno, ya que quiere aumentar sus productos para empezar su crecimiento.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for bakery business.

loans.name: Serigne Touba

texts.fr:
Mr. D. is a young married man, born in 1983 in Treichville. He has worked as a shoemaker for over five years and has a workshop in the market at Grand Thies. He is requesting this loan to increase his stock of raw materials in order to complete his orders on time and top up his income.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

mr D. est un jeune marié né en 1983 à TREICHVILLE .il fait de la coordonnerie depuis plus de cinq ans et son atelier se trouve au marché grand thies .il demande ce pret pour augmenter son stock de matières premières afin de terminer ses commandes à temps et d'améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: To make shoes and sell shoemaking materials

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Revendeuse des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè depuis 1997, madame A. Abla est née le 13 avril 1957 à Akoumapé, l’un des villages du Togo. Mariée à monsieur LIASSIDJI Yao qui exerce l’activité de maçonnerie, elle a quatre (4) enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Compte tenu du revenu irrégulier de son mari, elle l’aide dans les dépenses de la famille avec le revenu qu’elle tire de son commerce.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire son stock par l’achat de 17 sacs de riz, 2 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et 2 cartons de poissons fumés.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abla A., who has been selling staples in the Agoè neighborhood since 1997, was born on April 13, 1957 in Akoumapé, a village in Togo. Married to Mr. Yao Liassidji who is a mason, she has 4 children, all of whom attend school. In view of the irregular income of her husband, she helps support the family with the income she gets from her little business.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to replenish her inventory by buying 17 sacks of rice, 2 cases of pasta, and 2 cases of smoked fish.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staples for re-sale

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: La señora Eva Maria tiene la edad de 24 años habita en el sector de Esquipulas en Managua, es casada su marido Geyner Laguna es chofer desde hace 4 años años y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa  , la señora todavía no tiene hijos ya que quiere esperar un tiempo por que su planes en estos momentos es sacar adelante el negocio de repostería que tiene 6 años de funcionar en ese sector , ella quiere incrementar la producción de dichos productos ya que tienen una demanda mas alta  que su presupuesto , doña Eva decidió solicitar el préstamo ya que con ese dinero comprará mas material y abastecerá a todos sus clientes. Su sueño es llegar a tener por lo menos una sucursal dentro del casco urbano de Managua pero para eso necesitará mucho esfuerzo y apoyo
texts.en:
Eva Maria is 24 years old and lives in the Esquipulas neighborhood of Managua. She is married to her husband, Geyner Laguna, who has been a chauffeur for the last 4 years and helps pay the bills. Eva doesn't have any children yet as she'd like to wait until they follow through with their current plans of growing their bakey business, which has been operating for 6 years in their neighborhood. She'd like to increase production of certain product as it is in higher demand than previously anticipated. Eva decided to solicit a loan so that she could buy more product and supply it to all of her clients. She'd like to realize her dream of having an office in the urban centre of Managua, but for that, a great effort and much support is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients to make baked goods.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania!

This is 33-year-old Lulu R. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 2 children: Hussein who is 13 years old, and Swalene, who is 11 years old. Lulu has been running a beauty salon since 2004. Hers is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to expand her business. Lulu thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who earns a little rice revenue from her farm. Aside from this plantation, she sells water lilies. She is a 47-year-old widow with four children: one is employed in a garment factory, two are construction workers, and the youngest one is attending the local school. Even though Mrs. Sokha K.’s family members have different businesses, they cannot support their household well. Thus, Mrs. Sokha K. is seeking a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and thus provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for breeding

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam I. is a married woman with two children.  She is forty-eight years old.  One of her children has completed college and the other has yet to complete.  Mariam and her family are currently living in Atebubu, a farming community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Mariam sells cereals such as beans, maize, and groundnuts.  She has been selling for fourteen years.  She buys the cereals from the farmers in her locality.  Mariam says prices are quite moderate when buying from the farmers directly and, in this way, she is able to make a good profit.  She sells her goods to the local food vendors. 

Mariam is in a group called ‘Assurance’ Trust Bank in her community.  The members in the group guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and grains.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is 30 years old, unmarried, and lives with her parents. She sells women’s clothing at the central market. Her income is about 4,000 UAH per month.

Tatyana has been in this business for 2 years. She is very good at working with people and treats her clients well. They come back often which allows her business to grow. During this short period of time, she was able to build her own kiosk. Tatyana would like to open a second location as there is a high demand for the type of clothing she sells.

Tatyana is requesting a loan to purchase women’s sweaters. She hopes to increase sales and open a second location. Also, her business is the only source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase women's sweaters

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married with a son. She is from Stryi, Western Ukraine. Ganna owns a business selling men’s clothing in the local market. She has a serious business approach focusing on client demand and modern fashion trends. Ganna has been in this trade for 5 years. Presently, she has about 10,000 Grivnas in inventory. 

Ganna is very enthusiastic about her venture and business as such. You can definitely call Ganna a workaholic. She invests all her energy in her business and seeks to see its growth. One of her dreams is to buy a small store and move her business there. Ganna is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise, e.g. men’s sweaters and shorts, and boost her sales this spring season.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and operating a barbecue store (food vending). Her first loan from ASHI served as her initial capital in this business. She has been in the business for almost 2 years. She has realized that this business will  increase her profit and her customers. Her neighbors and laborers serve as her customers. 

She is married and blessed with 2 children that inspire her to pursue her dreams.  Her business generated more income and she started accepting orders from another town. Her income has begun to help her family's income grow to become a potential for their dreams.

loans.use: additonal capital to purchase pork, hotdogs, chicken liver, and feed, etc.

loans.name: Fenika

texts.en: Fenika A., 20, is married with one child. She has many years of experience in the elei printing business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Fenika’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase paints for elei printing and also helped her with her children school fees.

loans.use: To purchase paints for elei printing and also for school fees.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en:
Bui Thi T. is a fifty-three-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An.  She is widowed and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, Thảo works in a family member's business venture in the services sector, operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members.  Thảo has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Thảo joined TYM Fund, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Thảo has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  Thảo is now requesting a new loan of $575, which again will be used to buy fabric and other sewing materials.  This will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Thảo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Eliseo Gerardo

texts.es: Don Eliseo es originario de la Comunidad de Paqui a 8 Kilometros de la ciudad de Totonicapan don Eliseo su actividad principal es la confeccion  cuenta con su pequeño taller con quince maquinas de coseher, en donde cada operario  elabora  cuatro docenas por dia y el producto ya terminado don Eliseo los entrega en la Ciudad Guatemal, en Mazatenango, y San Francisco el Alto hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales, ya que tiene un pedido muy grande
texts.en:
Don Eliseo is a founder of the Community of Paqui at 8 kilometers from the city of Totonicapan. His principal economic activity is embroidery. He has a small workshop with fifteen sewing machines in which each operator produces four dozen a day. When the products are ready, Don Eliseo brings them to Guatemal city in Mazatenango and San Francisco el Alto. Today, he needs a loan to buy materials since he already has a large order.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Ysuf

texts.ru: Юсуф Шерназаров в возрасте 43 года, проживает в районе Хуросон. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Юсуф занимается животноводством, т.е. закупает скот, откармливает и продает. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Также он работает таксистом более 15 лет. Клиент хочет получить у нас кредит, чтобы закупить крупно рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Yusuf S. is 43 years old and lives in the Khuroson region. He is married and has 6 children. His oldest son is in Russia earning money. Yusuf raises livestock; he purchases livestock, fattens it and sells it. He has been in this business for more than 5 years. He has also worked as a taxi driver for more than 15 years. The client would like to get credit from us in order to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita T. is from the town of Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old. Bernardita is married and has 10 grown children. To make a living, Bernardita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops and backyard animals. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Bernardita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Bernardita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Bernardita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Bernardita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizing materials such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Bernardita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mapartu

texts.en:
Mapartu E. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs at the restaurant. Mapartu is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is an army officer. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and rent it out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice S. is from the village of Purok 9B Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 26 years old. Janice is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janice works in a family member's business venture in a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "GTY" products or Ready to Wear clothing items in the local community. Janice is just starting this business.

In 2009, Janice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Janice from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Умри

texts.ru: Ачилова Умри женщина , которая кредитуется в организации несколько лет. Она занимается бизнесом продажи продуктов питания на маленьком базарчике 27 микрорайона города Худжанда, где сама и живёт. Т.к. сейчас сезон арбузов, Умри  на полученный кредит с Микроинвеста хочет завести партию арбузов и продавать около своего ларька.

loans.use: на завоз арбузов

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. has received schooling through tertiary. She is married and has four dependents. She is responsible for paying utility bills and her dependents’ school fees.

Mary sells provisions such as canned fish, baked beans, and cooking oils as well as plasticware in the central market, Hohoe, which she has done since 1989. Her loan will be used to buy more of the plastic and aluminum products to sell. She hopes to save and build a house from the profits of her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more of the plastic and aluminum products to sell

loans.name: Magali

texts.en:
Magali is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 37 years-old, lives with her partner, and has three children who are 14, 12, and 3. They are studying in the public school.

Magali started an education but didn’t get to apply it because she got married and left on a trip to Argentina, but things didn’t work out and she had to return. She constantly suffered beatings by her husband to the point where she had to go to the hospital.

This is when she decided to start selling clothes. She bought three shirts for little girls and two pairs of pants. She succeeded in selling them and then bought more. Since then, Magali has sold clothes for a living. Twelve years have passed, and she now has a partner that respects and supports her.

Since joining FINCA, Magali has learned to value herself as a woman and to work toward her dreams. Magali needs a loan of 1400 PEN to buy discounted clothes and footwear. Her dream is to see her daughters grow up and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy discounted clothes and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Josué 1.9 Group

texts.es:
Al centro de la foto está Marvin S. M. quien es el coordinador del grupo Josué 1.9, es un varón muy esforzado y trabajador. Posee un tramo en el mercado central de Masaya donde vende huevos por cajilla.

Su negocio nace como iniciativa de la empresa Avícola donde trabajó cargando y descargando contenedores. Ellos le propusieron poner un tramo en el mercado de Masaya y que ellos le iban a proporcionar al crédito los huevos para que los vendiera.  Hace ocho meses inicio este negocio con 50 cajillas semanales, actualmente trabaja hasta con 250 cajillas semanales. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. 

“Lo hago por mi esposa y mis dos bebes que tanto amo” dice Marvin, pues ellos son la principal fuente de sus ánimos. Su financiamiento lo quiere para comprar de contado y ganar más ya que al crédito es mucho más caro.

Los otros miembros del grupo son Luz S. quien trabaja en la compra y venta de artesanías y Carlos M. quien posee una mini-pulpería que está iniciando y pretende hacer crecer a gran escala.

loans.use: Comprar de contado sus productos para obterner mejor precio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ouvrir un atelier et achat de matériels de travail.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose  sells provisions in front of her house; she uses the profit she makes for her family needs. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for the past 5 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provision to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. She is 57 years old and is married; she has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns and runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood to the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leonora joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is currently requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: investing in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a new clothes business.

loans.name: Cordilia

texts.en: Cordilia is 40 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a businessman. She is an LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Felismina Abrao

texts.pt:
Felismina Abraão M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 1 filho de 10 meses de idade. Fez 12ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu filho e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Nunca saiu de Maputo, desde a infância ate hoje ainda continua vivendo lá. Tem um negocio próprio amais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e faz um horário das 7h as 18horas todos os dias. Aprendeu esta actividade com os seus pais onde vende mais cerveja, refrescos e vinhos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrigerantes, cervejas, vinhos e outras bebidas alcoólicas) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt os dois e todos para mesma actividade.
 
Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para fixar um estabelecimento comercial convencional e aumentar ainda mais a quantidade diversificada da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Felismina Abraão M. was born in Maputo, south of Mozambique. She is 29 years old and a single mother to a boy who's 10 months old. She finished 12th grade but had to drop school due to financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her son and doesn't support anyone else. She never left Maputo. She runs her own business selling beer, wine and soft drinks for the past 10 years. She learned this activity from her parents, she has no employees and works from 7AM to 6PM every day. She makes around 2.500,00MT (U$80) per month which she uses for household expenses and saves some every month. She has never had loans with other banks and this is her 3rd loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 10.000,00MT (U$350) in order to buy more merchandise (soft drinks, beer, wine and other alcoholic beverages) to diversify her products and improve her business. Her previous loans were also for $350 and for the same reason. She is hoping to pay this one in time like she did with the others so in the future she can ask for another loan to open her own liquor store and improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Beverages for reselling

loans.name: Modest

texts.en:
M. Modest is a businessman who is married with six children, all of whom are in school. He lives in Namenga Kireredde in Lugazi.

Modest deals in selling electrical goods and has been in the business for over four years. He is using the loan to acquire more electrical goods such as switches, sockets, cables, bulbs, tubes, flat irons, extensions, and so forth.

Modest’s dreams are to increase his stock and run his business well and have his children study and complete university so that they can become self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy more elecrical good to sell

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Сафарова Шарофат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Сафарова Шарофат занимается растениеводством  более 3 лет. Она сажает картошку. Во всем этом ей помогает муж. Целью кредита является закуп семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Sharofat S. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. Sharofat has been involved in agriculture for over 3 years. She grows potatoes. Her husband helps her with this business. She is obtaining this loan in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn C. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Genalyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Genalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to invest in expanding the business. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used  to repair fishing materials. This will be the second loan which she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair fishing materials

loans.name: Marisela Del Carmen

texts.es: Marisela vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 22 años de edad, se dedica ala venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, casada y con una bebe de 5 mese de nacida, anteriormente trabajaba en zona franca renuncio y con su liquidación y dinero que dio su esposo producto de su trabajo en zona franca como operario, invirtió en ropa, zapatos y cosmético que vende ambulante y por encargo a sus clientes pues tiene dos años en este negocio lo que espera es poder crecer para  poder ir a los departamento a vender ya que las ventas le han comentado que son buenas. Su anhelo es poder tener su propia casa algún día ya que habita en casa de su suegra es por eso desea invertir y  ir ahorrando para poder lograr el objetivo junto con su esposo. Este financiamiento comprara ropa para damas, caballeros, zapatos, cosméticos y otra variedad de productos que encargan sus clientes lo que espera es vender mas y ganar mejor para poder cubrir las necesidades diarias de  su familia y ahorrar para hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Marisela is 22 years old, she is married, has a 5-month old daughter, and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She sells clothing, shoes, and toiletries. Previously she worked in the free trade zone; upon quitting she took her severance pay and combined it with money provided by her husband (from his job in the free trade zone) and invested it in purchasing clothing, shoes, and toiletries. For the past two years she has been selling her products on the street and by request to direct clients. She now wishes to expand her business and sell directly to department stores, as she's often been told that her products are quite good. She currently lives in her mother-in-law's home and hopes to someday purchase her own house. She wishes to invest in her business and save money so that she and her husband can reach this goal. This loan will be used to purchase men and women’s clothing, shoes, toiletries, and other products requested by her clients. She hopes to be able to sell more products and earn more money in order to cover her family's daily expenses, as well as save money to purchase a house.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, and toiletries to increase her sales

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Mr. Benito A. is from the village of Locus, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old. He is a farmer and a Barangay Kagawad (an elected government official) in the local community. His income of 9,000 per month comes primarily from his barangay honorarium (payment for government duties) and from his agriculture business. Benito is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to pay for his motorcycle.




About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for his motorcycle

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi O. is a 36-year-old nursery school teacher.  She also owns a mini-retail shop, a business she started in 2003. She has been teaching and at the same time running the mini shop to support her husband in providing for their two children.

In 2008, Naomi became a widow after the death of her husband; since then, she has been the sole breadwinner for the family. For her to be able to support her family effectively, she wants to expand her business and see her income grow and it is for the reason she has applied for a loan with KMET for 20,000 KES to use to increase her stock.

Her future goal is to see her children get quality education that will see them have a better life in future. She lives in Manyatta Kisumu.

loans.use: To increase her stock to boost her business.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en: At her young age (33 years old), Lorina G. has become a successful businesswoman. She started her business using the loan she received from ASHI when she became a member in the year 2002. This was just small then but because of so many trials due to poverty, Lorina strived hard to make it grow and expand. Her vision of giving her three children a better future using the proceeds of her business enhanced her eagerness to explore the potentials of her business. Her husband has been so supportive to all her ventures. Looking back at Lorina’s business, now it has a lot of accomplishments. Before, her franchised fried chicken rolling store operated only in one municipality and was transported by bicycle. Now it operates in four neighboring municipalities and is transported by motorcycle. Lorina feels happy with her business achievement. However, it is not yet stable enough for her to feel financially secure. Without her a loan, her business can never grow, especially when time comes when her three children (whose ages are from eight to 13 years) are ready to go to college. Therefore, Lorina is requesting another loan in a larger amount to put up another business, which is a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for transportation. She hopes that by having several businesses, she will have more income, have more savings for the future of her children, and will be able to help her other relatives by employing them to work with her in her businesses.

loans.use: To buy another cart for her business and a sidecar for her tricycle

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita M. is from the village of Misom Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Carmelita is married and has one adult child.  Carmelita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as noodles, eggs, salt, sugar shampoo, soap, coffee, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Carmelita is now requesting her second loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fongyen

texts.en:
Born in 1962, J. is married and a father of three. He has been a victim of a sickness that incapacitated his left arm. His greatest wish is to see all his children be responsible citizens in the future. He joined GHAPE in 2004 and has been a devoted member since then. He bought a motorbike with his previous loan but, unfortunately, it is not in working condition.

With this loan, he plans to repair the motorbike and use it as a motorcycle taxi for public transportation. This will serve as an additional source of income for his family and will go a long way to help meet the family needs of food, clothing, medication, and education for the children. Motorcycle taxis provide a door-to-door service that is preferred by all. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Repair Motorcycle Taxi

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Kha Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Kha S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who are located in Preah Putth village in Kandal province.

She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Sophan Chen, earns a living as an electronic repairman working out of his home.  Currently her husband has some problems because his electronic supplies are not sufficient to use. So to improve this business, Mrs. Sok Kha S. is asking for a loan to bU. some electronic supplies. With this livelihood, they support five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy some electronic supplies

loans.name: C4576 Indatwa Group

texts.en:
Chantal is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 1 and 3 years old. Chantal is the president of a group called INDATWA and this group owns a small grocery where they sell a variety of goods. This group has been in business for a long time. The hours of their business are from 6 am to 7 pm every day.

Chantal and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand the grocery by purchasing a large quantity of goods. With these additional goods, the group will satisfy the demands of the customers. They will earn a lot of money which will be used for reinvestment and to improve the lifestyle of their families.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: A.  ameyo est une femme très dynamique, à 32 ans elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, son époux est un conducteur de camion, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de friperie, céréales et divers. Son stock a connu une baisse raison pour laquelle elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et  sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 1 balle de friperie, 5 sacs de céréales et divers.
texts.en:
Ameyo A. is a very dynamic woman. At 32, she is married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a truck driver. She earns money by selling second hand clothing, cereals, and various other products. Her supplies are low and she wants to restock. This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy one load of clothing, five sacks of cereal and various other items.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, cereals, and various items

loans.name: Carlos Clemente

texts.es:
Carlos Clemente R. T. tiene 45 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 22 años.

Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Carlos trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz y cacao. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas y Puerto Pechicho cada 6 meses para arroz y maíz y vende cacao solo en pequeña cantidad. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en los cultivos de verano, para comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara porque el interés es mínimo y le quedara bastante ganancia. Su sueño es dejar algo a sus hijos, trabajar más y dejar propio el cacao y maíz. Ahora tiene desafíos porque cae langosta en los cultivos. 

Le gusta descansar y cocinar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Carlos Clemente R. T. is 45 years old and lives in the Ventanas hamlet, located within the Los Ríos province. He has two children, ages 20 and 22. Carlos is a member of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Carlos works as a farmer, raising corn, rice, and cacao. He sells his products in Ventanas and Puerto Pechicho, every six months for the corn and rice, but only small quantities of cacao. He is requesting this loan in order to work the summer season; to buy seed and fertilizer. He feels that this loan will be helpful because the interest rate is low and he will earn a good income. His dream is to leave something behind for his children and to be able to work more. He likes to cook and rest in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an orthopedic back support

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim P., 46, along with her life partner, Mr. Thy, 51, earns a living by cultivating crops on farmland that they own, located near their village. In addition to her farming work, Sim P. makes porridge and sells it to her neighbors and fellow villagers for additional income. 

The irrigation system is located a considerable distance away from Sim P.’s farm, so she has always faced difficulty when it comes to watering her crops. To solve this problem, Sim P. has requested a loan that will be used to buy a machine that will pump water for her crops.      

The couple has four children, one of whom is married. One of their children works as a construction worker and two are secondary teachers.

loans.use: To buy a machine that will pump water for her crops

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio R. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 21 years old and is married. Artemio owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Artemio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Artemio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Mr. Sourn P. is a middle-aged man whose wife is shown in the photograph. Sourn P. and his wife own a plot of farmland that they inherited from their parents. On the land, they grow various crops to earn a living.

Besides this, the couple also travels to the forest where they buy chop-wood (firewood) and transport it to sell at their home. Sourn P. sees that the chop-wood trade is a profitable one for his family and he wants to enlarge it as he hopes he will be able to improve his profit.

Therefore, Sourn P. looks for assistance from Kiva in order to buy a bigger quantity of firewood from the forest people to resell.

loans.use: To buy a bigger quantity of firewood to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the village of Brgy. 26, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Elsa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional firewood to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.
