About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City, Misamis Orie

loans.name: Assiakolé

texts.fr: Assiakolé est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Son époux est un dessinateur de bâtiment. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  de pagnes, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé où ce commerce est très développé. Elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec une pièce  de GTP, une pièce de WAX hollandais et 2 pièces de tissus à dentelle.
texts.en: Assiakolé, aged 40, is married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a building draftsman. She earns an income by selling pagnes (colorful West African wax cloths). She has been in this business for three years and gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé where this kind of trade is highly developed. Assiakolé came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan, which she will use to buy one set of GTP cloth (a mid-quality brand), one set of Dutch style wax cloth and two sets of cloth trimmed with lace.

loans.use: To buy pagnes

loans.name: Tigo Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tigo” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this new loan, however, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isata K.. Isata is age thirty-eight; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a farmer; three of her children are attending primary school and two are  in secondary school. Isata has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells cooked foo-foo (fast-cooking food made out of cassava roots).  With this loan, she will buy raw foo-foo and cassava roots in large quantity.

(Also included on the right in the photo is loan officer Daniel B. Banya handing over the loan to the clients.)

loans.use: Buys raw foo-foo and cassava roots in large quantity.

loans.name: Lorena Rocia

texts.es:
Lorena Roció mujer de 44 años  muy conocida en el Municipio de San Jacinto,  por el carisma que imprime en cada uno de sus actos, especialmente cuando lo aplica a su negocio de vender ropa papelería y detalles para el hogar en una miscelánea que tiene en un local al lado de su vivienda. Ella es una estudiante de arquitectura que agrega a su negocio valor,  por su perfil de estudios y por su potencial natural relacionado con la proyección de la imagen del mismo y la estética,  que  hasta a una persona desapercibida impacta cuando pasa por este lugar. Su madre y sus hermanos siempre le han apoyado sus ideas emprendedoras, ella hace mucho empezó vendiendo carne, pero como  este negocio solo funciona en las horas de la mañana se inventó  el de vender mercancías  y lo ubicó en un lugar  al lado de su casa. Su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo es desde hace seis años, durante ellos ha recibido ocho financiamientos, con sus créditos ha logrado adecuar su local para la venta de mercancías, sus utilidades se han visto reflejadas en la inversión locativa que hizo a su vivienda, compra de electrodomésticos  para facilitar y disfrutar de su vida doméstica.  Ahora sus sueños se dirigen a ampliar su negocio y hacer un apartamento al lado del local para ubicarlo en arriendo y que este genere a su familia otro nuevo ingreso.  Con su credikiva comprará ropa, papelería y detalles para el hogar, inversión con la que proyecta una utilidad bruta de un 40%, con alta probabilidad de éxito, pues su experiencia le indica que Diciembre, Enero y Febrero  son  las épocas  de mayor repunte en sus ventas.
Lorena está satisfecha  de que su negocio  esté ubicado en un corredor comercial en la avenida principal, porque permanentemente tiene la visita de muchos de sus clientes y de transeúntes, lo cual hace  que ella esté siempre pensando en término de invertirle un nuevo capital de trabajo y   en la búsqueda de un apalancamientos financieros con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en: Lorena Roció is 44 years old and very well-known in the municipality of San Jacinto for the charisma she brings to whatever she does, especially her job selling clothing, stationery supplies and household items in a general store that she runs on the side of her home. She is an architecture student, which adds value to her business by using its natural aesthetics to attract customers who otherwise wouldn't notice it. Her mother and siblings have always supported her entrepreneurial ideas. A long time ago she started out selling meat, but since that business only operated during the morning she decided to start selling merchandise out of the side of her home. She took out her first loan with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo six years ago, and since then she has received a total of eight loan with which she has been able to stock her store with supplies. She has invested the profits into making improvements on her home. She bought household appliances to make her domestic life easier. Now her dreams are to expand her business and build an apartment on the side of her store and put it up for rent, and in this way generate a new source of income for her family. With her loan she plans to purchase clothing, stationery supplies and household items and investment that projects a gross profit of 40 percent with a high probability of success. In her experience, December, January and February are the months where she makes the most sales. Lorena is pleased that her business is located in a business corridor on the main avenue because she permanently has a view of many of her customers and passersby, which means she is always thinking of ways to invest new working capital and finding financial leverage with loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, stationery supplies and household items

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret B. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. None of her children are currently in school. Margret has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 2 years. To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Margret hopes to own a house. Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos.  La señorita estudió educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 05 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en productos de belleza.

Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará más productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, talcos, etc, para  venderlos a sus amistades y familiares.

Su visión a futuro es ser directora de Unique (Empresa distribuidora de cosméticos), tener su propia empresa y tener un restaurant turístico.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 30 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She studied in higher education.

Rina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her initial loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in buying beauty products.

Rina will use this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy more beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, talcum powder, etc. to sell to her friends and family members.

Rina's vision for the future is to be a manager for Unique (a cosmetics distribution company), to have her own company and to own a tourist restaurant.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease with which she can obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, talcum powder etc. to sell to her friends and family members

loans.name: Sue

texts.en:
Sue U. is 35 years of age and married with five children between 10 and 22. She has a business selling lavalavas — bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women.  She has two years experience in this business. Sue needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use her profits — estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week — to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Sue joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sue 's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Roseline D.. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 10. In 2007, Roseline established her gara cloth business. She began her business in order to help her husband pay expenses for educating the children and building a house. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about 400,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Roseline  requires a loan in order to buy more raw materials: brillian cloth (10 pieces @ 120,000 SLL), tie-dye ink (100 pkts. @ 4,000 SLL), gara powder (200 pkts. @ 1,500 SLL), and caustic soda (50 pkts @ 1,000 SLL). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. In the future, Roseline D. plans to open a bigger shop in the city of Sierra Leone and hire workers or salespersons. She is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make gara cloth

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a freelance plumber for 5 years,  depending on clients' demand. He helps his father who represents the main income source for the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools and equipment so he can expand his business operation and earn superior profits.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a mother of three sons. Wafa and her husband are employed with a decent salary. Wafa and her husband run a small store to increase their income. The store is bringing in good income which covers household expenses and gives the family the chance to save.

During the last year and due to economic hardships, Wafa and her husband bought goods on credit. Now that their situation is much better, they want to pay back their suppliers. Wafa, who was photographed in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem, took a loan from FATEN for this purpose.

loans.use: Paying for goods for their store

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: La Sra. María Esther B. P. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia se dedica al negocio de venta de tortilla tostadas ella brinda el servicio en su  casa habitación ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes le vende el producto y sus mismos clientes le mandan  clientes nuevos  tiene siete  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Productos como Maíz, Leña  y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición del negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. María Esther B. P. is self-employed and runs a business selling fresh tortillas. She runs this business from her home. She has steady clients who buy her products and bring her new clients too. She has had this business for seven years and has one school-age child. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase corn, firewood, and other goods to help her business. The loans from CEPRODEL have been of great benefit allowing her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Liliana Nataly

texts.es: liliana tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera vive en casa familiar con sus padres, se dedica a la venta de refrescos como ambulante tiene años de experiencia en el rubro decidio dedicarse a este negocio ya que de niña ayudaba a sus familiares en esta actividad y aprendio de ellos. solicitante tiene como objetivo la ampliacion de su negocio en su casa para lo cual desea realizar el mejoramiento de la vivienda donde vive y tiene el sueño de tener un local propio ya que tiene bastante clientela. Liliana invertira el dinero en la compra de ladrillos cemento y otros materiales de construccion.
texts.en: Liliana is 24 years old, single, and lives in the family home. She sells soft drinks and has years of experience in this sector. She decided to pursue this line of work since she was a little girl to help her relatives, and learned from them. She would like to expand her business in her home which is why she would like to improve her home. Her dream is to have her own store since she already has many clients. Liliana will invest the money in the purchase of bricks, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.use: the purchase of bricks, cement, iron, and other construction materials

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa y responsable, vive en la casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo Tito de 39 años y sus 2 queridos hijos.

Son 16 horas las que Albina pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las 6 de la mañana y atiende todo el día de corrido hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche, su bodega esta ubicada frente al Colegio Secundario “Puerto Yurinaki” de la comunidad de Yurinaki (Comunidad  del distrito de Pichanaki) y es muy concurrida por los alumnos del plantel, como también por los profesores, a quienes además brinda el servicio de pensión.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la comunidad, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Albina con MFP, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy respetada por la puntualidad que demuestra.

Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Albina is 38 years old.  She is a very industrious and responsible mother who lives in her in-laws' home together with her husband, 39 year-old Tito, and her two beloved children.

Albina spends 16 hours in her store every day.  She opens at 6.00am and serves all day long until approximately 10.00pm.  Her store is located opposite Puerto Yurinaki High School in Yurinaki community, in Pichanaki district.  Her store is very busy with both pupils and teachers from the school for whom Albina also provides a meal service.

What Albina most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers and finding out what is happening in the community.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay in her store all day without being able to go out.  Over time, she hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to make more income.

This is Abina's seventh loan from MFP.  She is prepared to work very hard to make her repayments punctually.  She is a very well-respected member of her community bank because of her punctuality.  Albina will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more products to better stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more products to better stock her store

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a single mother of three.  She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from her cafeteria.  She has two years of experience in the business and has employed three people.  She also farms for extra income. Being a businesswoman, she needed a way to access loans easily; hence she registered for a group in Faulu Kenya, a partner of Kiva. Currently, she needs 20, 000 KES to buy a gas cylinder and furniture.

loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder and furniture

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en: 33 year old S. Samuel is affiliated to Kamu Kamu Group-Mpigi. He is a hard working and affable father of 3 who has been transacting his food sales business in Natete food market-Kampala for almost 4 years.  He sells mostly maize flour, beans and Peas.  He began this business immediately after he transferred responsibility for running his  second hand shoe sales business to his young brother.  He still oversees the business, though the brother is the one selling the shoes. Monthly, he says, this business generates him shillings 100,000 as profit. With this loan, Samuel is going to purchase more food such as cassava, potatoes and rice to resell.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, potatoes and rice for resale

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is a 34-year-old farmer from the village of Japana, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Mary, his parents, a 7-year-old daughter and a 2-year-old son. 

All the adult members of the family are involved in agriculture. In particular, they have a dairy farm with four milk cows. Mary and her mother-in-law produce approximately 70 kg of traditional Georgian cheese per month with the milk and sell it at the local market. The family also owns 2.5 hectares of agricultural land, 1 hectare of which is used for growing watermelon. They harvest 20 tones of fruit which is sold to the wholesalers. Another 1 hectare is used for maize:  3 tones are harvested each year, 1.5 tones of which is sold locally and the remaining 1.5 tones is used in the dairy farm for feeding cows and calves. On the remaining 0.5 hectares, various vegetables are grown, which are sold at the local market. 

Malkhaz requested a loan for cultivation of the land and purchasing watermelon seeds. With cultivation and quality seeds, Malkhaz expects to harvest 30 tones of watermelons (10 tones more that usual). The harvest of maize will increase to 5 tones. 

This family has also planned how they will invest the profit. They will buy a personal computer for their daughter, purchase an additional cow for dairy farm expansion and perform some renovation work on the house.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Inacio Salvador

texts.pt:
Inacio Salvador nasceu no Distrito de Zavala,  Provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, solteiro pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 26 a 36 anos. Fez 5ª classe parou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus sobrinhos que vivem  com ele. 

Saiu de Inhambane Para Maputo por missão de serviço.Trabalha como funcionario permanente do Ministerio da Educação ha mais de 5 anos e tem como salario 2.260.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e por vezes consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca fez emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de amigos  que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (aros de porta, cimento, barrotes, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt,ambos para construção. 

Compromete-se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e mobilar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Inacio Salvador was born in Zavala District, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is single and has 6 children between 26 and 36 years old. Inacio finished 5th grade but did not continue because of financial problems. He lives in his own house and supports relatives (nephews or nieces) who live with him.

He left Inhambane to move to Maputo on work assignment. He has worked as a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education for more than five years and has a salary of 2,260 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and sometimes saves some in his bank account.

Inacio has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (door frames, cement, beams, zinc sheets and other items) to continue construction on his house. The earlier loans were for 15,000 meticais and 10,000 meticais and were both for construction.

He promises to make his payments promptly so he can take out other loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to finish his house and furnish it so he can make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (door frames, cement, beams, zinc sheets, etc.).

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits & beverages.

Florita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Florita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits & beverages.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has practiced farming in Olkalou for the last 5 years. He is 56 years old, married to Regina and they have four children. Joseph was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET, by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer which he will plant and sell in the Olkalou market. In the future, Joseph hopes to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabethe De Los Angeles

texts.es: Elizabethe De Los Ángeles tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa hace mas de 5 años que ella recorre los diferentes lugares a ofrecer sus productos. Ella inicio esta actividad cuando nació su hijo y no tenia los ingresos necesarios para mantenerlo, al inicio no tenía mucha experiencia pero compro lo que sus clientes más le solicitaban como trajes para niños, vestidos, pantalones entre otras cosas así fue que poco a poco ella fue progresando con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes para niños, sabanas y camisetas. Su deseo es proporcionarle una  muy buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Elizabethe De Los Ángeles is 24 years old.  She has been selling clothes for more than five years.  She travels to different places to sell her products.  She started out in this business when her son was born and she didn't have the income she needed to support him.  At first she didn't have much experience but she bought what her customers were most requesting such as children's outfits, dresses, pants, etc.  In this way, she gradually made progress in the business.

Elizabethe is requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, children's outfits, sheets and t-shirts.  Her wish is to provide her son with a very good education.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, children's outfits, sheets and t-shirts

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37-years-old and lives in Latacunga, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. Gloria has a strong character, her personality is friendly, and she is a hardworking and responsible person. Her business is in repairing and selling shoes. She is seeking a loan to increase her business and her income. In Ecuador, it is common for people to have their shoes repaired rather than replaced. Gloria will use part of her loan to purchase the supplies she needs to repair shoes. Additionally, she will use part of her loan to fix up part of her house to rent out as an apartment and further increase her family’s income. 

Gloria began her shoe repair business twelve years ago. This is her first microloan from FODEMI. She hopes it will be a good support for her to finish fixing up the apartment and to achieve her other goals to increase her family’s income. Gloria’s dreams are to complete fixing up her house, to expand her business, and to increase her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for shoe repair and to fix up part of her house to rent out as an apartment.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh was born in Panjikent in 1981. He is an active and hardworking husband. For the past seven months, Farrukh has worked as a taxi driver. He drives a route through Panjikent-Shurcha, Navobod, and Kolkhozchiyon. During the time he has been working, he has made a good profit that he used to buy his own car the mark of “Damas.” 

Farrukh is requesting a 600 USD loan to repair his car and buy spare parts. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his taxi

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan, 26, lives with his family in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife works as a hairdresser at a beauty salon and his daugther attends local high school. Bayarsaihan started to sell clothes with his sister in 2009. Aside from this business, he runs a block manufacturing factory at his home. So far, his businesses are running successfully. He plans to purchase many clothes and goods before the new school year starts.

He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I want to buy many clothes and goods before September when the sales will go up dramatically." He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase clothes and increase his sales turnover.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui pratique avec son époux l'activité de commerce de gomme arabique.Ce dernier achète  le produit au nord du pays et son épouse se charge de la vente.Ayant épargné sur ses bénéfices, elle a acheté une parcelle de terrain et y a construit trois pièces.Son activité lui permet également de prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de ses deux filles.Elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter 300 kg de gomme arabique,du jujub et du "sump".Son ambition est de construire une grande maison et y loger sa famille.
texts.en: The loan seeker is a married woman who works with her husband, selling gum arabic. He buys the goods from the northern part of the country and his wife is in charge of selling them. Having put some profits aside, she has managed to save up to buy a plot of land and is building a three-roomed dwelling there. Her business enables her to see to her own needs and those of her two daughters.  She is seeking a 250,000F loan in order to purchase 300kg of gum arabic, jujub (a date plant) and a water collection basin. Her goal is to build a large house and house her family there.

loans.use: to purchase 300kg of gum arabic, jujube (a type of date plant) and a water collection basin

loans.name: Sarah Joy

texts.en:
Sarah Joy is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Sarah Joy has a shop shere she sells canned goods, snacks, noodles, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & noodles.

Sarah Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sarah Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & noodles.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Lucia has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, canned goods and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lucia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 46 years old and blessed with three children. Her family is peacefully living within the villa of Nagbukel San Isidro. Amelia's husband is a retired soldier. 

Amelia is in line with livestock business and she has been managing it for five years. She is glad that her family is in good health through our God Almighty. She has been raising six fattening and two sow. With the large number of her raised hogs, she is in need of additional capital in the amount of P40,000 to buy feeds stock for the maintenance of her piglets. She hopes that she could obtain this loan amount so that she could raise all her fattening until their optimum growth. Amelia is a responsible and patient mother to her children because her husband is far from them. She believes that the success of her business will depend upon her strategy in managing her business well.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for livestock business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana; La socia tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad, la socia trabaja vendiendo abarrotes en la esquina de sus casa en el paradero principal de autos que tiene la ruta a Cusco, la socia vende detergentes, champoo, panes, jugos, gaseosas, galletas, atunes, aguas minerales entre otros productos que salen todos los días, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos para la implementación de sus tienda de abarrotes en la carretera. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.
 La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas". The communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Juana. She is 25 years old and she is married common-law. She has a 3-year old son. She sells groceries from the corner of the block where her house is located, at the main car stop on the way to Cusco. She sells detergents, shampoo, bread, juices, soft drinks, cookies, tuna, mineral water, and other products that are sold on a daily basis. She wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of products to supply her street-side store. She requests a loan to purchase basic consumer goods.

She is thankful for the loan and she is committed to make the loan payments according to the agreed time table.

loans.use: to purchase basic consumer goods.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César de 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

César desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha cuenta con otro ingreso para ayudar en la casa de sus padres.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de más alimento balanceado y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con las ganancias que obtenga con ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  César es una persona que con esfuerzo y arduo trabajo a sabido salir adelante, permitiendo que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
César is 23 years old and married. He lives with his parents, who don’t have basic utilities, in the rural district of Tambogrande which is in the department of Piura. People in this area work in agriculture or livestock, or they are artisans. 

For a few years César has worked raising and selling farm animals (sheep and poultry). His pens are behind his house, and they are appropriate and ample. He feeds them a well-balanced diet, grains a natural grasses, so that his animals reach an optimal weight and so that he can sell them to different merchants in the area which provides him a good income with which to cover his personal costs. He also has farmland where he plants lemon, and at harvest he has another source of income to help his parents. 

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy more feed and fertilizer to improve his farmland. With the income he gets from both businesses he will be able to repay his loan and have a better quality of life. César is a person who, with much effort and hard work, is able to succeed, allowing his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more feed and fertilizer to improve his farmland.

loans.name: Belliter

texts.en:
Belliter is a 46-year-old business lady. She is married to Nzenge. They are blessed with four adult children. She has been running a retail shop for the past twelve years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Belliter will use the loan to buy maize meal, sugar, and cooking oil to add to her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy commercial land. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy maize meal, sugar, and cooking oil to add to her shop.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las rosas de la Paz”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de  San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 34 años, está casada y tienen 2 hijas, una de 9 años que  cursa el nivel primario y de 17 años que cursa el nivel secundario.
Empezó vendiendo productos de belleza lo deja porque abandonaba a sus hijas. Su esposo le apoyó en comprar un carrito salchipapero para que venda en las noches  se inicia con un capital de S/.300.00  nuevos soles, poco a poco fue ganando clientela.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de “salchipapas” (comida al paso) y otras variedades como salchipollo, juanes, arroz chaufa, además de refrescos, gaseosas, chupetes (helado de hielo), gelatinas.  Esta actividad la realiza por las noches.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00,  comprará  productos e ingredientes al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos,  como papas por sacos, aceite por galones y los condimentos, además de comprar los envases descartables que utiliza en su negocio. 
Luz Elena  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es implementar su negocio  con muebles adecuados para el tipo de negocio que tiene y además dedicarse a otros negocios que le permitan crecer  y  mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Luz Elena belongs to the Communal Bank Las Rosas de la Paz, in the District of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, in the department of San Martin. She is 34 years old, married with 2 daughters. One is 9 years old and she attends primary school and one is 17 years old and she attends high school. 

She began selling beauty products but stopped because she didn't like leaving her daughters. Her husband helped her to buy a salchipapero cart in order to sell at night and she began with 300 soles. Little by little the number of customers increased. Currently she sells salchipapas (fast food) and other types of food such as salchipollo (fried potatoes covered in chicken), juanes (rice, chicken, and olives wrapped in banana leaf), arroz chaufa (similar to Chinese fried rice), plus soft drinks, sodas, chupetes (ice cream) and gelatin. This work she does in the evenings.

With this loan of 1,500 soles she will buy products and ingredients at wholesale prices to lower costs, such as sacks of potatoes, oil by the gallon and condiments. In addition she will buy the takeaway containers that she uses in her business.

Luz Elena is a working woman and entrepreneur. Her dream is to equip her business with suitable furniture for the type of business she operates and to work in other businesses which permit her to grow and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of potatoes, oil by the gallon, and condiments

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: El señor Rubén Darío a sus 52 años es padre de dos hijos, trabaja en su propia tienda desde hace más de 10 años. Actualmente, el señor Rubén Darío requiere de la compra de surtido para su tienda tal como licor que le permita suplir la demanda de este tipo de producto para las fiestas de fin de año. Esto le permitirá al señor Rubén Darío aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño del señor Rubén Darío es tener su tienda bien surtida y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rubén Darío, age 52, has two children.  He has been working in his own store for over ten years.

Currently Rubén Darío needs to buy stock like liquor for his store.  This will allow him to meet the demand for this type of product at the end of the year festivities.  It will allow Rubén Darío to increase his income and the quality of life for his family.

Rubén Diarío’s dream is to have a well-stocked store and to increase the number of customers that he has.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, por el buen servicio y porque necesita invertir dinero, comprando dos bueyes y los insumos agrícolas como abono y herbicidas, esto le ayudara para aumentar su ganado y para iniciar el cultivo de maíz. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron para mejorar los resultados en las cosechas, sus condiciones han cambiado en la familia.
texts.en:
Luis needs to invest money buying 2 oxen and agriculture supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides to care for his crops. 

This will help him to increase his livestock and to begin planting corn. 

The previous loans helped him improve the results he had with his harvest, and the quality of life of his family has changed.

loans.use: to buy two oxen, fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Wangnignigbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNIGBE 2 est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Henriette Claire, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Henriette Claire est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Djima. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Henriette Claire a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis huit ans, Henriette Claire vend des produits vivriers et des charbons de bois, de façon secondaire à son domicile. Henriette Claire achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Henriette Claire désire obtenir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNIGBE 2. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: WANGNIGNIGBE 2 is a group composed of 3 people who all belong to the same "tontine" (savings group). The group representative, Henriette Claire, is the one raising her hand on the picture. This is the third time that this group requests a loan from ALIDé, in order to increase their business. Henriette Claire is 39 and is married to a man named Djima. They care for their 3 children, who all go to school. Henriette Claire quit school at the primary level. For 8 years, Henriette Claire has been selling food and charcoal on the side, from home. Henriette Claire buys those items in Benin. In order to increase the stock of these items and better meet the needs of her customers, Henriette Claire would like to obtain a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the WANGNIGNIGBE 2 group. Previous loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy food (corn, soybean) and charcoal.

loans.name: Onisa

texts.es: Onisa de 57 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 14 a 31 años. En esta ciudad desde hace tres años se dedica a empacar y comercializar raíces chinas, las cuales distribuye entre graneros, restaurantes y supermercados. Su negocio inició muy pequeño, después de que su esposo quedara sin empleo y la necesidad de generar ingresos los orilló a aprovechar su experiencia adquirida en su antiguo trabajo y a desarrollarla  como su plan emprendedor. Su negocio se ha expandido y hoy en día  empacan y comercializan paquetes de raíces chinas a través de terceros y  ya poseen código de barras,  para llegar directamente a las grandes superficies comerciales. Su necesidad de crecimiento los lleva a aplicar a su credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hacen a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará semillas al por mayor y empaques, para responder a la creciente demanda existente. Su principal sueño es expandirse en cadenas de supermercados y está segura de poder lograrlo mediante su trabajo responsable y esmerado.
texts.en: Onisa, who is 57 years old, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband.  They have 4 children between the ages of 14 and 31.  Onisa has made her living in Barranquilla for the last three years packing and selling bean sprouts, which she distributes to granaries, restaurants and supermarkets.  Her business started out very small.  After her husband became unemployed, the need to generate some income drove them to take advantage of the experience Onisa had acquired from an old job and to develop an entrepreneurial plan.  Her business has expanded, and today they pack and sell packages of bean sprouts though a third party and even have a bar-code to get directly to the big retail stores.  Their need to grow brought them to apply for a kiva loan, their first financing, which they are doing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Onisa will purchase wholesale seed and packing supplies to respond to the current growing demand.  Her main hope is to expand to supermarket chains, and she is sure she will be able to make it happen through her responsible and conscientious work ethic.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Evelyn Scarlet

texts.es: Evelyn Scarlet es una emprendedora que  la actividad económica a la que se dedica a brindar los servicios de video juegos en el cual lo tiene ubicado  en su casa de habitación, ella es clienta de Fundación León se le ha brindado financiamiento para el negocio en el cual nos expresa que le ha ayudado mucho ya que aumentado los juegos y los clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de equipos y discos nuevos de juegos.
texts.en: Evelyn Scarlet is an entrepreneur whose business, which is located in her home, is offering video game services.  She is a client of Fundación León, which has offered her financing for her business.  She has expressed to us that this has helped her a lot since she has increased the number of games and customers.  Currently, she is requesting financing in order to invest in the business by purchasing equipment and new game disks.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and new video game disks.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Najah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her brother. Najah is a 35-year-old married woman who has two family members from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 600 JD (Jordan dinar) to pay for her home improvements; she would like to repaint her home and to do maintenance on the home. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements (painting and maintenance).

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is 55 years old and married with one child. Joji works very hard to provide for them.

Joji has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Joji has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, body-lotion and other groceries. 

In the future Joji would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy wouldlike to buy animal feed

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en:
Rosa María is married and has a 14 year-old daughter. She has been selling clothes for 35 years, and she has worked hard to help her family and to be able to offer a better quality of life to her daughter. Lately she has gone through some economic problems and wants to continue selling her products. She needs a loan of in the amount of $250, which she plans to invest in buying inventory. She is sure she can make it with her business, which is why she plans to repay the loan over a period of three to six months.

Your generosity and collaboration can help this family get ahead. Today is the time to help someone who really needs it. María needs your support, don’t let this moment go by, decide to help her out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa María es casada y tiene una hija de 14 años, desde hace 35 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, y se ha esforzado mucho para ayudar a su familia y poder ofrecerle una vida de calida a su hija. Últimamente atraviesa por problemas económicos y quiere continuar con la venta de sus productos, ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que planea invertir en la compra de mercancía, ella confía en salir adelante con su negocio, por lo que planea devolver el préstamo en un lapso de tres a seis meses.

Tú generosidad y cariño puedes hacer que esta familia pueda salir adelante, hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, María necesita de tu apoyo, no dejes pasar este momento y decídete.

loans.use: To buy inventory for clothing sales

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani L.is a 28 year oL. mother and is married with two children. The elder is a boy and the younger is a girl.  Her husband Madisa is a fisherman, earning about $5 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Ani L.selL. various fried snacks and cooked instant noodles at her smaL. kiosk.  From this business, she can earn about $15 in a day as an income.  Ani L.needs a loan of $75. With this loan she can buy more goods to seL., thus more or less doubL. her income. She realL. wants to have more income for her children's education, to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Anibal Amilkar

texts.es:
In a place called San Juanito, Chihuahua, lives Anibal. He is married and has two little daughters, one two years old and the youngest just seven months. After the death of his father, Anibal took charge of his business, where he sold grilled chicken. Little by little the demand for his products has grown. He remodeled his location and increased the variety of foods he offers to his customers. Thanks to this good service, he and his wife have succeeded in making their business grow.

Now, in order to meet the demand, he has help from five employees, and he wants to continue growing, which is why he is requesting a loan for $925, which will be used for the purchase of ingredients. With these he hopes to increase his production. He promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Play an important part in the successful development of this business. Anibal and his family thank you very much for the support you offer.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

En la localidad de San Juanito, en Chihuahua vive Anibal, es casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, una de 2 años y la menor sólo de 7 meses de edad. Al morir su padre, Anibal se hizo cargo de su negocio en el que vendía pollo asado, poco a poco se fue aumentando la demanda por sus productos, acondicionó mejor el local e incrementó la variedad de comidas que ofrece a sus clientes, y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece junto con su esposa han logrado hacer crecer el negocio.

Ahora para cubrir su demanda cuenta con la ayuda de cinco empleados y desea continuar creciendo para lo que solicita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos, con lo que espera incrementar su producción, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo exitoso de este negocio, Anibal y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti R. is 38 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit and goes door to door to reach new customers. Her husband Junaidi sells machinery equipment. She needs $100 loan to buy more clothes and the rest will be used for her husband's business. She usually earns $16 - $17 per week, with a profit of about $3.50 per week. Siti hopes this loan will allow her to help her husband and supplement their incomes. She's a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: Increase her husband's capital and their income

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila has a small clothing sales business located at the Barabushovo Market in Kharkov, the second largest city in Ukraine. She is married and has a son and daughter. In business for eleven years, she has worked hard over the years to develop a successful business and help meet the needs of her family. Ludmila currently sells a selection of women’s clothing. She has requested a loan of $1200 to help open a new sales kiosk and purchase inventory to sell. Ludmila enjoys being self-employed and would like to continue growing and developing her business.

loans.use: Open a new kiosk

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio has been a public transportation driver for more than 30 years. He drives his taxi in the inter-city area of La Paz to El Alto. This is the primary means to support his daughter, his young granddaughter, and his wife. They live in region of Satélite in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to change the fuel of his taxi from gasoline to natural gas, which will allow him to save 50% on costs, since the natural gas is cheaper than gasoline. This is the first loan with IMPRO, and a credit evaluation approves him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Emilio es transportista de servicio público por más de 30 años. Trabaja con su taxi como Trufi Inter ciudad La Paz – El Alto, siendo su actividad su principal con la que mantiene a su hija y pequeña nieta y esposa. Vive en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para cambiar combustible a su taxi de gasolina a Gas natural vehicular; dicho cambio le permitirá un ahorro en combustible de 50% pues el costo del gas natural es mucho más barato que el costo de la Gasolina. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To change the fuel in his taxi from gasoline to liquid natural gas

loans.name: Muk Yemusumba C Group

texts.en:
Esther is a single mother of six children. She sells used clothes. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children and buy a piece of land.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in the store

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is married with two children.  She started selling wood a long time ago.  With previous loans from SMT, she expanded the business and is now able to purchase half a lorry of wood at the same time.  To expand her business further and make more profits, she is requesting for a loan of $350.00 to enable her to purchase one full lorry of wood at a time.  Kadiatu is 33 years old.

loans.use: To do more business on wholesale

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika G. is married and has 5 children.  She has been one of the active clients of MicroInvest since 2003.  She applied for a business development loan, improved her business and then opened a material sales outlet. She has a wide assortment of materials.  She is now applying for a KIVA loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months to purchase new seasonal goods.

loans.use: To purchase new seasonal goods

loans.name: Nusmira

texts.en: Nusmira was born in 1960 and she is a widow. She lives alone, near the town of Tuzla. Her monthly pension from her husband is 600 KM (about US$ 480). Nusmira wants to use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 for buying chickens in order to expand her little poultry business. Her wish is to improve food production and be able to fill her purchase orders.

loans.use: For buying chickens

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is 53 years old and married with seven children.  As a teacher, with a salary of less than $250, it is not easy to provide all the needs of the family members.  Silas has 5 hectors farmland but could not cultivate them all due to lack of farm inputs.  He would like to expand his farming activity to produce more rice, beans and cassav for the family.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds and hire labour.  Silas will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana just celebrated 20 years of working in her haberdashery business and of being a mom, she is very loved and has become and example of perseverance in her community because she has overcome numerous family and financial problems. Susana's wish, is to help her 4 younger children with their professional studies, they give her the strength necessary to continue working in her business. The business is located in a busy avenue in the city of Juliaca. While Susana attends her business, her hardworking husband works in a private institution in Juliaca. Susana thinks that by having more capital, their income will increase considerably and they will be able to finish their projects.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana, acaba de cumplir 20 años de dedicación a su negocio de mercería y a su ardua labor de madre, ella es muy apreciada y se ha convertido en un ejemplo de constancia en su localidad porque pese a los innumerables problemas familiares y económicos que atravesó ha podido salir adelante con firmeza.El deseo de Susana, es brindarle estudios superiores a sus 4 menores hijos quienes le dan la suficiente fuerza para continuar perseverando en su noble oficio, negocio que está ubicado en una concurrida avenida de la ciudad de Juliaca; mientras Doña Susana se esfuerza en su actividad su laborioso esposo hace lo propio desempeñándose en su trabajo dentro de una institución privada de la ciudad de Juliaca.Susana considera que aumentando el monto de su capital mejorarán considerablemente sus ingresos económicos, y le permitirá concretar sus proyectos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Candida is 55-years-old, is single, and has three children. Two of her children emigrated to Panama and support her economically. She only lives with one of her children. She lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the city of Managua, a neighborhood that was established in the center of the city many years ago.

Doña Candida is dedicated to selling applicances and beauty products, an activity that she started years ago with her own savings. She started selling small quantities, but thanks to her good management, she has been able to increase her inventory. The loans that she has requested have helped her invest in her business. She will use this credit to purchase appliances like fans and irons, so she can continue increasing the variety of products she offers. She hopes to be able to increase the profitability of her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Candida tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos emigraron hacia Panamá y le apoyan económicamente, sólo vive con uno de sus hijos. Habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, un barrio en el centro de la ciudad establecido desde hace muchos años atrás y que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad.

Doña Candida se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y productos de belleza, actividad que empezó hace ya algunos años con ahorros propios, empezó vendiendo pocas cantidades pero gracias a su buena administración ha podido crecer en inventario, los préstamos que ha solicitado le han ayudado en la inversión a su negocio, éste crédito lo usará en la compra de electrodomésticos como abanicos, planchas para seguir aumentando la variedad de los productos que ofrece. Espera poder aumentar la rentabilidad de su epqueño negocio

loans.use: To purchase appliances to invest in her business

loans.name: Adrián

texts.es:
Adrián tiene 47 años, vive junto a su esposa y a sus 5 hijos de 20,16,14,12 y 10 años. Es un hombre que desde muy joven se caracterizó por ser una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus chacras, y ahora a la crianza de cuyes, porque vio en esta actividad la forma de obtener ingresos adicionales, debido a la gran demanda de estos animalitos en los mercados.Esta labor no requiere de mucha atención, sólo se debe saber seleccionar a los animales y ubicarlos adecuadamente en sus jaulas, por lo general le toma parte de la mañana para limpiar, alimentar y seleccionar a sus cuyes. Lo difícil es mejorar la raza, para ello tendría que adquirir animales de raza y poder alimentarlos adecuadamente. Adrián tiene en sus hijos los mejores motores que le ayudan a seguir mejorando como padre y agricultor. Este padre anhela que su pequeño criadero de cuyes mejore y sea el más reconocido para cumplir los diversos pedidos de cuy para exportación. Para ello, requiere comprar animales de raza para mejorar la calidad de sus cuyes, por lo que solicita este préstamo.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Adrian is 47 years old and lives with his wife and their 5 sons who are 20,16,14,12 and 10 years old. He is a man who from an early age was characterized as a hard-worker who was very dedicated to his agricultural lands, and now works raising guinea pigs; he saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. This type of work does not require a lot of attention, instead, you only need to know how to select animals and place them properly in their cages. It usually takes part of the morning to clean, feed and select the guinea pigs. The challenge is to improve the breed, but in order to do so he would have to acquire pure-bred animals and feed them properly. Adrian has the best intentions for his children, this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. This farmer yearns to improve his bread of guinea pigs so that he will be better known in order to take advantage of the various orders for export. In order to do so he is asking for a loan, this will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve their quality.

loans.use: Purchase of pure-bred animals to improve the quality of his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children, 8 and 3 years old and 1 who is only 3 months old. She has sold clothes (khanga: traditional Tanzanian wraps) and firewood since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood and khanga for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and clothes for her business

loans.name: Mien Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Miền 49 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, chị có 2 con hiện tại các con chị đang còn đi học. Chồng chị mất sớm nên mọi công việc trong gia đình từ nhỏ đến lớn chị đều phải là người lo liệu. Tham gia vào Qũy chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Hiện tại chị còn làm thêm nghề nấu rượu phục vụ cho bà con quanh địa phương, bã rượu được chị tận dụng làm thức ăn cho lợn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mien Thi N. is a 49 year old woman. She has 2 children who are going to school. Since her husband passed away early, she takes care of the family. In 2004, she joined the TYM fund, and borrowed money to invest in pigs and chickens. She also learned to make wine and sold it in the local market. The production waste was used to feed pigs. She plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to raise more pigs. The family’s income is 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: El Sr. Dario tiene 37 años de edad vive en concubinato con  la Sra. Amelia Dure, tienen 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar.nnHace mas 10 años que trabaja en la curtiembre, desde joven  hacia trabajos de curtiduría como  personal y  recibía una remuneración  en  forma semanal, mas adelante  gracias a su sacrificio y buena ideología pudo reunir  una capital e iniciar esta actividad  pero  ya como propietario alquilando un predio ajeno.nnEl Sr. Dario manifiesta que su sueño es adquirir un terreno  propio para  instalarse en  forma definitiva con  todas sus  maquinarias, para  trabajar junto con su hijo.nSolicita  un préstamo d para  compra de cueros. n
texts.en:
Dario, 37, lives with his partner, Amelia Dure; they have 3 school-aged children. He's worked at the tannery for more than 10 years. He started working as a tanner when he was young, an employee with a weekly wage. Later, thanks to his sacrifice and sense of purpose, he was able to pull together enough money to start his own tannery business but he has to lease land from someone else to operate it. Dario says that his dream is to buy property of his own and set up a proper operation with all of his tools and equipment where he can work with his son. He's applying for a loan to buy hides for making leather.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hides for making leather.

loans.name: Marie-Claire

texts.fr: Née le 22/08/1965 à Cotonou dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin,Dame K. Marie-Claire est mariée à GBEDAN Pierre agent de transit à BETREXCO,mère de quatre enfants,elle s'est dépuis près de 20 ans spécialisée dans la distributionde vente de boissns fraiche devant le Port Autonome de Cotonou, dame Marie-Claire tout les soires fris de l'igname et le beigné d'haricot; Aujourd'hui,face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèl, elle procède à la demande de son quatrième prèt.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. Born on August 22, 1965 in Cotonou in Benin South Peninsula County, Marie-Claire K. married Pierre Gbedan, a transit agent at BETREXCO, a boating transportation company. She has 4 children and has sold cold drinks for almost 20 years in front of the Cotonou Port. Marie-Claire also sells igname (a potato-like traditional food) and beans. She is now asking for her fourth loan to stock up on drinks and ignames.

Translated from French by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 14 crates of drinks and 3 bags of ignames (a potato-like traditional food)

loans.name: Mila

texts.es:
La señora Mila es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 2 hijos que son estudiantes y dependen de ella. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, compró prendas de vestir para venderlas en su puesto de trabajo.
Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más prendas de vestir para aumentar sus ganancias al venderlas.
Mila desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mila is a member of the “Flor de Canela” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 43 years old, single, and mother of 2 school-aged children who are dependent upon her. With the first loan for S/.300 she bought clothing items to sell in her stand. With this loan for S/.500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy more clothing items in order to increase her income from her sales. Mila wishes to continue working in order to support her children in their studies with the hope that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Née le 07 novembre 1976 à cotonou dans le département du littoral au sud du Bénin, Dame H. Edwige  est divorcée et mère d'un garçon. Actuellement chez ses parents, elle est revendeuse de divers, de tissus et prepare en plus de tout cela de la nourriture qu'elle vent devant sa maison. Desireuse de renforcer d'avantage son activité et de couvrir la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born on November 7, 1976 in Cotonou, in Littoral County in southern Bénin, Ms. Edwige H. is divorced and the mother of a boy. Currently at her parents’ place, she sells various items and fabrics. And in addition to all that, she makes food, which she sells in front of her house. Wanting to do more to bolster her business and to meet the demands of her customers, she is requesting her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, sacks of omo (soap), and two boxes of spaghetti

loans.name: Zahida M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji is a 30 year-old old married lady and a citizen of a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he runs a boutique where he displays his collection which he prepared with the help of his wife Zahida baji. Zahida baji is the mother of one son who has a chicken-meat selling business for the past 2 years. Zahida baji is applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, cloth and beads) to expand her husband’s boutique. 

She is a group leader of some more women from her locality. Asia baji wants a loan to buy cotton to sell. Abida baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for boutique

loans.name: Mrs. Youeng An Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA., which consists of 23 people, is located in Koek Romiet village in Kandal province, and all members will use the loA. for different purposes. Mrs. YouE. A. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating vegetables to earn her living. In this farm, she faces a small problem: she does not have enough vegetable seeds to cultivate. She has decided to ask for a loA. to buy these seeds. Her husband, Mr. Chhit Lin, helps her in her farm. Mrs. YouE. A. is 58 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. 

This is a village bank loA. consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nineteen members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it offers the most benefit to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар работает в местном колхозе. Ему 34 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Чтобы занять жену Музаффар держит дома коров и бычка. Жена смотрит за ними и по мере упитанности Музаффар выводит их на базар и продает. Это вносит весомый вклад в его семейный бюджет. Сейчас очень трудно найти высокооплачиваемую работу и поэтому приходится находить различные способы для зарабатывания денег. Музаффар давно слышал про МикроИнвест и когда несколько его односельчан получили здесь займ он тоже решил присоединиться к ним и подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Muzaffar works in the local collective farm. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. To keep his wife busy Muzaffar has cows and one calf at home. His wife looks after the animals and Muzaffar takes them to the market when they are grown enough and sells them. This brings a very good income into their family budget. Right now it's very hard to find a good high paying job and this is why it is necessary to look for other sources of income. Muzaffar has heard of MicroInvest a long time ago and when one of his fellow villagers got a loan he too decided to join and applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf and fodder

loans.name: Tusikose Yote Group

texts.en:
Zainab is a clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zainab is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 8, 4, and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zunubi, MwanaJ., and Zuwena. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma O. grows corn. She is 36 years old and has two children. She started farming after she decided to get married and have a family. She still has her cornfield. She sells all her harvest to her regular buyers in the nearby village. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. Some of the loan also will be used to start another line of business to supplement the family income.

Many times, Emma was down in her business. However, because of her strong partnership with CEVI, she was able to overcome the downturn. CEVI keeps its promise to provide easy access to loan services. In addition to that, she also receives training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is 34 years old; she is married and the mother of two children. Currently both her children are in school. She lives at Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who deals in assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking, that is, house to house selling. She has been trading for five years now. She also carries cosmetics products and baby care products.

Lydia has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more of the products such as cooking utensils, cosmetics, and baby care products which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers.

With the loan she believes she will be better placed to make lots of profit to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the street selling her goods. She would be grateful for your assistance. Lydia belongs to a village bank called ‘Power and might.

loans.use: increase her stock of inventory such as cooking utensils

loans.name: Kuyu

texts.en:
Kuyu L. sells cooking oil and charcoal and is requesting a loan to open a charcoal store. Kuyu is 49 years old and lost her husband in the 21 year liberation struggle for Southern Sudan. She has six children who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy tanks for water to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a charcoal store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is a typical woman whose only ambition is to see her family happy. And in order to do that, she helps her husband in supporting their three children’s schooling and meeting their daily needs. Despite her age (she’s 41 now), Josefina remains vigorous in the midst of the adversities. 

She shared their life as tenants before and the hardships of being one. She confessed borrowing money from their buyer and used it as starting capital. She endured the high interest rate attached with that loan because she had no other option.  But when she heard about the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and the variety of their services, she felt as though she was relieved from carrying a heavy load. 

She now applies for Php 15,000.00 loan from CEVI as additional capital as she aims to expand the business so that later she will be able to buy a carabao, a farm animals use by farmers to plow the field. Aside from meeting her financial needs, Josefina has no regret of joining CEVI because aside from easy access to loans, she enjoys their group meetings and reflections.

loans.use: farming necessities

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ахмедова Саломат женщина , которая торгует на рынке «Сомон» женской одеждой. Она кредитуется пятый год.Хочет на полученный кредит съездить в Бишкек и привезти летние блузки для женщин и платья. Саломат благодарит организацию и инвесторов за финансирование и понимание и поддержку. За период кредитования у неё увеличился товарооборот и следовательно прибыль.На снимке Саломат в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Salomat A. is a woman, who sells women’s clothing at the Somon market. She has been our client for the fifth year. She wants to use her loan to go to Bishkek and bring summer blouses and dresses for women. Salomat is grateful to our organization and investors for the financing, understanding and support. Over the period of financing, her goods turnover increased and, subsequently, profits. The photograph shows Salomat on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
