Arlene A. is 49 years old, married with 3 school-aged children and a resident of Brgy. Banquerohan, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

Arlene has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and the General Store that she owns and operates for the same length of time now earns her PHP 7,000.00 per month on the average.

As member no. 41-245-3 of the Cadiz City Branch of NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arlene has consistently paid back the loans she has taken to expand her business for the past ten years. Now on her 19th loan cycle, Arlene intends to borrow PHP 10,000.00 for additional working capital so that she could stock her store with more goods to sell.

Arlene is one of many women entrepreneurs in the island of Negros who strive hard to be financially independent and to help their families achieve economic stability, and not to remain dependent on the still pervasive mono-crop sugar industry in the province.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: MORE STOCKS TO SELL IN HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Edruis

texts.es:
La señora Edruis es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos, ella estudió educación superior incompleta, vive en el Comunidad Casa Blanca.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir ganado menor (ovinos).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a comprar ganado mayor (vacunos) para engorde.

Su deseo es comprar su casa en Arequipa y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Sra. Edruis is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), which is located in the District of Asillo, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 3 children. Sra. Edruis received some higher education, but did not complete a degree. She lives in the community of Casa Blanca. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost one year. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used to acquire sheep. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase cattle for fattening. She hopes to buy a house in Arequipa and educate her children. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle for fattening

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 4 hijos, ella es iletrada, vive   el  Centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas de 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo será invertido en la compra de ganado menor esta actividad la realiza en las comunidades cercanas, luego los vende en las ferias de la zona que se realizan una ves por semana.
Andrea también se ayuda con trabajos de artesanía como chompas para pedidos.

Su deseo es poder compra ganado mayor y venderlo a los mayoristas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the town of López in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 32 years old, lives with a partner and is the mother of four children. She is illiterate and lives in the town of López. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for more than three years. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase grocery supplies. She is now requesting an additional loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of small livestock. She will sell them in the nearby communities’ weekly town fairs. Andrea also makes crafts, such as sweaters, and sells them by order. Her greatest wish is to buy large livestock and sell it to the wholesalers. She enjoys the loan meetings and workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small livestock, cattle, pigs, etc.

loans.name: Shukuru

texts.en:
Shukuru is a 38 year-old mother of three who owns rental units in Mihango Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past 20 years. Shukuru has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to renovate the units she owns. A successful business, Shukuru hopes to build additional units in the near future. Shukuru describes herself as jovial and hard-working.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Renovate rental units

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a 49 year old businessman who operates a herbal medicine business in Machakos town. He has been in this business for ten years. He also does farming as a means of generating additional income.    He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock of herbs, honey and packing materials. He hopes to improve his skills on alternative medicine to better his business. He describes himself as a professional.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal skins to make shoes

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a retailer of vegetables and a hog raiser in their village. She is married to Rogelio, a farmer and a carpenter. They are blessed with two children: Randy and Cora. Cora is a Home and Restaurant Management graduate and works in a restaurant in Manila as a waitress. Sometimes her daughter assists them with their financial needs. 

Carmelita dreams that her son will also finish his studies. However, due to lack of financial resources, he was not able to pursue his education.  She is now hoping that her business will improve enough for them to have a more stable source of income.  She is asking for a loan of PHP7,000 that she needs to buy feed for her hog raising business. She sells her hogs after a few months and her profit from this is used for their daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Sévérine

texts.fr: L. Sévérine est née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ALLAGBE Lawal, Sévérine est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Sévérine habite depuis près de 6 ans, le quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Sévérine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Il y a une douzaine d’année que Sévérine vend des liqueurs de tous genres à Gbogbanou à Cotonou. Sévérine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits et qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter son stock de liqueurs pour satisfaire sa clientèle à l’approche des fêtes, Sévérine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
L. Sévérine was born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to ALLAGBE Lawal, she is the mother of three children who are all in school. For nearly six years, she has lived in the Yénawa district in Cotonou with her husband and children. The couple provides for the family jointly. Sévérine attended school through the secondary level. For a dozen years, she has been selling liqueurs of all kinds in Gbogbanou in Cotonou. She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client, having already benefited from three loans, which have been repaid. To augment her stock of liqueurs, to satisfy her customers as the holidays approach, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy liqueurs

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Bougoula Hameau un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts antérieurs se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font  entre autre  la restauration, la transformation des grains de néré en Sounbala et l’achat vente  de poissons fumés, des savons, des tissus, des condiments alimentaires etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 sacs de 100kg de graines de riz en plus de 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires (pour la restauration) 2 paniers de poissons fumés,  8 cartons de savons,  2 douzaines de tissus  pour hommes et femmes, 5 sacs de 100kg de graine de néré pour le sounbala et 7 colis de condiments (pour la vente). 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché de Bougoula Hameau et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi group are married women who, in average, are 38 years old and have 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in the hamlet of Bougoula, one of the villages of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers and are applying for their fifth joint loan. All previous loans have concluded successfully. Their activities include catering, the processing of néré grains into Sounbala (traditional condiment) as well as the purchase and sale of smoked fish, soap, textiles, food condiments etc.. With this new loan, they are planning buy 3 bags of 100kg of rice with 3 packs of food condiments (for catering) 2 baskets of smoked fish, 8 cartons of soap, 2 dozens fabrics for men and women, 5 bags of 100kg of néré seed for Sounbala and 7 packages of seasonings (for sale). They buy products from markets in the town of Sikasso as well as neighboring villages. They sell their products at the market of Bougoula and at their homes, to a client base of men and women that pay in cash but also often in credit. They envision they will each make an average monthly profit of 45,500 FCFA, part of which will be used for savings and family needs, the rest being reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, condiments, fish, seeds, soap and fabrics for retail and catering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy deep-frozen food

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe P., 39, is a hard working single mom. She has one child who is in grade school and she makes sure that she earns enough for their everyday living expenses.  She has been making and selling processed food for ten years. She also directly sells clothing and silver for extra income. 

Febe has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than seven years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used almost all the money she borrowed for buying ingredients for her processed food business.   Her three current businesses let her earn a profit of PHP 29,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 43,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital for her expanding business so she can buy more processed food ingredients and more clothing and silver to sell. 

She dreams that she can have her own store property for her businesses and she continues to work hard so her child can have a better future.  


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying more processed food ingredients and more clothing and silver to sell.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol R. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Manalungon of Santa Catalina in the province of Negros Oriental. She earns her living by vending fish and operating a general store business.

Carol’s husband Edmund is 55 years old and a fisherman.  They have three children, two who help their father in his fishing business.  Both Carol and her husband dream to improve their living conditions and to sustain the needs of her family.

Carol R. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000 from her business activities.

Carol R. is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 5,000 was used to fund operations of her fish vending, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 12th loan, the amount of Php 10,000, which she intends to use to buy supplies for her fish vending and general store. Carol is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding merchandise variety

loans.name: Makump Family Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'Makump Family'. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families’ well-being. 

Idrisa T. pictured on the right is the leader of this group. Idrisa T. was born in Makump village about 5 miles from Makeni. The 35-year-old is married with 7 children – 4 in secondary school and 3 in primary school. For many years now, Idrisa has been selling mints, chewing gum, biscuits, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy mints, chewing gum, biscuits, etc. wholesale for resale

loans.name: Kunduzkan Eratova's Group

texts.ru:
Кундузкан работает преподавателем в средней школе. Ей 41 год. Ее супруг в данное время находится на заработках в РФ. У нее 4 детей и все школьники. После работы в свободное время клиент присматривает за домашним скотом, ей помогают ее старшие дети. У нее имеется дойная корова, с которой она получает молоко и реализует в городе Ноокат. Кредит будет использован для закупа еще одной дойной коровы.

Гулчехра, 44, замужем и мать 4 детей:по 2 сына и дочери. Два сына уже работают отдельно и таким образом поддерживают семейный бюджет. Она также работает учителем в школе, как и предыдущая участница  группы. Кредит будет использован для закупа 3 баранов для откорма и перепродажи.

Замире 47 лет. Она занимается животноводством. Ее супруг  Сабиров Шакир работает в России. Перед тем как заняться животноводством, она достаточно долгое время занималась торговлей. Кредит будет использован для закуп бычка и отправки его на пастбище.

Максуда, 48, замужем. У нее 5 детей, самой старшей 22 года, а младшей всего 2 годика. Клиент является завучом в школе. Как дополнительный источник дохода, она несколько лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Сейчас у нее есть 4 овца. Также она собирается приобрести корову и отправить на пастбище.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kunduzkan works as a teacher in a secondary school. She is 41 years old. Her husband is working in the Russian Federation at this time. She has four children and they all go to school. After work during her free time she looks after the cattle at home and her children help her. She has a milk cow from which she gets the milk and sells it in the town of Nookat. She will use the loan to buy one more milk cow. Gulchehra is 44, she is married and is a mother of four children: two sons and daughters. Two sons are already working and by that support the family budget. She also works as a teacher in school as the other participant of this group. The loan will be used to buy three sheep for feeding and resale. Zamira is 47 years old. She does animal husbandry. Her husband, Shakir Sabirov, works in Russia. Before she started animal husbandry business, she has been in the retail business for a long time. The loan will be used to buy a calf and send it to the pastures. Maksuda is 48 years old, she is married. She has five children. Her oldest daughter is 22 years old and the youngest one is only two years old. She works as an assistant principle in school. She has started an animal husbandry business several years ago as an additional source of income. Right now she has four sheep. She also plans to buy a cow and send it to the pastures.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To muy one milk cow, sheep, calf

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Attotinga au Bénin, Y. Viviane est mariée à AMOUSSOU André, un tailleur, et est mère de sept enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Deux des enfants ne sont plus à la charge de Viviane et de son mari. Il y a près de 15 ans que la famille vit au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Viviane n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et porter une aide financière à son mari, Viviane vend du sel de cuisine et divers autres produits (conserves de tomates et de sardine, pâtes alimentaires, savons, condiments de sauce, etc.) à Allada. Viviane achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et parfois à Allada. Viviane mène cette activité depuis dix ans et a obtenu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Viviane n'arrive plus à tous les satisfaire, et sollicite donc un quatrième prêt. Ce prêt lui servira à rehausser son activité pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Attotinga in Benin, Viviane Y. is married to André AMOUSSOU, a tailor, and is the mother of seven children, all having attended (or are still attending) school. Two of the children are no longer under their parents’ care. For the past 15 years, the family has lived in the Dogoudo borough of Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Viviane has not attended school. To meet her needs and help her husband financially, she sells kitchen salt and various other products in Allada (canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, soap, sauce condiments, etc.). She gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and sometimes in Allada. Viviane has been in this line of business for ten years and has already been granted three loans from ALIDé, all of which were repaid in full. Facing an increasingly important customer demand, she is no longer able to satisfy all customers, and is therefore requesting a fourth loan. This loan will be used to bolster her activity to increase customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 4 cases of canned tomatoes, 4 cases of pasta, and one ton of kitchen salt.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Gonido sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de charbon de bois à l’image de Tata Traoré et de  céréales.
Ces femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire et Tata Traoré compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en sacs de charbon de bois. 
Elle approvisionne généralement  à Fana auprès des producteurs et effectue  sa vente sur place, au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 7.500FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Tièssiri group are all married and are, on average, 33 years old, have four children and live in traditional extended families in Gonido, in the Fana prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through family ties and are engaged in the sale of food condiments, charcoal--like Tata Traoré--and cereals. These women of the Tièssiri group are on their fourth joint loan and Tata Traoré plans to use hers to buy cartloads of sacks of charcoal. She generally gets her supplies from producers in Fana and makes her sales from home, at the market in Tingolé and in neighboring markets, at retail, in cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. She plans to clear a monthly profit of 7,500 FCFA which will be used to meet the daily expenses of the family and the rest will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: 06.03.02 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Huy N. (60302011) is a 49-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Huy is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 60302 (060302-Hoang Hoa).


Huy is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, Huy operates a family member's business raising cattL. for saL..  Huy has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Huy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Huy from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Huong (60302021) is a 40-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  V. T. Duyen (60302021) is a 55-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Thong (60302002) is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,124,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huy N. (60302011) là 1949 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Huy là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 60302 (060302-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Huy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huy kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND.  Vào 2003, Huy đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huy đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Huong (60302021) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  V. T. Duyen (60302021) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Thong (60302002) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2124000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Alcatraz De San Marcos Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA ALCATRAZ DE SAN MARCOS YA QUE ES UNA FLOR MUY BONITA QUE LES AGRADA A TODAS Y SAN MARCOS POR QUE ASI SE LLAMA LA COMUNIDAD DONDE VIVEN LA S SIETE INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON: HERMINIA, LEONCIA,FELICITAS, MARTINA, LIOVA, GAUDENCIA Y ANGELA TODAS ELLAS SE DEDICAN A LA ELABORACION DE ALFARERIA (CAZUELAS,JARROS,OLLAS,LOZA, ETC.)

DOÑA LIOVA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO DESDE HACE TRES CICLOS ES VIUDA TIENE DOS HIJOS UN HOMBRE QUE YA NO ESTUDIA Y UNA MUJER QUE VA A LA SECUNDARIA. ELLA QUIERE AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO Y EN UN FUTURO PODER EXPORTAR SU MERCANCIA A OTROS PAISES PARA ASI PODER SACAR ADELANTE  A SUS HIJOS Y A LA QUE ESTUDIA PODER AYUDARLA A QUE VALLA A LA UNIVERSIDAD.

CON ESTE CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR BARRO POR BULTO, LEÑA POR CARGA, PINTURA Y GRETA PARA ELABORAR CAZUELAS, OLLAS, JARROS, PLATOS DE LOZA, MACETAS , ETC Y PODER VENDERLAS EN LA CIUDAD DE MEXIXO Y ALREDEDORES DE PUEBLA Y MORELOS Y ASI SACAR MAS GANANCIAS PARA APOYAR A SUS HIJOS

DOÑA LIOVA NOS COMENTA QUE SE SIENTE MUY AGUSTO CON EL GRUPO YA QUE ES PURA PERSONA PAGADORA Y PUNTUAL Y COMENTA QUE ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON FUNDACION REALIDAD POR EL CREDITO OTORGADO Y A KIVA ESPERA QUE SEAN BUENOS RESULTADOS LOS QUE OBTENGAN CON ESTE TRABAJO Y PUEDAMOS SEGUIR CONTANDO CON ELLOS MAS ADELANTE.
texts.en:
This loan group is called "Alcatraz de San Marcos" after a very pretty flower that everyone likes and the community of San Marcos, where the seven group members live. The group members work in the following trades: Hermina, Leoncia, Felicitas, Martina, Liova, Guadencia, and Angela are all potters and make casseroles, jars, pots, crockery, etc Liova has been a member of the group for three loan cycles, and is a widow and has two children - one boy who has finished his studies, and one girl who goes to secondary school. She wants to grow her business for the future so she can export her merchandise to other countries. This would let her and her children move forward in life and would enable the girl who is in school to go to university. With this loan she wants to buy clay in bulk, loads of fire wood, and paint in order to make casseroles, pots, jars, china plates, flowerpots, etc and to sell them in Mexico City and around Puebla and Morelos and so to earn more income to support her children. Liova tells us that she feels very comfortable with the group and that she is a very reliable repayer and punctual, and she comments that she is very grateful to the Foundation and Kiva for offering her a loan and she hopes that she will show them good results from her work and that the group can continue working with them in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clay, wood, etc

loans.name: Productive Women Group

texts.en:
Susie H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Productive Women. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children who range from 9 to 24 years old. She was only able to attend school through eighth grade. She cares for two siblings and all of her children are attending school.

For 11 years, she has been selling rice, pepper, oil, salt, and onions at the Freeport Market in Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers get attracted to her business because she talks to them in a friendly manner. She plans to use her 15,000 LRD portion of this 66,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, pepper, oil, salt, and onions. She describes herself as a quiet person. Her goal is to expand her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Augustine is inset at lower right because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more rice, pepper, oil, salt, and onions.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 40 years old and married with two children.  She earns her income from her retail shop which has been running for six years.  In addition, she rents out houses. Since she joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Delta, she has learned how to manage her finances by saving her money with the group.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to add to her stock of sugar, cooking fat, sweets and maize flour. She hopes to build apartments in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, sweets and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Essoyomeuve

texts.fr: Aya est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois et de bois de chauffage, elle s’approvisionne au nord du Togo car dans cette zone le sac de charbon de bois revient moins coûteux, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.  Son stock de marchandises a subit une baisse elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de charbons de bois et des bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
Aya is married with two children. To earn a living she sells charcoal and firewood. She buys them in northern Togo, where charcoal is cheaper. Her customers are from all backgrounds. Because her stock ran low, she would like to build it up again. That is why she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy charcoal and firewood.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ada Violeta

texts.es:
Ada tiene 49 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, un distrito agrícola de regular movimiento comercial, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es una mujer que siempre trata de trabajar de la mejor manera para progresar y sacar adelante a los suyos, por las mañanas vende carne de pollo en su vivienda y por las tardes vende papas rellenas (plato típico del país consistente en una masa frita de papa sancochada que previamente ha sido 'rellena' con carne, verduras y algunas especias), Ada cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su vivienda para adquirir los productos que ofrece. Estos negocios le permiten agenciarse de ingresos estables con los cuales saca adelante a su familia.

Ada desea ampliar su negocio de venta de carne de pollo adquiriendo mas mercadería, de modo que pueda captar mas clientes y aumentar sus ventas por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Ada is 49 years old and lives with her family in the Chepén district; an agricultural district where business is regularly conducted. It’s located in the province of the same name, within the La Libertad region, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is a woman who is always looking for ways to work better to progress and move her family ahead. She sells poultry in the morning out of her home, and in the evening she sells stuffed potatoes (a typical national dish consisting of fried stewed potato dough that has been previously stuffed with meat, vegetables and spices). Ada has regular customers who regularly visit her house to buy the products that she offers. These businesses allow her to earn stable incomes with which she moves her family ahead. Ada would like to expand her poultry business by acquiring additional merchandise in order to attract more customers. She is requesting her first loan of 1, 500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest desire it to be able to continue working to move her family ahead. She is very well known and respected by her neighbors and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has been farming for the last 25 years on the outskirts of Kitale town in Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans and milk, which she sells locally. She also operates a small restaurant in her area. Her biggest challenges have been poultry diseases and fluctuation in the market price of her products.

Veronica has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will enable her to improve the standard of living of her family.

Veronica is 47 years old. She is married and has been blessed with seven children between the ages of 14 and 28. Four of the children are currently attending school. She hopes that in five years time, she will not only be keeping the indigenous birds, but also keeping layers and broilers.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Kisaakua Ole

texts.en:
Kisaakua has been buying, rearing, and selling animals in Naivasha town for the last 4 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Susan Koisaba, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy goats and sheep which he rears and sell later at a profit.

Kisaakua also wants to start cultivating his piece of farmland and plant wheat for commercial purposes.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for resale

loans.name: Rosarie

texts.en:
Rosarie E. is from the village of R.J Macias. She is 32 years old. Rosarie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosarie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Rosarie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosarie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat is 42 years old and married to M. H.. Both reside in a mid-sized city called Vehari, in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agriculture industry.  

They are very simple and helping in nature. Jannat is purely a housewife and prefers to stay at home handling household chores and taking care of her family. She and her family have built their habit to wake up early in the morning. In this way, they stay fresh for a long time and do their work efficiently.  

Her husband is involved in the animal-selling business. He buys animals of a young age from the market, grows them up and then resells them to the required customers. He has been in this profession for the past 10 years. He keeps the animals at his house and takes care of them.  

Jannat also helps him by taking care of his animals by giving them timely food and water and keeping their place clean to avoid diseases.  

Jannat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy young animals (goats and sheep) for his business. She is hopeful that this investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and his income will become double in size and her family’s living standards will become better. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is slightly raising her hand is Jannat.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en:
Kurbon is 27 years old and married with two children. Kurbon sells children's clothing and footwear. He has been in this business for three years. Kurbon attracts customers with good client service and affordable prices and has many repeat clients. Kurbon would like to borrow $2300 USD to increase his assortment. His business goal is to start a second location to make more money for his family. This business is the only source of income for his family.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Jony Alexis

texts.es: El señor Jony Alexis, tiene 24 años es soltero y no tiene hijos. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de videojuegos, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues ha sido muy importante para mantener a su negocio.  Este negocio empezó hace 4 años con muy poco capital de trabajo solamente tenía 3 nintendos pues poco a poco fue aumentando para tener más videojuegos, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues aduce que han sido beneficiosos. el financiamiento para la compra de controles, discos y reparar unos televisores que son necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jony Alexis is 24 years old, single, and has no children.  He has a video game business.  

This isn't the first time he's received financing, and it has been vital to the maintenance of his business.  The business started 4 years ago, with very little working capital.  He only had 3 Nintendos, but bit by bit he grew it to more video games, proving that the prior financing was beneficial.  

This loan will be for the purchase of controls, discs, and repair of some monitors that are needed for his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Gaza City in Gaza Strip. The family owns a coffee roaster and produces coffee for sale as well as all kinds of spices to sell to shops and vendors. Susan works as an employee. Together with her husband's income, they take care of two daughters, Sarah and Asala, and two sons, Ahmed and Muhammad. Susan took out a loan from FATEN as her husband needs to purchase a large amount of coffee beans to increase  production in order to increase their customers and secure a better life for the children.

Nayef, Susan's husband, appears in the photo as she comes from a conservative background and doesn't want her picture online

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase coffee beans

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; La socia tiene 37 años de edad, ella es casada; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de joyería y artesanía, la socia se dedica a fabricación de aretes, collares en alambre y con mostacillas; también elabora parte de la artesanía y también compra al por mayor de sus proveedores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “LOS DIAMANTES” ["The Diamonds"] communal bank. The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Justina, and she is 37 years old. She is married and has 1 child. Her work is selling jewelry and handicrafts. She works making earrings and necklaces using wire and beads. She also makes some of the handicrafts she sells, and she buys some on a wholesale basis from her suppliers. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying supplies for her business.
 
The borrower values and appreciates the loan provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in supplies for her business

loans.name: Daniel  Tariton

texts.en:
Daniel Tariton, aged 29, sells quarry stones at Ngurunga, a very busy but remote area. He is a single man. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Daniel has been selling quarry stones for a period of 10 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 15,000. This loan of Kshs 50,000 is his third loan with KADET. The previous loans were paid with no problem. With this loan, he plans to buy quarry stones for sale.  If the loan boosts the business, he will purchase livestock to trade in the near future.

Daniel describes himself as hardworking. He dreams that he will become a prominent business man in future.

loans.use: To buy quarry stones for sale

loans.name: Efficacité Plus Group

texts.en:
Alain is a leader of the community bank named “Efficacité Plus,” which is composed of 15 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Alain, 30 years old, single and taking care of his younger brother, is a bread provider in his area located in the northern and most populated area of Kinshasa. In business since 2001, he makes about $35 per week through his sales. His plans are to use the next loan to diversify his business by adding a telephone booth in order to increase his income. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having received and fully repaid seven loans. He dreams of one day opening a bread facility to provide his area with loaves of bread.

loans.use: To purchase a small generator in order to increase the ouput

loans.name: Taylor

texts.en:
Taylor F., age 35, provides general alteration and tailoring services in his local community. He has five years of experience in this business. He is unmarried and has no children.  

Taylor is requesting a loan of WST 1,000 in order to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles and thread. He plans to use the improved earnings from his business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Taylor joined SPBD.  This is his first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Taylor's only access to capital because he was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread

loans.name: Nestor José

texts.es:
El Sr. Néstor José P. E. se dedica a laborar como conductor en la Alcaldía de León  dedicándose a esta labor desde  hace 15 años, es soltero con tres hijos a los que tiene que mantener. 
El Señor P. tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda debido a que está en mal estado, es por ese motivo que acude a Ceprodel a solicitar crédito para compra de materiales de construcción tales como: bloque, hierro, arena, piedrín, cemento, zinc. Para iniciar la construcción de una pared de su casa  y cambio de techo.
Con esta mejora que realiza en su vivienda está brindando una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Néstor José P. E. works as a driver for the City of León and has been in this job for 15 years.  He is single and has three children to support.

Mr P. needs to improve his home as it is in a bad state of repair.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel so that he can buy building supplies such as: blocks, iron, sand, gravel, cement and sheets of corrugated metal roofing so that he can begin building a wall in his home and replace his roof.

This improvement he is making to his home will provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy blocks, iron, sand, gravel, cement and sheets of corrugated metal roofing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Anahid from Al Bayader, Amman , is a 37 year-old married woman and mother of 4. Years ago, Anahid learned to sew and design clothes and started her own business in fashioning and embroidering dresses. She used the first two loans that she took from Tamweelcom to develop her business by purchasing new machines and training women. Anahid is requesting a loan of 300JOD to purchase new sewing machine and train a woman to use it.

An aspiration of Anahid is to expand her business and employ additional women to help them improve ther living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa A. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Diosa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Diosa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling hotdogs & sausages from PUREFOODS in the local community. Diosa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Diosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Diosa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like hot dogs & sausages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Diosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like hot dogs & sausages

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transport business. Her husband Victor, who is 30 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 4 and 9 years old. Helen Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 to buy an additional unit of motorcycle so that she can earn higher profits. Helen Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase an additional unit of transport vehicle

loans.name: Charasol (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Charasol  está conformado por 8 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las que les permiten ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, nuestras socias son mujeres luchadoras y a pesar de las dificultades en sus trabajos y negocios nunca dejan de sonreír. Viven en la ciudad de Azogues que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus calles, iglesias y deliciosa gastronomía que le cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

La Señora. Blanca G. vive en el entro de la ciudad de Azogues, se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta porque le han permitido crecer en su negocio, ella tiene 42 años de edad, es divorciada y no tiene hijos, vive en su casa propia. 
Doña Blanca se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también atiende su tienda de abarrotes que la tiene hace 2 años,  labora en ella de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos, etc. Su mayor sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos

La Señora. Jackeline G. vive en la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4  y 1 año de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres y comparten los gastos del hogar.
Doña Jackeline se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para apoyar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Avon y Yanbal, lleva trabajando en esta actividad hace 2 años. 
Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos para surtir mucho más su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Charasol is formed by eight women that work in different activities that allow them to help the economy of their homes, our members are fighters that in spite of the difficulties in their jobs and businesses they never give up or stop smiling.  They live in the city of Azoques, characterized for the beauty of its streets, churches and delicious gastronomy that locals and out-of-towners like, its people is kind and friendly.

Blanca G. lives downtown in the city of Azoques, this is her fifth loan with the community bank and she likes it because it has allowed her to grow her business, she is 42, divorced, has no children and lives in a house she owns.  In addition to her housekeeping activities, Blanca works at the grocery store she's had for two years, she works there from Monday to Saturday from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.  The money from her loan will be invested in purchasing products for her store such as: rice, sugar, oil, detergent, deli, etc.  Her wish is to travel to the United States.

Jackeline G. lives in the city of Azoques, she is 26 years old, married and has two children ages four and one.  Her husband is a driver, they don't own a house and live in her parents' house, sharing the expenses with them. Jackeline takes care of her children, but to support the home economy she sells Avon and Yanbal cosmetics, she has been selling these products for two years.  She is on her fifth credit with the community bank, which will be invested in purchasing perfumes, lotion, jewelry and cosmetics to stock up her store.  Her goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, deli, perfume, lotion, jewelery, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Migna

texts.es: Migna de 33 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa; esta casada con Vladimir de 36 años de edad y tienen 02 hijos Joseph de 14 años y  John de 08 años respectivamente y juntos viven en su propia casa. Migna, es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Migna es comerciante tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Santa Rosa. La bodega de Migna es la primera en abrirse, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que suceden en su ámbito circular, lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias y abrir un puesto de carnicería en su mismo distrito. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de los integrantes. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
33 year-old Migna is from Santa Rosa district.  She is married to 36 year-old Vladimir and they have two children: 14 year-old Joseph and 8 year-old John.  They live together in their own home.

Migna is a very industrious woman who works hard in order to do well in spite of the adversities that fate often provides.  Migna is a saleswoman who has a grocery store in Santa Rosa district market.  Migna's store is always the first to open.  She opens her business at 6.00am and is ready to greet her first customers.  Her customers know that she sells a good variety of merchandise in her store and so don't hesitate to buy from her as they know that they will find what they need.

What Migna most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers and thereby staying up to date with what is happening in the community around her.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her feet almost all day long.

Migna will use the loan she has requested to buy more food products for her business so that she can stock it with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to invest her profits and open a butcher's shop in the same district.

This is Migna's eighth loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in repaying her previous loans and she hopes to continue being punctual.  Migna is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Wangninan De Dessah 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement WANGNINAN DE DESSAH 2 est composé de 23 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier et qui mènent ensemble certaines activités. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Agossi Emilienne, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Agossi Emilienne est née le 30 Juin 1972 à Ifangni, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à un maçon du nom de Lucien, Agossi Emilienne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a environs quinze ans que la famille s'est installée à Tchaada / Dessah dans l'Ouémé. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Depuis cinq ans, Agossi Emilienne mène comme activité la vente de maïs et d'huile de palme qu'elle transforme ensemble avec ses autres membres. C'est au marché d'Ikpinlè et aussi à Cotonou que Agossi Emilienne s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Agossi Emilienne sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de diversifier davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Group WANGNINAN OF DESSAH 2 is composed of 23 members who live all in the same neighborhood and who undertake certain activities together. 

The president, named Agossi Emilienne, has a hand raised on the photograph. 

With the aim of raising the level of their activity in order to better face the demands of their customers, this group solicits their first financial support from ALIDé. 

Agossi Emilienne was born on June 30, 1972 in Ifangni, in the department of l' Ouémé. 

Married to a mason of the name of Lucien, Agossi Emilienne is mother of four children, all in school. The family has been in Tchaada/Dessah in l' Ouémé for about fifteen years.

The couple carry the household together. 

Agossi Emilienne has sold corn and palm oil that she transforms together with the other members.

The supply is from the market d' Ikpinlè as well as in Cotonou. 

With an aim of increasing her business and of satisfying her customers, Agossi Emilienne requests a loan from ALIDé.

Her ambition is to diversify her activity to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and bags of maize

loans.name: Estela Lili

texts.es:
Estela de 49 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su trabajo que decidió poner su papelería en su sector.

Ella labora diariamente y en todo el día por que su papelería lo tiene en su mismo domicilio, le afecta en su negocio la delincuencia ya que por el sector esta peligroso. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, papelería, plumas, para aumentar sus ingresos. 

Ella anhela agrandar su negocio con mas mercaderia para que sus clientes se hagan fieles al comprar la mercaderia.
texts.en:
Estela, 49, is an inspiirational woman in her work who decided to open a stationery store in her area.

She works all day because she has her stationery store in her home, but there are problems because the area where she lives is dangerous.  She will use the loan to buy notebooks, stationery, and pens to increase her income.

Estela would like to enlarge her business with more merchandise for her customers so that they remain loyal and buy from her.

loans.use: To buy stationery, pens and notebooks

loans.name: Nelcy Rossmeri

texts.es:
Nelcy es una joven de 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Oyotun  en Chiclayo.

Nelcy se dedica  a la crianza de aves de corral (gallinas, patos y pavos) el apoyo de sus padres le permitió a Nelcy ser experta en este negocio. Ella ahora cuenta con una clientela establecida, que son los pobladores de su zona.

Nelcy solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de pavos y en el alimento balanceado que la crianza de estos requiere. Nelcy tiene muchos deseos de expandir su  negocio para poder independizarse de su familia.

Nelcy goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Nelcy is a young woman, who is 25 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the district of Oyotun in Chiclayo.

Nelcy raises poultry (chickens, ducks and turkeys) and has become an expert in this business with the support of her parents. The inhabitants of her zone have become her loyal clientele. 

Nelcy is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 1000 nuevos soles that she will use to buy turkeys and the balanced food required to raise them. Nelcy would really like to expand her business in order to become more independent from her family.

Nelcy has very good personal and professional references.

loans.use: buy ducks and balanced food.

loans.name: Mirna Natividad

texts.es:
Mirna de 44 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de comidas en la parte delantera de su casa. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha incrementado su clientela. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  Vende almuerzos a un precio de $ 1.80, la cual continúe caldo, segundo y jugo. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando para mejorar su estilo de vida y mejorar su negocio y vivienda. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
Mirna is 44 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has a business selling meals in the front of her home.  With effort and commitment, she has managed to increase her customer base.

Mirna currently works from 6.00am to 8.00pm every day.  She sells lunches for $1.80 which include soup, main course and juice.  She has many aspirations for her business.  She would like to continue working so that she can improve her lifestyle, her business and her home.  She would like to use this loan to buy cement, sand and blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en: Phuc was born in 1962. She lives in Dai Bi Village, Uy No Commune. She has three children. Two of her daughters are married. Her son is still young. Her husband is a builder. Ms. Phuc is a farmer. She not only grows rice but also raises fish. She has  had this job for 10 years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy food for fish.

loans.use: to buy food for fish

loans.name: Ma. Bona

texts.en:
Ma. Bona is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a small carinderia (eatery). She cooks the food that she sells. Ma. Bona also buys and resells seaweeds.

Ma. Bona plans to use her loan to buy raw ingredients for cooking meals and more seaweeds to sell. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking meals and more seaweeds to sell.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, reside junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, él es empleado de un Banco en la ciudad, actualmente tiene una dificultad con su vehículo ya que tiene desperfectos mecánicos, para solventar esta situación, Julio solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos y pagar el mecánico.
Esta necesidad será solventada por el préstamo, ya que él no dispone de la suficiente disponibilidad de fondos para cubrir los gastos, su objetivo es mantener en buenas condiciones su medio de transporte, para mayor seguridad y menos riesgo de accidentarse.
texts.en:
Julio lives together with his wife and his two children aged 7 and 4.  He works in a bank in the city.  Julio is currently experiencing mechanical problems with his vehicle.  In order to put this right, he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts and pay a mechanic.

Julio will cover his needs with this loan since he doesn't have enough funds available to pay for these expenses.  His goal is to keep his vehicle in good condition as this will make it safer and make him less likely to have an accident.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay a mechanic to fix his vehicle

loans.name: Ana Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana Lilian de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su hijo y su hermano; ella posee una venta de atoles los cuales tienen un sabor exquisito, ella ha devuelto el sabor tradicional al paladar de sus clientes, por ello la prefieren, los prepara todos los días por la tarde para que las personas  lo disfruten; se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque lo vende a precio accesible y es de calidad además les da un servicio excelente, siempre está feliz para recibir a los clientes. Ana Lilian es muy decidida y está dispuesta a ver crecer su negocio para ella la lucha diaria es la madre de todas las cosas, sus ganas de salir adelante la impulsaron a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima por mayor como semilla de marañón, maíz, piña, elotes entre otros para estar a la expectativa del cliente en todo momento y poder satisfacer sus necesidades. Ana Lilian tiene fe que su esfuerzo logre darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Ana Lilian is 43 years old and lives with her son and her brother. She sells atole [a hot corn-based drink] and hers has an exquisite taste. She has returned the traditional flavor to her customers' palates and for this they prefer her. She prepares her atole every day in the afternoon so that people can enjoy it. She has amassed many customers because she sells her product at an accessible price and it is of a high quality. Furthermore, she provides excellent service - she is always happy to receive her customers. Ana Lilian is very determined and is ready to see her business grow. For her, the daily struggle is the mother of all things. Her desire to get ahead compelled her to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to purchase ingredients wholesale, such as cashews, pineapple, and different types of corn. This way, she can be ready for her customers at all times and she will be able to satisfy their needs. Ana Lilian has faith that her efforts will succeed in giving her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cashews, pineapple and different types of corn

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 32 years, is married to Patrick. They have  one child aged ten years. She runs a restaurant and catering services. She has been in this business for a period of three years now. With this loan, she plans to buy more rice, wheat and maize flour for her business.

From the anticipated profit she hopes to expand her restaurant due to the increase of customers on a daily basis.

She desires to own a decent restaurant in Nairobi business center.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old, married and blessed with three children. She is an elementary school graduate who is hopeful of lifting her family from poverty. She has a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner, vinegar, sugar, and salt. She engaged in this business to earn and save for the education of her two school-aged children.

As a store owner, having a creditor is not avoidable, so Maria sees to it that her business will not suffer from the credit of her neighborhood. She is asking a loan amount of Php 8,000 to buy soft drinks, breads and eggs as additional goods to sell in her store. She is thankful that Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. approved her loan.

She hopes that her store will grow and earn a higher income so that they will never experience eating without meat.  Maria wants to continue her dreams through her children. She wants her children to finish school, a vital thing that she never did because of the hardships of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads and eggs as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes and bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 42 year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four young children. He has been working as a car mechanic for 30 years, and he opened the garage he is working at in 2007. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase mechanical machinery to facilitate his business operation. He notes that this machinery will help him repair the cars faster and more easily. 

This is his fifth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing history. Hassan specializes in fixing car bodies and color. In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical machinery

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 29 years old and lives in Toril Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
 Ailen works in the pig industry  for a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase pigs for her piggery. 
Ailen has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Ailen hopes to have big capital for her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her piggery

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past four years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells stationery supplies. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase papers and pens to sell in her shop, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay her family's bills. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another stationery shop on the other side of town. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more paper and pens for resale

loans.name: Margaritas De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS DE SAN ANTONIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Olga. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cultivo de papa, cría de animales, venta de chuño, artesanía en tejido.

La señora Olga  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra alimento para su ganado) que comprará de la Ceja y posteriormente lo repartirá a su ganado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Margaritas de San Antonio" will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Senkata. It is formed by eight members and it is directed by a board of directors, which is led by Olga. The businesses carried by the members of this communal bank are various, and among them are: potato farming, livestock farming, freeze-dried potatoes, and knitted crafts.

Olga indicates that this is the first loan cycle in which she works with Pro Mujer. She joined following an invitation by a promoter. She currently has a business raising cattle and she has had this business for many years. She learned the business from her mother.

The loan that she will take is to increase her capital, to purchase feed for her cattle. She will make her purchases in Ceja and she will later distribute the product among her cattle. This form of work helps her to generate an income to support her family in whatever possible. She is married and she has four children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings program.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a single lady who lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water.
