Saumu has operated a tailoring business for the past 3 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of theft. She aspires to expand her business in the future.

With the 12,500 KES loan, she wants to purchase fabrics and threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get financial help in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads for her business

loans.name: Nuage Plus Group

texts.en:
Kasav is the leader of a community bank named “Nuage Plus”, which is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses.
 
Kasav sells secondhand clothing. She has been in business since 1993. She likes her business and it has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC, and has already received five different loans, repaying them correctly. She intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing a bundle of secondhand clothing to resell, in order to reinforce the working capital. Currently, she earns a profit of $20 every week. Kasav is 44 years old, married and the mother of two children, ages 2 and 7 years old. One goes to school. 

Kasav's dream is to become a used clothing wholesaler in her area.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of secondhand clothing to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El  sr. Paulino    nacido en la localidad de El Torno el se dedica  a la venta de materiales de construcción,  es casado con la señora Sonia tiene tres hijos. El consigue sus materiales de construcción  sacando ripio, arenilla, relleno, del rio pirai, y después lleva a su puesto de venta donde ofrece los materiales de construcción, El Sr. paulino es cliente antiguo de la institución  ya que se encuentran pasando la tercera secuencia el crédito lo utilizara  para la compra de un par de llantas nuevas que le falta para la volqueta  ya que este es su instrumento de trabajo para trasladar el material de construcción al puesto de venta y también a la entrega a sus clientes y así de esta manera continuar trabajando. El se encuentra muy agradecido con la institución ya que siempre que ha necesitado le brindo una mano.
texts.en:
Paulino was born in El Torno; he sells building materials and supplies.  He’s married to Sonia and has three children.  He gets his construction supplies extracting gravel, sand and filler from the Pirai River and then takes it to his sales stand where he puts it up for sale.  

Paulino is a longstanding client of the institution since they are in their third credit sequence.  He will use it to buy a pair of new tires that his dump truck needs since this is his work tool to transport the building materials to his sales point and also to deliver to his customers so that he can continue working.  He is very grateful to the institution because it’s always lent him a hand when he’s needed it.

loans.use: to buy a pair of tires for his dump truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a timber dealer in Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He began this business 8 years ago by selling scrap timber and later moved on and purchased logging machines.

Paul learned about Milango from friends and joined in order to access funding for his business. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase a new stock of timber. He looks forward to being an exporter and importer of timber and timber products in the future; though the main challenges are price fluctuations and the high cost of stock and equipment. The extra income from this loan will enable Paul to educate and feed his children.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of timber.

loans.name: Theodora

texts.fr: Theodora, est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des divers et des plateaux d'oeuf. Elle maîtrise son activité compte tenu de son expérience dans le secteur. Elle s'approvisionne dans des marchés avoisinantes pour revendre en détail. Compte tenu de son emplacement dans le marché et en vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev afin d'accroître son stock de marchandises et de maximiser son profit pour le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Theodora is married with two children. She specializes in the sale of various products including trays of eggs. With her experience in this business, she now has a good command of her activity. She buys her merchandise in neighboring markets for resale at retail. 

Given her location at the market, and in order to meet the needs of her customers, she is seeking a loan from Finadev to stock up on merchandise and maximize her profits. This will help her provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for the store

loans.name: Mukkaram

texts.ru: Муккарам 60-летняя женщина, которая проживает и ведёт свою деятельность в городе Худжанде. Она торгует молочными изделиями творогом, сливочным маслом , сливками, сметаной. Она также перерабатывает сметану в топлёное масло и раздаёт оптом в кондитерские цеха. В это время на месте её заменяет её дочь. У Муккарам нет мужа, он умер в 2000 году, поэтому она самостоятельная женщина, которая содержит семью. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет увеличить производство топлёного молока, закупив сырьё.
texts.en: Mukkaram is a 60 year-old woman, who lives and runs her business in the city of Khujand.  She sells dairy products, such as cottage cheese, butter, heavy cream and sour cream.  She also makes clarified butter from sour cream and sells it wholesale to confectionery factories.  During that time, her daughter fills in for her at her retail outlet  Mukkaram does not have a husband, as he passed away in 2000, and this is why she is an independent woman, who supports her family.  Mukkaram wants to use this loan to increase the production of baked milk by buying raw materials.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for production of baked milk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 29 year old, married, and has four children.  All of them are in school.
Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 62-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with four adult children.

She and her husband reared their children for the past 15 years by operating their hog raising business, and also through fishing. This is quite difficult because raising hogs takes a few months before it will turn into cash. 

Because of that, Rosario is requesting a loan to buy piglets and feed as well. In the future, she dreams to expand her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Gladiz Isabel

texts.en: My name is Gladiz Isabel and my primary activity is commerce. I have a grocery store in my home in the center of my community. I have been doing this type of work for several years, and it generates income to cover my family expenses and other commitments I have to my providers. My business is very important to me since I use the profits earned to pay for my children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages, coffee, sugar, butter, candy, rice, dairy products, deli meats and soap.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Mrs. Tim S. is a 64 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her three children.  She makes and sells traditional Khmer cake at her bakery. She earns $5/day in this business.  One of her children works at a garment factory and helps her mother support the family.  This loan will be used to buy baking tools and materials for additional cakes.  In the future, she would like to remain in the cake business.  She hopes that she can support her children in their schooling so that they eventually learn specialized skills to obtain a good job.

loans.use: to purchase tools for her business

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Some months ago I began the construction of a bathroom but I've not been able to finish it. I would like to finish it now since what we have is not very hygienic for my family. I request $1,000 to finish the construction of a bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace algunos meses empecé la construcción de un baño pero no he podido terminarlo, quisiera terminarlo ahora ya que el que tenemos no es muy higiénico para mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de un baño.

loans.use: To finish the construction of a bathroom - Terminar la construcción de un baño

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mrs. Beatrice O. sells machine parts to the community. She started this business in 1995 after undergoing her 6 years of training. She is 29 years old and is married with 4 children. LAPO has made a difference to her business. She needs the loan of US$800 to buy more motorcycle spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy more machine spare parts for sale

loans.name: Carmen Lourdes

texts.es:
From the time she was very young Carmen dreamed of cultivating the land of her mother, a dream she has realized. Thanks to these efforts, she is able to grow potatoes and gladiolas which she sells, while still taking care of her home. Recently, her husband was sent on a new project in the city of Casapalca and she has been left in charge of the family. This is very difficult for her with her husband gone. However, Carmen hopes to increase her income from her harvests with a greater quantity of bulbs and fertilizers which will help her grow better products. Help us support this woman as she works so hard. With your help she can reach her goals.

Carmen, desde muy niña soñó con trabajar sembrando en las tierras de su madre, sueño que ahora se consolidó y que gracias al esfuerzo de su madre puede disfrutar de los frutos de sus cosechas de papas y gladiolos, como también disfruta criando a sus cuyes, sin descuidar la atención a su hogar.Ella hasta ahora pudo hacer crecer sus cosechas, pero ahora se suscitó un nuevo proyecto de trabajo para su pareja en la cuidad de Casapalca y ahora ella quedó al cuidado integro de su familia, tarea muy difícil de realizar por el alejamiento de su esposo.Sin embargo, Carmen, tiene la esperanza de obtener mayores ingresos en sus cosechas con mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes que le ayudará a tener mejores productos.Apoyemos a una mujer que lucha para seguir sembrando sus productos, con vuestra contribución lo logrará.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE BULBS AND FERTILIZERS TO INCREASE HER HARVESTS.  SHE NEEDS TO INCREASE HER INCOME TO BETTER SUPPORT HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Olinda Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Olinda belongs to the communal bank Luchando por Nosotras (fighting for ourselves). She lives in the Pasaje Pomarosa Mz B Lt. 7, in the Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 43 years old and is mother to 3 children whom she adores. Her husband is a technician but his income is not enough, so with the firs loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00), Olinda decided to invest in a small general store.

Currently, Olinda has a well-stocked general store, as well as an Internet and typing business in her own home. Every day she wakes up looking forward to keep working, and the housework is not unattended because she can count on the support of her beloved husband.

With the loan she recently received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 2,000 (US$ 669.00 approx.) which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy 1 printer, 2 reams of paper, 2 sacks of rice, 6 boxes of sodas, and 2 sacks of sugar.

Olinda is very happy for everything she has achieved thanks to the support of her family and the staff of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Olinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Pasaje Pomarosa Mz. B Lt. 7, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad y es madre 3 hijos que son su adoración, su esposo es técnico, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Olinda, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega muy surtida, así mismo tiene su negocio de internet y tipeos en su propia casa, donde todos los días se levanta con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y los quehaceres de la casa no son desatendidos dado que cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2.000, (US$ 669.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará de 1 impresora, 1 millar de papel, 2 sacos de arroz, 6 cajas de gaseosa y 2 sacos de azúcar.

Olinda esta muy contenta por todo lo que esta logrando, gracias al apoyo de su familia, y de las promotoras de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buying assorted products for a general store. (Compra de productos variados (bodega).)

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, age 28, is married with 2 children (ages 8 and 3). She also takes care of her mother, age 56. Salma owns a business where she sells chips and sarongs. She started this business last year in 2007, and now makes a monthly profit of about $280. Her business is open from 1pm to 9pm daily.

Salma hopes for a loan to buy more inventory to sell. She is a member of a loan group called Ushindi, which totals 39 members who keep eachother accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy chips and sarong stock

loans.name: Memmed

texts.en: Memmed R. owns and operates a furniture store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Memmed is 57 years old and is married with three children. He has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently seeking additional funding so that he can make improvements to his store.

loans.use: To make improvements to his furniture store

loans.name: Kagali East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Suzan N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more fabric and thread. Suzan is 39 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Suzan makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy building materials.

Suzan is joined in her small group by Madina N., Esther M., Rose B., and Josephine N.. Madina N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add utensils and saucepans. Esther M. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to purchase in bulk. Rose B. operates a business selling clothes and wants to add to her business. Josephine N. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To add working capital to tailoring business

loans.name: Hira

texts.en:
Hira R. lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Goam Bahadur R., and one son. She lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores. Her husband is a house painter. Her son is studying in grade 3.

Mrs. R. opened her small cafe 2 years ago to strengthen the economic situation of her family. She sells different varieties of food items in her little cafe. Especially, she prepares Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice) for her cafe. She also sells tea and coffee. Her cafe is small but very popular in her locality. So Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy necessary food ingredients for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for her little cafe

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is a sharp young entrepreneur who lives in Simferopol on the Crimean peninsula in southern Ukraine. She owns a profitable women’s clothing business located at the bustling Central Market. Unlike many other clothing vendors, who purchase clothing from wholesalers in Odessa, another city in Ukraine, Olesya purchases inventory from Turkey, which allows her to have a better assortment to sell. Olesya is single and lives with her mother and step-father. Her mother is also an entrepreneur who sells clothing in the market.

Olesya has requested a loan of $1,050 to help open a new sales location. She and a partner are working together on it. This loan will free up some of Olesya’s working capital so she can pursue this business expansion and work to increase her income.

loans.use: Help open a new sales location

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es:
Neyda is a seamstress; she makes bermudas from material her clients bring her. This activity is her main source of income with which she covers the living expenses of her mother and younger brother. Her husband, as many Bolivians, migrated to the Republic of Argentina to work as a tailor. Neyda lives in the Zona Villa Ingenio Distrito II of the town of El Alto. The loan will be spent on buying a sewing machine for her younger brother who has learned from Neyda and that way they will improve their income as there will be an increase of the volume of the products. This is the first loan with Impro, and the evaluation allows approval of the loan requested by Neyda.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Neyda es costurera; confecciona bermudas, no emplea materia prima solo mano de obra, lo cual quiere decir que sus clientes traen sus propias telas. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de madre y hermanito. El esposo, como muchos bolivianos, migró hacia Republica de Argentina para trabajar como costurero. Neyda vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio Distrito II de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una maquina de costura donde trabajara el hermanito menor que aprendió de Neyda y así podrán mejorar los ingresos pues el volumen de producción se incrementará. Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Neyda.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine to increase the volume of bermudas to satisfy growing demands.

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.es:
José Héctor started his business by investing the salary that he earned when he would go to the ranch to work all day and opened a small store for his wife so that she could manage it with the help of their children. Besides having the store, back then he had a small ranch with some cattle but, because of his debt, he decided to sell it. Since he couldn’t find a buyer, he kept the store and made it bigger to offer more. The store was small and didn’t provide sufficient income so he decided to ask for a loan to expand it and sold cheese, milk and cream. Little by little things started going well for him to the point where he didn’t have to sell his ranch. Now the store is well stocked and they sell everything. His wife died and so now one of his children manages it in the mornings and afternoons.

He needs a loan for US$600, which he plans to repay in six months, to buy merchandise and stock his store. With your help, José Héctor will continue to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

José Héctor inició el negocio debido a que el se iba al rancho a trabajar todo el día, entonces decidió invertir su sueldo, poniéndole una tiendita a su esposa para que ella se encargara de la tienda con ayuda de sus hijos, además de tener la tiendita en aquel entonces tenia un pequeño rancho y unas cuantas vacas pero como tenia una deuda decidió venderlo y quedarse con la tiendita para ampliarla y surtir mas como no encontró quien lo comprara, y la tienda era pequeña y no daba los ingresos suficientes decidió pedir préstamo para ampliar e ir surtiendo además de la venta de los quesos, leche y jocoque poco a poco le fue bien al grado que no tuvo que vender su rancho, ahora su tienda esta muy surtida y vende de todo, su esposa falleció, y ahora uno de sus hijo es quien se encarga de cuidarla en las mañanas y el en las tardes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda. Con tu ayuda Héctor seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank Lupakas in the community Huariquisana, belonging to the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Colao. She is fifty years old; she is married and has six children whom she supports. She finished elementary school. With her first loan of S. 300, she invested in the purchase of hemp to make rope.

Celia and her family have been working in the making of rope for 15 years. They start their work at 8:00 AM every morning; by 4:00 PM, they have made 100 products made out of rope. This is how her family is able to succeed.

With this loan of S. 1,000, which she will repay in 4 months, they will buy two packets of hemp-type material, since ropes made of that material are worth more. Celia is happy that her business is increasing her income; she can now buy many things that she wanted for her family. Her dream is to install more machinery so that she can sell retail and wholesale, and that her children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Celia pertenece al Banco Comunal Lupakas de la comunidad Huariquisana, del distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Colao Ilave y Región de Puno. Tiene 50 años de edad, casada, madre de 06 hijos que aun depende de ella, estudió hasta primaria completa. Celia con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que recibió invirtió en compra de material de cáñamo para elaboración de soga. En la actualidad doña Celia junto con toda su familia viene trabajando hace 15 años en elaboración de sogas, inician su trabajo 8:00a.m. hasta 4:00 p.m. logran hacer 100 frazadas de soga, así vienen sobresaliendo con todo su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprarán dos paquetes de material tipo cáñamo, ya que las sogas de ese material tienen un poco más de precio. Celia esta alegre con su negocio por que esta incrementando su capital y además ya puede comprarse muchas cosas que tanto deseaba para su familia. Su sueño grande es implantar más maquinas para elaboración de sogas con el fin de entregar por mayor y menor, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for making ropes

loans.name: Loidith

texts.es:
La señora Loidith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de  bebidas como: gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, pulpin, chupetes y agua mineral. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el AA. HH. 2 de Febrero, Mz F, L-3, donde espera a sus clientes para darles una buena atención.

Se dedica a este negocio más de un año, gracias a su dedicación, las ventas han aumentado ya que es la única que se dedica a este tipo de negocio en su zona.

Con el préstamo de  S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, pulpin (jugos), agua mineral con gas y sin gas, bolsitas para chupetes, frutas de diferentes variedades, azúcar, vainilla, etc., y todo lo que necesita para surtir el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.    

La señora Loidth tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, su meta es crecer en el negocio, tener una bodega grande y bien implementada para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Loidith belongs to the community bank "María Auxiliadora ”. She lives in the region and province of San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. She sells carbonated drinks of various brands, sizes and flavors, juices, “chupetes” (frozen Popsicles), and mineral water. Her business is located in her own home in AA. HH. February 2nd, Mz F, L-3, where she hopes to give good customer service to her clients.

She has worked in this business more than one year and sales have increased, thanks to her dedication and the fact that hers is the only business of its type in the area.

With this loan of 1,000 Soles (about $350), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy carbonated drinks of various brands, sizes and flavors. Also juices, mineral water (with and without carbonation), bags for “chupetes”, a variety of fruits, sugar, vanilla, and all that is necessary to stock her store so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

Loidith is 31 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She is a very hardworking woman whose goal is to build her business to have a large, well-stocked general store to offer convenience to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carbonated drinks, juices, mineral water, fruits, bags for "chupetes", etc.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven N., 51, is married and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has worked collecting rice from house to house for sale. On average, she is able to make around US$4 each day. She says that currently it is difficult to purchase rice because most of the farmers have had a poor harvest. Her husband, Ong Oun, 54, is a rice farmer and normally he makes US$3 each day.

Ven N. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to increase her rice stock and to raise pigs for additional profit. In the future, she plans to purchase a mill with which to provide a grinding service as well.

loans.use: To add increase rice inventory and raise pigs.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: El Sr. Emilio Rodríguez tiene 28 años e inicio su negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios hace aproximadamente 3 años, siendo empleado de su actual empresa. Empezó siendo secretario del negocio, y ante la indisposición del propietario de seguir atendiendo el local por falta de tiempo ya que contaba con otros locales, ofreció al Sr. Emilio venderle a cuota y éste acepto ya que vio una buena posibilidad de negocio. nHace un año que el Sr. Emilio es propietario del negocio, desde entonces gracias a su trabajo fue creciendo económica y comercialmente. Vio una oportunidad para trabajar con nosotros y hoy día solicita un  crédito para la compra de mercaderías ya que se quiere preparar para el gran movimiento comercial que se viene de aquí a fin de año.n
texts.en:
Emilio R., 28, started his business selling cell phones and accessories about 3 years ago, a then employee of the business he now owns. He began as an assistant in the business and when the owner decided to focus on others of his businesses, he offered to sell this one, on installments, to Emilio who accepted what he saw as a good business opportunity. Emilio has now owned the business for a year and, thanks to his hard work, it has grown economically and commercially. He saw a chance to work with us and is applying for a loan to buy merchandise because he wants to prepare for the rush of sales that will come at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Born around 1963 in Mono County in South Benin, Chantal S. married Fidel Dade and is the mother of 5 children. She specializes in the sale of artisanal products such as baskets, brooms, and fans. She also sells more assorted products. She is seeking her third loan to stock up on products and fulfill the growing demand of her consumers.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Née vers 1963dans le Mono au Sud du Bénin,Dame S. Chantal est mariée à DADE Fidèl,mère de cinq enfants, elle s'est spécialisée dans la distribution des produits artisanals tèl que : les paniers ,les éventailles,les ballaie,,,;elle dispose également d'une boutique de vente de produits divers,Dame Chantal pour mieux gérer son activité consacre les wweekend à l'activité du marché et les autrs jours à célui de la boutique de maison qu'est la vente des produits artisanales,Pour renforcer son activité et faire face à la vente de fin d'année; elle sollicite son troisième crédit.

loans.use: Purchase of baskets and shelves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add new clothing to her stock.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Daniel Kodjo is thirty-five years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. His children are currently in the junior high school. His wife is a hairdresser. 

He lives with his family in Somanya in the eastern region of Ghana. The town is dominated by the Krobos, one of the many tribes in Ghana. However, there are quite a number of aliens living there as a result of work placement. 

Kodjo straightens and welds cars that were damaged in accidents. He has a workshop in the community in which he lives. He has been in this business for fifteen years. 

Kodjo wants a loan to acquire some material for his business, such as filler, steel plates, and electrodes. He wants to buy these materials in bulk, so he can also sell them to colleagues and workers in his community who use them for their work.

loans.use: To buy steel plates, electrode, filler, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra Hilda tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella. Vive con su madre quien tiene domicilio propio. Se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y ropa de mujer como ser zapatos, vestidos, etc., los cuales los compra en la feria, ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad. La competencia en este tipo de actividad es muy fuerte debido a que hay muchas promotoras de cosmeticos de diversas lineas. La Sra Hilda tiene varios clientes fijos a los que vende sus productos y tambien manda a España donde tiene su hermana quien tambien los vende alla. El credito sera invertido en la compra de mas mercaderia ya que a mayor monto de ventas ella tiene mayor margen de ganancia y mas premios. La Sra Hilda ha tenido un buen comportamientos de pago ya actualmente tiene un credito vigente en otra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda is 32 years old, single and has no dependent children. She lives with her mother who owns her own house. She sells cosmetics and women's clothing such as shoes, dresses, etc, which she buys at the market – she already has a number of years of experience in this activity.

Her competency in this kind of activity is very strong given that there are a lot of people selling various brands of cosmetics. Señora Hilda has a number of fixed clients who buy her products and she also sends them to Spain where she has a sister who sells them.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise as with a larger amount of sales she gets a bigger margin of profits and more benefits. Señora Hilda has shown good payment behaviour and currently has a loan with another financial institution.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Umri

texts.ru: Умри 36 летняя женщина, мать двоих детей,муж работает мастером по ремонту телевизоров.Сама Умри работает техничкой в больнице "Нур".До обеда она заканчивает свою работу и выходит на торговлю.Её заработная плата не хватает для проживания, поэтому Умри имеет бизнес по продаже продуктов питания.Товар ей привозят сами оптовики поставщики.Кредит Умри хочет использовать для закупа макаронных изделий и другого товара первой необходимости для населения.
texts.en:
Umri is 36 and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a TV repairman. Umri works as a technician in Noor Hospital. She finishes her work before lunch and then goes to the market to trade. Her salary is not enough to live off; therefore, Umri is in business selling food. She buys her goods from wholesalers. Umri wants to take out a loan in order to buy pasta and other goods local residents need.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Шокиров Сафарали проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 71 год.Имеет четверых детей. Старший сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках . Сам он занимается животноводством.Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупный рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safarali S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 71 years old. He has four children. Safarali’s eldest son is working in Russia. Safarali raises livestock. He has a plot where he raises cattle. He would like to take out a loan in order to increase his cattle headcount. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase cattle headcount

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
A. Saodat is a hard-working woman and since 1996 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Dushanbe. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of 4 children that she would like to offer an education as they are minors.

Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood, working at hard labor. To realize this dream, Saodat now requests 1000 USD for a term of 9 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History <> Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables she sells

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario G. is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. She is a corn farmer and trades all her harvest in the market by sacks. From her business, she has been able to raise funds to support her family needs. She wants to grow her business more so that she could easily send all her children to school.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She thinks that she needs to improve the soil condition of her farm to increase her yield. She also plans to start a new business to supplement her income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization organized to respond to the needs of small enterprise. It provides easy access to credit for all its clients. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage services to support businesses' growth.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil M. is 55 years old. He is married and the father of four children. Adil owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by this business. In addition, he works as a head of municipality of his village.

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store., as well as to buy construction materials.

Adil is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is for his children to progress by means of pursuing their education, a goal toward which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To increase inventory and buy construction materials

loans.name: Mary Akwen

texts.en:
Mary is a widow who lives in Nsongwa, Cameroon, and has eight children. She has a farm, like many other people living in her area, and she sells the fruits of her labor in the Bamenda Food Market, about a ten minute drive from Nsongwa. Mary plans to buy cassava and potatoes for farming, manure to fertilize her fields, corn and pineapple. Mary also intends to purchase piglets and chickens. These animals can be useful as an investment and also as fertilizer for one’s farm. Lastly, Mary will buy some small garage tools.

Mary has been a farmer for many years and has experience using loans to fund her farm business. This is Mary’s fourth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2005. She knows from her past experience that she can take on a loan of this size and be successful.

Before she joined GHAPE, her life was very difficult. Her father passed when she was only 13, ending her education. She says she was forced to marry early and since then has lost her husband to a protracted illness leaving her to support her eight children. Mary was “financially not okay,” as she could not cover basic needs.

Mary is a GHAPE member because “GHAPE…empowers the poor” and “has trained me and equipped me with prosperous knowledge.” After being with GHAPE for three years, she has “discovered the benefits of being a GHAPE member.”

With the profits from this loan she will pay for her children’s school fees, provide the best for her children and finish the housing projects her husband left behind. She also wants to save a reasonable percentage in her GHAPE savings account.

About GHAPE Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and a strong bond of trust has developed between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: For cassava, potatoes, manure, corn, pineapples, pigs, chickens and garage tools

loans.name: Hau's Group

texts.en:
Hậu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1965. She lives with her husband and son’s family. Her husband is a builder. She makes brooms to sell. She buys brooms from other people in her village to resell, too. 

She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND( or 240 USD) to buy materials to make brooms. She is a group leader. There are two other fund participants in her group:

 T.ệp Thị Vương sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND ( or 345 USD) to expand her business.

 Xuyến Thị Hoàng has a small shop. She sells fresh coffee. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND ( or 240 USD) to expand the goods she sells.

 Thuy T. N. wants to borrow 3,270,000 VND ( or 190 USD) to invest in her shop, which sells beer, fresh food and ice-cream.

loans.use: To buy materials to make brooms

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn J. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Noralyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. Noralyn owns and operates a specialized retail business in the local community. She sells "RTW" or ready-to-wear items. Noralyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Noralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair their jeepney, a transport vehicle, the business of her husband. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Noralyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: the repair of their "jeepney"

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
MERIAM F. of Brgy. Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental, is a 36 year-old married woman with 3 school-age children who owns and operates a fishing business.

Fishing has been the main source of income for the F. family for the last 10 years, and since Meriam joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, profits from their business and additional loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon has allowed Meriam and her husband to own 2 fishing vessels which they use to catch crabs. This earns them approximately PHP 15,000.00 per month.

Now for her 14th loan with NWTF-Project Dungganon, Meriam wants to borrow PHP 19,500 as additional capital to expand her fishing business even further. Even though the 2 fishing boats already earns them quite a comfortable living, Meriam is striving even harder so that her children will have a better life, and better education.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Nury Yeni

texts.es:
La señora Nury es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 1 hijo, ella estudió educación superior (enfermería técnica), vive en el Barrio las Cruces.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir gaseosas para su negocio.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de venta de salchipapas, para lo que comprara papas, aceite, salchichas, gaseosas, mayonesa, mostaza, etc. Por el momento sus padres se están haciendo cargo de su negocio ya que ella se encuentra delicada de salud.

Su deseo es ejercer su carrera.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Nury is a member of the Community Bank "Las Retamas" located in the district and province of Puno. She is 22 years old, she lives with her partner and she has a son. She studied to be a nursing technician in the district of Cruces. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles which was used to purchase softdrinks for her business. She currently requires a loan in the amount of S/.600 neuvos soles which will be invested in her current business selling sausages and chips. She will use the funds to purchase potatoes, oil, sausages, soft drinks, mayonaise, mustard etc. For the time being her parents have been managing the business because she has been ill. Her wish is to be able to work in her field of studies. She loves to go to the Community Bank meetings and meetings with other Community Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, oil, sausages, soft drinks, mayonaise, mustard, etc.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
“Love your work to make you succeed” is the quotation shared by Salvador N. Jr. who resides in Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to financial difficulties, he was not able to pursue his studies in college. He helps his parents earn a living for their survival.

Salvador is married to Jocelyne N. and they are blessed with two children who are presently studying in the secondary and elementary levels of education. Salvador and his wife help each other to earn an income to support the studies of their children because they want them to become successful in the future.

The couple cultivates their parcel of farmland twice a year by planting rice and vegetable crops. Since they have inadequate capital, Salvador is requesting additional farming capital of PHP 18,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of their crop production. He wishes to generate support from the lenders and promises to pay back the loan at the right time.

Salvador works hard on the farm and he is patiently supporting his family through his farming. He also hopes to give his family a progressive standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen A. lives in Kenya. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a welder. Hellen has a tailoring shop where she specializes in making school dresses. She has requested  kshs 20 000 to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 49 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años tiene una tienda donde vende hierbas aromáticas, como la hoja de coca, pero también ofrece otro tipo de artículos y productos comestibles. Su puesto está dentro del mercado de su localidad y atiende durante todo el día, todos los días, pero los fines de semana se toma un momento al medio día para ir a su casa a alimentar a los animales que cría. Julia trabaja con mucho esmero y fe en su negocio, para el futuro su deseo es mejorar sus ventas incrementando la cantidad de mercadería que ofrece.
Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal, el cual tiene como nombre “Chamblachaca”. En esta oportunidad el dinero que esta solicitando será para invertirlos en la compra de mas mercadería en coca, velas y demás artículos para su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase khaki fabric in order to tailor clothes for resale.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is a 35-year-old married mother of five children aged between 3 and 18 years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Specioza owns a one-roomed house where she lives with eight people. The family has access to both electricity and piped water.

Specioza sells chickens and eggs to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and, on average, receives ten customers a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying chicken feed at Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She has been in this business for seven years and with Kiva partner MCDT for five years. She is now servicing her twentieth loan. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her children and food for her family.

Specioza wants to use this loan to buy more chicks and sacks of chicken feed. She aspires to see her business grow bigger, to start selling wholesale only, and to own 5,000 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 29 years old, married to Mr. A. and they both live in the Delta State. She learned hair dressing in order to empower herself and assist her siblings to make a better living in the future.  Beatrice now owns a hair dressing saloon and she want to add the sales sells of sarongs in ordern other to increase her profits. She is requesting for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase sarongs to sell.  She hopes for a big business in future.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea P. was born in 1983.  She now lives in Chung Ankor village in Takeo province, where she resells mats. Her husband, Mr. En Kloem (shown at left), is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice.  Mrs. Phea P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline, as well as buying more mats to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's standard of living as a result of this loan. This couple has two children.  One attends the local school, the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, gasoline, and more mats to resell.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 38-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their child. Ayman has owned and operated a mini-market since 2007 where he sells canned food, candies, beverages, home cleaning products, shampoos, toys and lots more.

Ayman requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his mini-market so as to expand his stock. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Ayman is speciA. in his work because his business is well located and, more importantly, you can find all you want in his market. He does his best to suit his clients’ demands and offers them the best. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists.

When he first started his business, Ayman didn’t have a lot of clients because he wasn’t known by the public, but he knew how to improve his networking. He decided on doing his business because that is what he always wanted to do since his youngest age.

In the future, Ayman plans on improving his business by always having the best materials for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his mini-market

loans.name: Nerry

texts.en:
Nerry F., 52, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Primitivo Fontanillia, a construction cutter, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing their own computer shop, while selling ready-to-wear garments and bed sheets on the side.

Nerry has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative.

Nerry is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy things that her businesses need. Her three businesses let her earn a net profit of PHP 4,700 per month.

Now, with your help, Nerry would like to obtain a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding businesses by buying computer-related equipment plus clothes for her ready-to-wear business.

Nerry dreams that her businesses will grow and that someday she can have a shop in a mall to attract more customers and generate more income.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment plus clothes for her ready-to-wear business

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Mrs. Saron N., a resident of Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province, is a 46-year-old farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land upon which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Orouk Choun, is a fisherman. The rice field is currently infertile, far from the irrigation system, and is beset with many insects, so Mrs. Saron N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, fuel, and pesticide, and to hire laborers to plow the field. This couple has four children, two of whom are waitresses, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fuel, pesticide

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nancy C. de 23 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Su esposo es chofer profesional, con el tiene 2 hijos.

Ella empezó vendiendo en un mercado verduras. Cuando obtuvo ingresos suficientes puso un pequeño local para vender granos y víveres. 

Tiene ya 8 años con la tienda de granos, arroz y otros víveres. Trabaja con la ayuda de su mama todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00. El Mani lo vende libra a $ 1.5, Garbanzo por libra a $ 1.3, Mate la libra a $ 0.50. Uno de los inconvenientes es la competencia que tiene.

Con el préstamo quiere granos, aceites, shampoo para su negocio. Uno de sus sueños es tener mas locales de venta de granos con empleados.
texts.en:
Nancy C. is 23 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil in a cement home with basic water and electric service. Her husband is a professional chauffeur, and they have two children. Nancy started out selling vegetables at a market, and when she had sufficient funds she set up a small store to sell grains and other provisions, and she now has eight years of experience in the business. She works with the help of her mother every day from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m., selling peanuts at a $1.50 a pound, garbanzo beans at $1.30 a pound and maté at $.50 a pound. One of the inconveniences is the amount of competition she has. With the loan, she plans to purchase grains, oils and shampoo for her business. One of her dreams is to have more stores to sell grains with employees.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, oils and shampoo

loans.name: Peter Mbugua

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married father of three children who are all in school. Peter sells CDs and DVDs around town, earning a total profit of KES 12,500 per month. He sells to residents in the Mwiki and Kasarani areas, which are densely populated with people of middle income.  He was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is his first loan with KADET. He has no previous credit history.  He plans to but more inventory and also to open a store.  He hopes to grow his business and open a big music store. He also has plans to buy a motorbike to operate as a taxi business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Damien

texts.en:
Damien is 35 years old and is married with two children who are 2 and 6 years old. He also takes care of two relatives who are 12 and 16 years old.

Damien is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of goods as his photo indicates. Among those goods, are included cosmetics products like body lotion, Colgate (toothpaste) and foodstuffs like rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. His shop is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Damien is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of sugar and rice, as they are highly in demand. With this large quantity he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, Damien hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow him to renovate his house and continue paying school fees for his two relatives as well as building a secure future for his two children.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en: Ashura I. is a small businesswoman and married. She runs a business selling traditional clothes ( Vitenge and Khanga ) at Yombo Buza  ward in Dar es Salaam.She purchases the business goods direct from the wholesale shops at Mnazi Mmoja traditional-clothes shopping center. She opened another business selling powdered soap to customers. She purchases it wholesale and packages it in retail form. She manages to meet her family's daily needs from the business income and business capitalization. She needs a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita O. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Pablita owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Pablita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, es una mujer luchadora y optimista, tiene 35 años, convive en su casa de su madre con Hilar de 38 años, juntos trabajan con mucho tesón para que su único Miguel de 11 años no le falte nada. Hace más de 20 años trabaja para brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su único hijo, por ello, durante el día vende helados y en las noches vende golosinas en pequeño puesto de venta, y lo hace de manera ambulante; mientras que su pareja labora como chofer de un moto taxi, vehículo que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. Con los ingresos que perciben ambos pueden cubrir los gastos domiciliarios y la educación de su hijo, asimismo están ahorrando para más adelante poder disponer del dinero en algún proyecto, como el de construir su vivienda propia, asimismo comprar otro moto carro que les genere mayores utilidades. Lo que más le gusta es atender a sus clientes de manera esmerada, sin embargo le desagrada tener que comercializar hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que le resulta cansado, pero vale la pena por que este negocio le es muy rentable y le hace vivir sin preocupaciones económicas. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de trabajar con su grupo comunal, donde recibe charlas educativas que le ayuda a disponer de manera adecuada el crédito que obtiene. Con los tres mil soles  que solicita, comprará otra moto carro, para alquilarlo a diario,  donde asegura que recibirá beneficios económicos.
texts.en:
Carmen, a fighter and an optimist, is 35 years old and lives in her mother's house with Hilar who is 38. Together they work with great determination so their only son, Miguel, will lack nothing. For more than 20 years she has worked to provide a good quality of life to her only son. To that end she sells ice cream during the day and sweets in the evenings from a small sales location and while walking around. Her partner works as a motorcycle taxi driver, using a vehicle he bought through a lot of effort. With the income they both earn they are able to cover the household expenses and the education of their son. At the same time they are saving for the future so they can use the money in a project such as building their own house or to buy another moto-vehicle that would help them earn greater income. What Carmen likes the most is attending to her clients in a careful manner. However, it bothers her to have to work until the late hours of the night, which is tiring, even though it is worth the effort since the business is profitable and allows them to live without economic worries. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy working with her communal group where she receives educational talks that help her carefully use the loans she receives. With this request for 3000 soles she will buy another moto-vehicle and rent it daily, which will assure them of benefiting economically.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a moto-vehicle

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: Née en 1964 au Bénin, D. Anne-Marie est mariée à HOUNGBEME Simon et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Anne-Marie vit avec sa famille au quartier Senadé à Cotonou capital économique du Bénin, depuis dix ans. Anne-Marie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Anne-Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Anne-Marie achète des cartons de pommes fruits auprès des grossistes importateurs du Bénin  pour revendre en détails à Sèmè non loin de la frontière nigériane. Face à la demande de plus en plus existante de sa clientèle, Anne-Marie  voudrait augmenter son stock de produits afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé après que les trois derniers aient été remboursés dans de meilleures conditions. Anne-Marie ambitionne plus tard acquérir une parcelle pour y vivre avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Benin, Anne-Marie D. is married to Simon HOUNGBEME and is the mother of three children, all attending (or having attended) school. For the past ten years she has lived with her family in the Senadé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She helps her husband and they jointly deal with different family expenses. Anne-Marie has not attended school. About 15 years ago she started buying crates of apples from Benin’s wholesale importers, to resell them retail in Sèmè, not far from the Nigerian border. Facing increasing demands from her customers, she would like to increase her stock of supplies to increase customer satisfaction. This is why she is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, having fully repaid the three preceding ones. Anne-Marie has the ambition of buying a plot of land in the future, to live there with her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy apples

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her aging father. 

Sauda owns a store from which she sells charcoal to all categories of people on both a retail and a wholesale basis.  She has been in this business for three years.  

She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t incur any transport costs because she takes the bus to and from her place of work. 

Her business challenges includes defaulters and the rainy season because she works from an open place.  She is hoping to go directly to villages for charcoal in the future. 

She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital.  She rents a two-room house but the family has no access to electricity or piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J.  (pictured at right in the yellow gown) currently washes and irons clothes in a laundry shop.  She is requesting a loan to stock more washing powder and soap.  Mary is 39 years old and is married.  Her husband is a farm laborer. The couple has 3 children, who all attend school.  With the extra profits resulting from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more washing powder and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of chili peppers

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en: Jeneth B. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 42 years old and is married with two adult children. Jeneth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jeneth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Jeneth plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tiessiri 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri 1 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le sésame, le pois de terre, l’arachide et le haricot. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  DJELIKA D., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre  pour entretenir environs 1,8 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice 70.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri 1 group is made up of ten married women who average 40 years of age and have four children each. They live in polygamous families in Madoudiarrabougou, one of the villages in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of better organising their winter activities. They grow among other things pearl millett, sesame, peas, peanuts and beans. They are on their third farming loan and the previous loans have been repaid in full. With this new loan, Djelika Dembelle, the president of the group, is planning on buying intrants and small materials as well as paying the labor costs of maintaining around 1.8 hectares of pearl millet and peanuts. The produce is sold in the towns of Dioïla and Massiqui after the harvests to a customer base made up of men and women. They are counting on making a profit of 70.000FCFA at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, sowing, fertilizers, weedkillers, hoeing and small equipment

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn L. lives in the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old, married and has six school-aged children. She makes a living by buying and selling bananas. She has been in this line of work for more than five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 6,000 PHP, to expand her business.  

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a small banana-selling business

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married with two teen age children. She owns a small business selling clothing at Pavlpgrad open market. She started this business 16 years ago. Hard work and entrepreneurial skills helps Nadiya to develop her business. Today it is a family business that has two locations and brings a stable income to Nadiya's family.

Nadiya broke her leg recently. Her family was able to substitute for her and continue the business. Now Nadiya is back and working hard as usual.

This business is very competitive. Nadiya needs to have a good assortment of clothing the clients can choose from. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase assortment of seasonal clothing - coats, sweters, and jackets.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: We Heart Dae Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Aye L. is the leader of this group. She was born in Mabonto village, near Magubraka town. She is fifty years old, married and has seven children. Her husband is a teacher and five of  her children are attending schools – one in college and four in primary school. 

Aye sells palm oil, rice, groundnuts, and peppers. She has been doing business for twenty-five years now. She will use her share of this loan to increase the size and quality of her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy palm oil, rice, groundnuts, and peppers to increase the size of her business inventory

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr: D. est une un homme marié, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de gbodjome qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. il exerce comme activité la vente des produits de mercerie dans sa propre boutique. les fêtes de fin d'année approchent et il constate une hausse de la demande de sa clientèle; il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock d'articles de mercerie et bien satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: D. is a married man, who lives with his family in Gbodjome, a suburb of the city of Lome. He sells haberdashery items in his own store. As the holiday season is getting near, he is facing an increasing demand. For this reason he requests a loan from WAGES, in order to improve his stock with more products and be able to respond to his customers demand.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: G.s. Barrio Nuevo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Barrio Nuevo está conformado por Máximo de 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. El señor se dedica a la venta de cerdos, pues es su principal fuente de ingresos, ya que es muy importante para él pues su principal medio de vida. Cabe señalar que el señor ya tiene 4 años de estarse dedicando a esta actividad, la cual surgió en principio con fondos propios y de allí fue que el continuo con el trabajo, ya al tener capital de trabajo. Algo que aduce el señor, es que en Nicaragua no hay trabajo, por ello es que uno se tiene que dedicar a algo honesto para ganarse la vida. Otra integrante del grupo es la Señora Gladys, la cual tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella ya tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual lo aprendió de su mama ya que ella la enseño a cocinar y ganarse el pan de cada día. Es por eso que el crédito estará destinado para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The Barrio Nuevo solidarity group is represented by Máximo.  Máximo is 50 years old, married with 2 children.  He sells pigs as his primary source of income and principle means of earning a living.  It should be pointed out that he has dedicated himself to this activity for the past 4 years.   For the most part, he began the business with his own funds, and from there, continued to work until he had working capital.  As he explains, in Nicaragua there is no work, and for this reason, one must dedicate oneself to something honest in order to survive.  

Mrs. Gladys is another member of the group.  She is 57 years old, married and has two young children.  She sells food in order to earn a living.  She has been working at this business for the past 15 years.  It was her mother who taught her how to cook and earn her daily bread.  Her loan will be used to buy basic materials.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Dulce Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Dulce, porque varias D. sus integrantes vendían dulces. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  12  integrantes.
L. señora Rocio Montaño es L. presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudió hasta L. Primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos: 2 mujeres y 2 varones.  ElL. se dedica a L. Venta D. Artesanias (Servilletas Bordadas) y Cortinas para carros, negocio que inició hace 6 años, con unicamente  3 metros D. teL. y 10 varillas, no sabía coser ni bordar pero era tanta L. necesidad D. iniciar algún negocio para poder mantener a su familia, ya que su esposo se había quedado sin trabajo, D. modo que le pidio a una vecina que le enseñara a bordar y coser a máquina, para lo cual tenía que pagarle con trabajo en su casa lavando su ropa y ayudandole a su quehacer y sólo le enseñaba 45 minutos ya que el esposo D. su vecina se molestaba si L. encontraba en su casa y apesar D. los malos tratos que recibió por aprender , alfin D. algunas semanas aprendió lo que elL. necesitaba para poder emprender su negocio y ya no son tres metros D. teL. ni diez varillas ahora son Rollos D. TeL. y más D. Cien kilos D. varillas. Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar más máquinas D. coser y poder  emplear a vecinos D. su comunidad para que ya no salgan a otros Estados y se queden en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Dulce' (Sweet) because several of its members sell sweet treats.  The group is located in the State of Mexico.  It has 12 members.

Rocio Montaño is the group's president.  She is 26 years old and studied at elementary level.  She is a saleswoman and has 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys.  Rocio sells handicrafts (embroidered napkins) and curtains for cars.  She started this business 6 years ago with only 3 meters of cloth and 10 rods.  She didn't know how to sew or embroider but she really needed to start a business which could support her family since her husband didn't have a job so she asked a neighbor to teach her to embroider and use a sewing machine.  She paid for these lessons by doing work in the neighbor's house such as washing her clothes and helping her with her housework.  She only received 45 minutes worth of instruction at a time though as her neighbor's husband got annoyed if he found her in his house.

However, in spite of the bad treatment which she received in learning her traD., after a couple of weeks she had learned all she needed to in order to set up her business and now she no longer has just 3 meters of fabric and 10 rods but rolls of fabric and more than 100 kg of rods.  She is requesting this loan to be able to buy more sewing machines and employ neighbors from her community so that they don't have to go to other states and can stay in their community.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia B. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  Asia has a business of selling timber, which she has had for seven years.  She is also a teacher.

To help expand her business, Asia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase timber materials.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Asia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Asia hopes to own a hardware shop. Asia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase timber materials

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
